requestBody.description:
# group.lock_settings_updated

The **Group's lock settings updated** event is triggered every time a [group's lock settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204519819-Managing-user-groups-and-settings) are updated. Group lock settings can be updated by an account owner or a user.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The "**Group's lock settings updated**" subscription enabled under the **Group** event.



**Event type**: `group.lock_settings_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that updated the group's settings.

operator.description: The email address of the user that updated the group's settings.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that updated the group's settings.

object.description: Information about the group's updated settings.

toll_free_and_fee_based_toll_call.description: Whether the group has the [**Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060950711-Enabling-Toll-free-and-Fee-based-Toll-Call) setting enabled.

alternative_host_reminder.description: Whether alternative hosts receive an email when they are added or removed to a meeting.

cancel_meeting_reminder.description: Whether meeting participants and hosts receive a notification when the meeting is canceled.

cloud_recording_available_reminder.description: Whether the host is notified when a cloud recording is available.

jbh_reminder.description: Whether the host is notified when participants join the meeting before them.

schedule_for_reminder.description: Whether the host is notified if a meeting is scheduled, rescheduled, or canceled.

alert_guest_join.description: Whether participants that belong to your account can see that a guest (someone who does not belong to your account) is participating in the meeting.

allow_users_to_delete_messages_in_meetin.description: If the value of this field is set to true,  allow users to delete messages in the in-meeting chat.

allow_show_zoom_windows.description: Whether Zoom windows display screen share.

annotation.description: Whether meeting participants can use annotation tools to add information to shared screens.

auto_answer.description: Whether users can view and add contacts to the [**Auto-answer group in chat**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203736135-Auto-answering-invitations-to-meetings) feature. Calls from members of the **Auto Answer Group** will be automatically answered the user.

auto_generated_captions.description: Whether live transcription services are available to transcribe meetings.

auto_saving_chat.description: Whether all in-meeting chats are automatically saved.

breakout_room.description: Whether hosts can split meeting participants into [breakout rooms](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206476093-Enabling-breakout-rooms).

chat.description: Whether meeting participants can send chat messages that are visible to all participants.

closed_caption.description: Whether the host can type closed captions or assign a participant/third party device to add closed captions.

co_host.description: Whether the host can add co-hosts. Co-hosts have the same in-meeting controls as the host.

custom_data_center_regions.description: Whether to display the custom [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042411451-Selecting-data-center-regions-for-hosted-meetings-and-webinars) selected for meetings hosted by this group.

disable_screen_sharing_for_host_meetings.description: Whether the [**Disable desktop screen sharing for meetings you host**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037710871-Disabling-desktop-screen-sharing-in-meetings) setting is enabled.

disable_screen_sharing_for_in_meeting_gu.description: Whether the **Disable screen sharing when guests are in the meeting** setting is enabled.

e2e_encryption.description: Whether all meetings are required to use [End-to-end (E2EE) encryption](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360048660871-End-to-end-E2EE-encryption-for-meetings).

entry_exit_chime.description: Whether a chime plays when participants join or leave the meeting.

far_end_camera_control.description: Whether other users are allowed to take control of the camera during a meeting.

feedback.description: Whether users can provide feedback to Zoom at the end of the meeting.

file_transfer.description: Whether the in-meeting [**Send files via meeting chat**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/209605493-In-meeting-file-transfer) setting is enabled.

full_transcript.description: Whether to enable the viewing of full transcripts in the in-meeting side panel.

group_hd.description: Whether a higher quality video for host and participants is enabled. This will require more bandwidth.

language_interpretation.description: Whether hosts can assign participants as interpreters who can interpret one language into another in real-time.

sign_language_interpretation.description: Allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into sign language in real-time. Hosts can assign interpreters when scheduling, or during the meeting itself. This feature is only available with version 5.11.3 or later.

manual_captions.description: Whether hosts can type closed captions or assign a participant/third party device to add closed captions.

meeting_reactions.description: Whether meeting participants can [communicate using the emoji reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions) located in the **Reactions** menu in the meeting toolbar.

webinar_reactions.description: Set this field to true to use [webinar reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4803536268429).

meeting_survey.description: Whether the host can present a survey to participants once a meeting has ended. This feature is only available in version 5.7.3 or higher.

non_verbal_feedback.description: Whether meeting participants can provide nonverbal feedback and express opinions by clicking on icons in the **Participants** panel.

original_audio.description: Whether users can toggle the [**Use Original Audio**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115003279466-Using-and-preserving-original-sound-in-a-meeting) setting during a meeting.

polling.description: Whether the [**Polls**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4412324684685) feature is included in the meeting controls. This allows the host to survey the attendees.

post_meeting_feedback.description: Whether an [post-meeting feedback survey](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4404969060621-Post-meeting-survey-and-reporting) is enabled for the end of each meeting.

private_chat.description: Whether meeting participants can send private 1:1 chat message other meeting participants.

remote_control.description: During screen sharing, whether the person who is presenting can let others control the shared content.

remote_support.description: Whether the meeting host can provide 1:1 remote support to another participant.

request_permission_to_unmute.description: Whether the [**Request permission to unmute participants**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203435537-Muting-and-unmuting-participants-in-a-meeting#h_01EGK4XFWS1SJGZ71MYGKF7260) setting is enabled.

save_caption.description: Whether participants can save closed captions or transcripts.

save_captions.description: Whether participants can save closed captions or transcripts.

screen_sharing.description: Whether hosts and participants can share their screen or content during meetings.

sending_default_email_invites.description: Whether users can invite participants by email only by default.

show_a_join_from_your_browser_link.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their browser and bypass the Zoom application download process. This is useful for participants who cannot download, install, or run applications. Note that the meeting experience from the browser is limited.

show_browser_join_link.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their browser.

show_meeting_control_toolbar.description: Whether to always display the meeting controls toolbar during a meeting.

slide_control.description: Whether the person sharing during a presentation can allow others to control the slide presentation. This feature is only available in version 5.8.3 or higher.

stereo_audio.description: Whether users can select stereo audio during a meeting.

use_html_format_email.description: Whether HTML formatting is allowed for meeting invitations scheduled with the Outlook plugin.

waiting_room.description: Whether participants cannot join a meeting until the host admits them from the waiting room.

webinar_chat.description: Whether webinar participants can send chat messages.

webinar_polling.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a webinar.

webinar_question_answer.description: Whether attendees can ask the host and panelists questions in the webinar.

meeting_question_answer.description: Allow participants to ask questions for the host and participants to answer.

webinar_survey.description: Whether the host can present surveys to attendees once a webinar has ended.

whiteboard.description: Whether participants can share a whiteboard that includes annotation tools.

blur_snapshot.description: Whether iOS blurs screenshots in the task switcher when multiple apps are open. Android hides the screenshot in the system-level list of recent apps.

account_user_access_recording.description: Whether cloud recordings are accessible to account members.

auto_delete_cmr.description: Whether Zoom automatically deletes recordings permanently after a specified number of days.

auto_recording.description: Whether meetings are automatically recorded when they begin.

cloud_recording.description: Whether hosts can record and save the meetings and webinars in the cloud.

cloud_recording_download.description: Whether anyone with a link to the cloud recording can download the file.

host_delete_cloud_recording.description: Whether the host can delete cloud recordings. If false, only the admin can delete cloud recordings.

ip_address_access_control.description: Whether cloud recording access is only available for a specific range of IP addresses.

local_recording.description: Whether hosts and participants can record meetings to a local file.

prevent_host_access_recording.description: Whether hosts can access and view their meetings' cloud recordings.

recording_authentication.description: Whether only authenticated users can view cloud recordings.

archive.description: [Archiving solution](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360050431572-Archiving-Meeting-and-Webinar-data) settings. This setting can only be used if you have been granted archiving solution access by the Zoom support team.

audio_type.description: Whether participants can join only the audio portion of meetings.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: Whether the meeting password is encrypted and included in the meeting links that allow participants to join with just one click without having to enter the password.

force_pmi_jbh_password.description: Whether passwords are required to join before the host in personal meetings.

host_video.description: Whether host video defaults to on when they join meetings.

join_before_host.description: Whether participants can join meetings before the host.

meeting_authentication.description: Whether only authenticated users can join meetings.

mute_upon_entry.description: Whether all participants are automatically muted when they join meetings.

participant_video.description: Whether participant video defaults to on when they join meetings.

pstn_password_protected.description: Whether new passwords are generated and sent for newly-scheduled or edited meetings.

require_password_for_instant_meetings.description: Whether passwords are required for instant meetings. If you use a PMI for instant meetings, this is disabled.

require_password_for_pmi_meetings.description: Whether participants are required to enter a password for PMI meetings.

require_password_for_scheduling_new_meet.description: Whether a password is generated when a meeting host schedules a new meeting. All participants must enter the password before they can join the meeting. This only applies to meetings that do not use a PMI.

upcoming_meeting_reminder.description: Whether desktop notifications for upcoming meetings is enabled.

telephony_regions.description: Whether telephony regions are enabled for meetings.

third_party_audio.description: Whether users can join meetings using the existing third party audio configurations.

approved_or_denied_countries_or_regions.description: Whether the [**Approve or block entry for users from specific countries/regions**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060086231-Joining-from-specific-countries-regions) setting is enabled.

auto_security.description: Whether all meetings must be secured with at least one security option. This setting can only be disabled by Enterprise, ISV, Business (with more than 100 licenses), and Education accounts.

block_user_domain.description: Whether users in specific domains are blocked from joining meetings and webinars.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: Whether the meeting password is encrypted and included in the invitation link. The provided link will allow participants to join the meeting without having to enter the password.

encryption_type.description:
The type of encryption used when starting a meeting: 
* enhanced_encryption — Enhanced encryption. Encryption data is stored in the cloud. 
* e2ee — End-to-end encryption. The encryption key is stored on the local device and cannot be obtained by anyone else. Enabling E2EE also [**disables** certain features](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360048660871), such as cloud recording, live streaming, and allowing participants to join before the host.

end_to_end_encrypted_meetings.description: Whether end-to-end encryption is enabled for meetings.

meeting_password.description: Whether all instant and scheduled meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected. [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937) meetings are **not** included in this setting.

only_authenticated_can_join_from_webclie.description: Whether only authenticated users can join meetings from the web client.

phone_password.description:
Whether passwords are required for participants joining by phone. 

 If this setting is enabled and the meeting is password-protected, a numeric password is required for participants to join by phone. For meetings with alphanumeric passwords, a numeric password will be generated.

pmi_password.description: Whether all Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected.

waiting_room.description:
Whether participants are placed in the [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) when they join a meeting. 

 If the **Waiting Room** feature is enabled, the [**Allow participants to join before host**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202828525-Allow-participants-to-join-before-host) setting is automatically disabled.

webinar_password.description: Whether a password is generated when scheduling webinars. Participants must use the password to join the scheduled webinar.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the group's settings were updated, in milliseconds.

old_object.description: Information about the group's previous settings.

settings.description: Information about the group's updated settings. This only returns modified settings.

$changed_field_name.description: The modified field its original value.

requestBody.description:
# group.admin_deleted

The **Group admin deleted** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users delete a group admin. Group admins can be deleted in the [Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204519819-Managing-user-groups-and-settings) or via the [**Delete group admins**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/groupAdminsDelete) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Group admin deleted** subscription enabled under the **Group** event.



**Event type**: `group.admin_deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The group's account ID.

operator.description: The email address of the user that removed the admin from the group.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that removed the admin from the group.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the group's admin were deleted, in milliseconds.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_jbh_waiting

The **Participant waiting for host to join** event is triggered every time an attendee is waiting for the host to join the meeting. The host of the meeting must be a user in your account or users in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

When scheduling a meeting, the organizer or host of the meeting can enable the **Enable join before host** option. This allows attendees to join the meeting before the host of the meeting arrives. This meeting also starts as soon as the first meeting participant joins.

If this option is **disabled**, participants are prompted to wait for the host to arrive before joining the meeting.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* The **Enable join before host** option **disabled** for the scheduled meeting.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant waiting for host to join** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_jbh_waiting`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

requestBody.description:
# user.deleted

The **User has been deleted** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users is deleted from the account.

Admins and account owners can delete users in a Zoom account. Deleting users permanently removes them and their data from the Zoom system.
To delete a user, use the [**Delete a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userDelete) with `delete` as the value for `action` query parameter or [delete the user from the Zoom Web Portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269946-Remove-User-from-your-Account#h_7402c643-23d1-48f7-8cf3-efefdb678a88) itself.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscription** must be enabled for your [Marketplace App](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **User has been deleted** subscription must be enabled under the **User** event.



**Event type**: `user.deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account from which the user was deleted.

operator.description: The email address of the user that deleted the user.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that deleted the user.

type.description:
The type of user: 
* 1 — Basic. 
* 2 — Licensed.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_left_breakout_room

The **Meeting participant has left a breakout room** event is triggered when a meeting participant leaves a meeting [breakout room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005769646-Participating-in-breakout-rooms).

Breakout rooms are sessions that are split off from the main Zoom meeting. They allow the participants to meet in smaller groups and are completely isolated in terms of audio and video from the main session.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting participant has left a breakout room** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_left_breakout_room`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The main meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

breakout_room_uuid.description: The breakout room's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each breakout room instance generates a breakout room UUID.

host_id.description: The main meeting host's user ID.

type.description:
The main meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

parent_user_id.description: The participant's main meeting user ID (user_id).

id.description:
The participant's unique ID. 
* If meeting registration was **not** required and the participant joined by logging into Zoom, this value is the same as the userId field used in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API. 
* If registration was required for the meeting and the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the same as the id value in the [**List meeting registrants**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrants) API response. 
* If participant joins without logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value. 

**Note:** Use the participant_user_id value instead of this value. We will remove this response in a future release.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

leave_time.description: The time at which the participant left the meeting.

leave_reason.description: The reason why the participant left the meeting.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's unique ID. 
* If meeting registration was **not** required and the participant joined by logging into Zoom, this value is the same as the userId field used in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API. 
* If registration was required for the meeting and the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the same as the id value in the [**List meeting registrants**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrants) API response. 
* If participant joins without logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

participant.leave_reason:
Jill Chill left the meeting.
Reason: Host ended the meeting.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.device_tested

The **Meeting Device Tested** event is triggered every time a user completes a [connected device test](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362283-Testing-computer-or-device-audio).

When a user joins a meeting, they choose to test their connected camera, microphone, and speaker devices. The Zoom client performs a test for the selected device and prompts a user to confirm whether the device works.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Device Tested** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.device_tested`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

test_result.description: Information about the meeting's device test results.

camera_status.description:
The camera's status: 
* 2 — Device working. 
* 1 — Device not working. 
* 0 — Device not tested.

speaker_status.description:
The speaker's status: 
* 2 — Device working. 
* 1 — Device not working. 
* 0 — Device not tested.

microphone_status.description:
The microphone's status: 
* 2 — Device working. 
* 1 — Device not working. 
* 0 — Device not tested.

requestBody.description:
# account.plan_added

The **Account has subscribed to an add-on plan** event occurs when an account with an existing plan(s) subscribes to an add-on plan.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* The **Account has subscribed to an add-on plan** subscription enabled under the **Billing** event category.



**Event type**: `account.plan_added`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description:
The user's account ID: 
* For regular Zoom accounts, this value is the ID of the account that the [add-on plan](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#additional-plans) was subscribed to. 
* For reseller partner accounts, this value is the ID of the Master account that subscribed the sub account's add-on plan.

operator.description: The email address of the user who added the account's plan subscription.

object.description: Information about the updated account's plan.

id.description:
The updated account's ID: 
* For regular Zoom accounts, this value is the ID of the account that the add-on plan was subscribed to. 
* For reseller partner accounts, this value is the ID of the Master account that subscribed the sub account's to the add-on plan.

plan_type.description: The plan subscription. This always returns the addon value.

type.description: The [type](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#additional-plans) of add-on plan.

requestBody.description:
# account.created

The **Sub Account has been created** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users creates a sub account.

A Master account administrator or an account owner can create sub accounts under the Master account. A sub account can be created either by using the [**Create a Sub Account**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/accountCreate) API or by logging into the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us) and navigating to the [**Add Sub Account**](https://zoom.us/account/sub/add) page.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher [plan](https://zoom.us/pricing) with the **Master account** option enabled.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
  * A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
  * The **Sub Account has been created** subscription enabled under the **Account** event.



**Event type**: `account.created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account's owner.

operator.description: The email address of the user who created the account.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who created the account.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.deleted

The **Webinar has been deleted** event is triggered every time a webinar scheduled by one of your app users or account users, is deleted.

A webinar host or a user with admin privileges can delete a scheduled webinar. Users can delete a webinar using the **Delete** feature for a webinar, from the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/webinar/list) or the Zoom Client App. Alternatively, users can use the [**Delete a webinar**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/webinarDelete) API to delete webinars programmatically.

## **Prerequisites**:
* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Webinar has been deleted** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who deleted the webinar.

operator.description: The email address of the user who deleted the webinar.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who deleted the webinar.

operation.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all webinars. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinars with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

requestBody.description:
# recording.registration_approved

The **View registrant has approved for this recording** event is triggered every time a registrant is approved to view a cloud recording.

[Cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording) of Zoom meetings and webinars can be made [on-demand](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488283-On-demand-Recordings). With on-demand recordings, users can view the recordings of past meetings and webinars at any time as long as they have not been removed. To view these recordings, users can register manually by filling out the registration form that pops up when users click on the **Recording URL**. After the registration, registrants that are approved will be able to view the recording.

An account owner, a host of the meeting/webinar or a user with admin privileges can customize the cloud recording [registration approval settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488283-On-demand-Recordings). If the **Automatically Approve** setting is enabled, registrants can view the recording automatically after a successful registration. If the **Manually Approve** setting is enabled, the registrants must be manually approved before they can view the recording.

Registrants can also be approved programmatically using the [**Update registrant status**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/meetingRecordingRegistrantStatus) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* The [approval setting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488283-On-demand-Recordings) for the cloud recording registration must be set to **Manually Approve**.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **View registrant has approved for this recording** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.registration_approved`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the host that recorded the meeting or webinar.

operator.description: The email address of the user that approved registration for the meeting or webinar recording.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that approved registration for the meeting or webinar recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

# meeting.risk_alert

The **At-Risk Meeting Notifier** event is triggered every time someone posts a Zoom meeting link to a social media account, such as Reddit or Twitter. The webhook sends the event to an authorized [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#oauth-app).

The [**At-Risk Meeting Notifier (ARMN)**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360052087972-At-Risk-Meeting-Notifier) scans public posts on social media sites and other public online resources for Zoom meeting links. When it finds publicly-posted meeting information indicating that a given meeting may be at high risk of being disrupted, Zoom notifies account owners and admins via email.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **At-Risk Meeting Notifier** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.risk_alert`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

armn_details.description: Information about the at-risk meeting notifier (ARMN).

post_platform.description: The post's social media platform. For example, Twitter, Reddit, or Facebook.

social_link.description: The link to the social media post.

post_user.description: The user who created the social media post.

recommended_enable_settings.description:
A comma-separated list of the recommended settings to enable: 
* enablePassword 
* enableWaitingRoom 
* enableOnlyAuthenticated 
* enableRegistration 
* enableScreenShareLock 
* enableScreenShareHostOnly 
* enableSpecifiedDomain

recommended_disable_settings.description:
A comma-separated list of the recommended settings to disable: 
* enableAnnotation 
* enableMeetingChat 
* enableScreenShare 
* enableMultipleShare

# webinar.participant_feedback

The **Get participant survey feedback for webinars** event is triggered every time an attendee completes an end-of-webinar [feedback survey](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005855266-End-of-meeting-experience-feedback-survey) for a webinar. A webinar attendee is a webinar participant or the host.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Get participant survey feedback for webinars** subscription must be enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.participant_feedback`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who commit the feedback.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

feedback_details.description: The feedback details. This returns null if the satisfied field is true.

id.description:
The Id of the feedback: 
* 1 — Poor video quality. 
* 2 — Poor audio quality. 
* 5 — Unable to present using share.zoom.us. 
* 7 — Unable to make phone call. 
* 8 — They could not hear us. 
* 9 — We could not hear them. 
* 10 — They could not see us. 
* 11 — We could not see them. 
* 12 — Could not present computer screen.

comments.description: The participant's comments. This returns null if the satisfied field is true.

# meeting.participant_joined_waiting_room

The **Participant joined a waiting room** event is triggered every time an attendee joins a waiting room prior to being admitted to the meeting. The meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

The [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) feature allows the host to control when participants join a meeting. When a participant attempts to join a meeting with this feature enabled, the participant is first admitted to the Waiting Room.
The meeting host can then admit attendees one by one or hold all attendees in the waiting room and admit them all at once.

## Prerequisites

* The [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) feature enabled for the meeting.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant joined a waiting room** subscription must be enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_joined_waiting_room`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the main meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

participant.description: Information about the meeting participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, email returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

date_time.description: The time at which the participant joined the meeting.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

# account.plan_canceled

The **Plan has been canceled** event occurs when an account cancels the subscription of an existing base or add-on plan.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* The **Plan has been canceled** subscription enabled under the **Billing** event category.



**Event type**: `account.plan_canceled`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description:
The user's account ID: 
* For regular Zoom accounts, this value is the ID of the account for which the plan was canceled. 
* For reseller partner accounts, this value is the ID of the Master account that canceled the sub account's plan.

operator.description: The email address of the user who canceled the account's plan subscription.

object.description: Information about the updated account's plan.

id.description:
The updated account's ID: 
* For regular Zoom accounts, this value is the ID of the account for which the plan was canceled. 
* For reseller partner accounts, this value is the ID of the Master account that canceled the sub account's plan.

plan_type.description:

* addon — An [add-on plan](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#additional-plans).

requestBody.description:
# user.disassociated

The **User has been disassociated** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users is unlinked from an account.

Unlinking a user from an account allows them to maintain their own Zoom account with existing settings, meetings, webinars, and Cloud recordings. Users can be disassociated from a Zoom account [via the Zoom Web Portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269946-Remove-User-from-your-Account#h_98a81098-0ca3-45ae-8d00-aab235cc781d) or via the [**Delete a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userDelete) API with `disassociate` as the value of `action` query parameter.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **User has been disassociated** subscription must be enabled under the **User** event.



**Event type**: `user.disassociated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account from which the user was disassociated.

operator.description: The email address of the user that disassociated the user.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that disassociated the user.

type.description:
The type of user: 
* 1 — Basic. 
* 2 — Licensed.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_jbh_joined

The **Participant joined meeting before host** event is triggered every time an attendee joins a meeting before the host. The host of the meeting must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

When scheduling a meeting, the organizer or host of the meeting can enable the **Enable join before host** option. This allows attendees to join the meeting before the host of the meeting arrives. This meeting also starts as soon as the first meeting participant joins.

If this option is **disabled**, participants are prompted to wait for the host to arrive before joining the meeting.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* The **Enable join before host** option enabled for the scheduled meeting.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant joined meeting before host** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_jbh_joined`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

requestBody.description:
# recording.archive_files_completed

The **Recording Archive Files Completed** event is triggered every time the archived files of a meeting or webinar become available to download.

Zoom's [meeting and webinar archiving solution](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360050431572-Archiving-Meeting-and-Webinar-data) allows account administrators to set up an automated mechanism to collect and archive meeting data to a 3rd party platform of their choice. This helps to satisfy FINRA or other compliance requirements.

The archiving process begins once a meeting or webinar, hosted by an account that has enabled the archiving feature, begins. The archiving of the meeting data completes after a meeting or webinar ends.

This feature is **only** enabled upon request approval. Contact the [Zoom support team](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362003) for more information.

## Prerequisites

* The **Archiving** feature must be enabled on the user's account.
* Enable **Event Subscriptions** in your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with these configurations.
  * A valid Event notification endpoint URL.
  * The **Recording Archive Files Completed** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.archive_files_completed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp when the event occurred.

download_token.description:
Use the generated token value with the download_url value to download the cloud recording via an [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app). The download token only lasts for 24 hours after its creation, and you can only download the file within 24 hours of receiving the event notification. You can either include the download_token as a query parameter or pass it as a Bearer token in the Authorization header of your HTTP request. 

 **Using an Authorization header (Recommended)** 

 
curl --request GET \
  --url {download_url} \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {download_token} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
 

**Using a query parameter** 

 
{download_url}/?access_token={download_token}
 

 For example: https://zoom.us/recording/download/123456?access_token=abcdefgh

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who hosted the meeting or the webinar.

object.description: Information about the webinar or meeting recording.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance. Each meeting or webinar instance generates its own meeting UUID.

id.description: The ID of the meeting (meetingId) or the webinar (webinarId).

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the archived meeting or webinar.

type.description:
The type of archived meeting or webinar. 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 - Instant meeting. 
* 2 - Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 - A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 - A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 - A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 - A webinar. 
* 6 - A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 - A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 100 - A [breakout room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005769646-Participating-in-breakout-rooms).

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

duration_in_second.description: The meeting or webinar's duration, in seconds.

total_size.description: The total size of the archive file, in bytes.

recording_count.description: The number of archived files returned in the API call response.

meeting_type.description:
Whether the meeting or webinar is internal or external. 
* internal - An internal meeting or webinar. 
* external - An external meeting or webinar. 

 The id, host_id, and topic PII (Personal Identifiable Information) values in this response are removed when this value is external.

complete_time.description: The meeting or webinar's archive completion time.

parent_meeting_id.description: The parent meeting's universally unique ID (UUID). Each meeting or webinar instance generates its own meeting UUID. If the is_breakout_room value is true, the API returns this value.

file_type.description:
The archived file's type. 
* MP4 - Video file. 
* M4A - Audio-only file. 
* TRANSCRIPT - A transcription file, in VTT format. 
* CHAT - A TXT file containing in-meeting chat messages. 
* CC - A file containing the closed captions of the recording, in VTT file format. 
* CHAT_MESSAGE - A JSON file encoded in base64 format containing chat messages. The file also includes waiting room chats, deleted messages, meeting emojis and non-verbal feedback.

file_size.description: The archived file's size, in bytes.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the archived file. To download the archived file of a meeting or a webinar, use the download_token value included in the webhook as the access_token query parameter value and include this query parameter at the end of the URL. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/archive/download/xxx?access_token={{your-download_token-value}}

status.description:
The archived file's processing status. 
* completed - The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing - The file is processing.

recording_type.description:
The archive file's recording type. 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view 
* audio_only 
* chat_file 
* closed_caption 
* chat_message 

 For more information, read our [Managing and sharing cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Managing-and-sharing-cloud-recordings#h_9898497b-e736-4980-a749-d55608f10773) documentation.

individual.description:
Whether the recording file is an individual recording file: 
* true - An individual recording file. 
 * false - An entire meeting file.

participant_email.description: The individual recording file's participant email address. This value is returned when the individual value is true. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#email-address-display-rules) for details.

participant_join_time.description: The join time for the generated recording file. If this value is returned when the individual value is true, then it is the recording file's participant join time. When the individual value is false, it returns the join time for the archiving gateway.

participant_leave_time.description: The leave time for the generated recording file. If this value is returned when the individual value is true, then it is the recording file's participant leave time. When the individual value is false, it returns the leave time for the archiving gateway.

encryption_fingerprint.description: The archived file's encryption fingerprint, using the SHA256 hash algorithm.

number_of_messages.description: The number of TXT or JSON file messages. This field will return only when the file_extension is JSON or TXT

storage_location.description: The region where the file is stored. This field returns only Enable Distributed Compliance Archiving op feature is enabled.

status.description:
The archive's processing status: 
* completed - The archive's processing is complete. 
* processing - The archive is processing.

requestBody.description:
# user.presence_status_updated

The **User's presence status has been updated** event is triggered every time one of your app users' presence status is updated in the Zoom Client app.

Users that are signed in to Zoom can set their [presence status](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360032554051-Status-Icons) in the [Zoom Client apps](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207373866-Zoom-Installers) to either "Available", "Away" or "Do_Not_Disturb". By default, when a user signs in, the status is set to "Available". When a user is in a meeting, the status is set to "In_Meeting". When a user is sharing the screen during a meeting, the status is set to "Presenting". When the user is on a Zoom Phone call, the status is set to "On_Phone_Call". When the user is in a calendar event (from a synced calendar) but hasn't joined a Zoom meeting, the status is set to "In_Calendar_Event".

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **User's presence status has been updated** subscription must be enabled under the **User Activity** event.



**Event type**: `user.presence_status_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user's account owner.

date_time.description: The date and time at which the user's presence status was updated.

presence_status.description:
The user's [presence status](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360032554051-Setting-your-presence-status): 
* Available — Online. 
* Away — Away. 
* Do_Not_Disturb — Do not disturb. 
* In_Meeting — In a Zoom meeting. 
* Presenting — User is sharing their screen in a Zoom meeting. 
* On_Phone_Call — On a Zoom Phone call. 
* In_Calendar_Event — In a calendar event. 
* Offline

requestBody.description:
# meeting.alert

The **Meeting issues alert** event is triggered every time a service issue is encountered during a meeting scheduled by a user in your account or in accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

Zoom monitors [meeting statistics](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202920719-Meeting-Statistics) in regards to the quality of service for each meeting. The following quality metrics can trigger an alert:

* Unstable audio.
* Unstable video.
* Poor screen share quality.
* High CPU usage.
* Call reconnection problems.

## Prerequisites

* The account **must** hold a [Business or a higher plan](https://zoom.us/pricing) to request this feature,
* In account settings, the **Meeting quality scores and network alerts on Dashboard** option must be enabled on the dashboard.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
  * A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
  * The **Meeting issues alert** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.alert`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

issues.description:
A list of issues that occurred during the meeting: 
* Unstable audio quality 
* Unstable video quality 
* Unstable screen share quality 
* High CPU occupation 
* Call Reconnection

requestBody.description:
# meeting.deleted

The **Meeting has been deleted** event is triggered every time a meeting scheduled by one of your app users or account users, is deleted.

A meeting host or a user with admin privileges can delete a scheduled meeting. Users can delete a meeting manually using the **Delete** feature for a meeting via the [Zoom web portal](https://zoom.us) or the Zoom client. Users can also programmatically delete meetings via the [**Delete a Meeting**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingDelete) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting has been deleted** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who deleted the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who deleted the meeting.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who deleted the meeting.

operation.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all meetings. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_joined

The **Participant/Host joined meeting** event is triggered every time an attendee joins a meeting. A meeting attendee is a meeting participant or the host. The meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant/Host joined meeting** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_joined`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

participant.description: Information about the meeting participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, email returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value. 

**Note:** Use the participant_user_id value instead of this value. We will remove this response in a future release.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

join_time.description: The time at which the participant joined the meeting.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

customer_key.description: The participant's SDK identifier. This value can be alphanumeric.

requestBody.description:
# user.tsp_deleted

The **A user's TSP account was deleted** event is triggered every time a TSP user account is deleted.

Zoom allows certain carrier partners to provision Telephony Service Provider (TSP) audio to users. For users to use TSP audio, carrier partners must create a TSP user account with Zoom for the users. Zoom account owners and admins can [delete an existing TSP user account](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userTSPDelete).

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan with TSP Configurations enabled.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* The **A user's TSP account was deleted** subscription must be enabled under the **TSP** event.



**Event type**: `user.tsp_deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who deleted the TSP.

operator.description: The email address of the user who deleted the TSP.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who deleted the TSP.

tsp_credentials.description: Information about the deleted user's TSP credentials.

dial_in_numbers.description: Information about the TSP dial-in numbers.

type.description:
The type of the phone number: 
* toll — Toll number. 
* tollfree — Toll free number. 
* media_link — Media link.

country_label.description:
The TSP country label: 
* US_TSP_TB 
* EU_TSP_TB

requestBody.description:
# user.updated

The **User's profile info has been updated** event is triggered every time the profile of one of your app users or account users is updated.

Users, account admins, and account owners can update information on the user profile information. Profile updates can be made either by accessing the [profile on the Zoom client](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363203-My-Profile) and making edits or by calling the [**Update a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userUpdate) API.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscription** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event notification endpoint URL**
	* The **User's profile info has been updated** subscription must be enabled under the **User** event.



**Event type**: `user.updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that updated the user.

operator.description: The email address of the user that updated the user.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that updated the user.

operation.description:
This field only returns for the following operations: 
* change_password 
* sign_out_from_all_devices

type.description:
The type of user: 
* 1 — Basic. 
* 2 — Licensed.

phone_country.description:
**Note:** This field is **deprecated**. Use the phone_numbers field. 

 The user's phone number country.

use_pmi.description: Whether a PMI will be used instead of an auto-generated meeting ID.

vanity_name.description: The user's personal meeting room name.

settings.description: The [user's profile](https://zoom.us/profile) settings. These settings are different from [user settings](https://zoom.us/profile/setting).

large_meeting_capacity.description: The number of [large meeting participants](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#largemeetingplans) allowed on a per-month or yearly basis.

webinar.description: Whether the Webinar plan is enabled for the user.

webinar_capacity.description: The number of [webinar participants](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#largemeetingplans) allowed on a per-month or yearly basis.

large_meeting.description: Whether a [large meeting plan](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans) is enabled for the user.

custom_attributes.description: Information about the user's custom attributes. This field only returns if users are assigned custom attributes.

primary_group_id.description: The user's primary group id, the field returns values if a user's primary group is changed.

time_stamp.description: The user's update timestamp, in milliseconds.

old_object.description: Information about the user's previous settings.

$changed_field_name.description: The modified field its original value.

requestBody.description:
# group.admin_added

The **Group admin added** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users add a group admin. Group admins can be added in the [Zoom Web Portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204519819-Managing-user-groups-and-settings#h_6bdb29aa-2bed-4e7c-abfe-1b076354419f) or via the [**Add group admins**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/groupAdminsCreate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Group admin added** subscription enabled under the **Group** event.



**Event type**: `group.admin_added`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The group's account ID.

operator.description: The email address of the user that added the admin to the group.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that added the admin to the group.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the group's admin were added, in milliseconds.

requestBody.description:
# account.vanity_url_rejected

The **Account vanity url rejected** event is triggered each time an account or subaccount's [vanity URL](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/215062646) is rejected.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher [plan](https://zoom.us/pricing) with the **Master account** option enabled.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **Account's vanity url rejected** subscription enabled under the **Account** event.



**Event type**: `account.vanity_url_rejected`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account's owner.

operator.description: The email address of the user who rejected the account's vanity URL.

object.description: Information about the account's rejected vanity URL.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.ended

The **End Webinar** event is triggered every time a user in your account or your app ends a Webinar.

Zoom users with a [Webinar Plan](https://zoom.us/webinar) have permissions for creating and managing Webinars. [Zoom Video Webinar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar) allows users to broadcast a Zoom meeting to up to 1000 attendees. A Webinar host can start and end a Webinar.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscription** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **End Webinar** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.ended`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who ended the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

end_time.description: The date and time at which the webinar ended.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.recovered

The **Webinar has been recovered** event is triggered every time a user recovers a previously-deleted webinar. The user must be a user on your account or on any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

Zoom users can restore previously-deleted webinars for up to one week after deletion. Any invitations, links, and webinar IDs sent prior to the webinar's deletion will still work after a user [recovers](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038297111-Recovering-a-deleted-meeting-or-webinar) it.

## Prerequisites

* Enable **Event Subscriptions** for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Webinar has been recovered** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.recovered`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who recovered the webinar.

operator.description: The email address of the user who recovered the webinar.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who recovered the webinar.

operation.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all webinars. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinars with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

requestBody.description:
# account.lock_settings_updated

The **Account settings lock status updated** event is triggered every time an account or a Sub Account enables or disables a lock for a [setting](https://zoom.us/account/setting). The account must belong either to you or a user of your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app. To receive notifications for this event, you must meet the following prerequisites.

Account owners or users with admin privileges can [manually update](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Account-Settings#h_419c57b8-0d83-4ff3-8910-3e5dfb7be3a0) account lock settings from the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/), or by using  the [Update Settings](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/updateAccountLockSettings) API.


## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
  * A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
  * The "**Account settings lock status updated**" subscription enabled under the **Account** event.



**Event type**: `account.lock_settings_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account's owner.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the account's lock settings.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the account's lock settings.

settings.description: Information about the account's updated lock settings.

audio_type.description: Determine how participants can join the audio portion of the meeting.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: If the value is set to true, the meeting password will be encrypted and included in the join meeting link to allow participants to join with just one click without having to enter the password.

enforce_login.description: Allow only signed-in users to join meetings.

enforce_login_with_domains.description: Allow only signed-in users with specified domains to join meetings.

host_video.description: Start meetings with host video on.

join_before_host.description: Allow participants to join the meeting before the host arrives

meeting_authentication.description: Only authenticated users can join meetings

not_store_meeting_topic.description: Whether to enable the [**Always display "Zoom Meeting" as the meeting topic**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Changing-account-settings#h_01EG9BJ646V2WJK1S3H2MP6YV6) setting.

participant_video.description: Start meetings with participant video on.

require_password_for_instant_meetings.description: Require password for instant meetings. If you use a PMI for your instant meetings, this option will be disabled. This setting is always enabled for free accounts and Pro accounts with a single host and cannot be modified for these accounts.

require_password_for_pmi_meetings.description: Require participants to enter password for PMI meetings. This setting is always enabled for free accounts and Pro accounts with a single host and cannot be modified for these accounts.

require_password_for_scheduling_new_meet.description: This setting applies for regular meetings that do not use a PMI. If enabled, a password will be generated while a host schedules a new meeting and participants will be required to enter the password before they can join the meeting. This setting is always enabled for free accounts and Pro accounts with a single host and cannot be modified for these accounts.

use_pmi_for_instant_meetings.description: Use a Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting.

use_pmi_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Use a Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting.

always_display_zoom_webinar_as_topic.description: Whether to enable the [**Always show "Zoom Webinar" as the webinar topic**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Changing-account-settings#h_01EG9BJ646V2WJK1S3H2MP6YV6) setting.

meeting_template.description: Whether to enable the **Meeting Templates** setting.

alert_guest_join.description: Allow participants who belong to your account to see that a guest (someone who does not belong to your account) is participating in the meeting or webinar.

allow_users_to_delete_messages_in_meetin.description: If the value of this field is set to true,  allow users to delete messages in the in-meeting chat.

allow_show_zoom_windows.description: Show Zoom windows during screen share.

annotation.description: Allow participants to use annotation tools to add information to shared screens.

attendee_on_hold.description:
Allow host to put attendee on hold.

**This field has been deprecated and is no longer supported.**

attention_mode_focus_mode.description:
