Whether to enable the [**Focus Mode**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061113751-Using-focus-mode) feature. When enabled, this feature only displays the host and co-hosts' video and profile pictures during a meeting. 

 This value defaults to false.

auto_answer.description: Enable users to see and add contacts to 'auto-answer group' in the contact list on chat. Any call from members of this group will be automatically answered.

breakout_room.description: Allow host to split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms.

chat.description: Allow meeting participants to send chat message visible to all participants.

closed_caption.description: Allow host to type closed captions or assign a participant/third party device to add closed captions.

co_host.description: Allow the host to add co-hosts. Co-hosts have the same in-meeting controls as the host.

custom_data_center_regions.description: Displays whether or not custom [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042411451-Selecting-data-center-regions-for-hosted-meetings-and-webinars) have been selected for meetings/webinars hosted by the account.

disable_screen_sharing_for_host_meetings.description: Whether to enable the **Disable desktop screen sharing for meetings you host** setting.

disable_screen_sharing_for_in_meeting_gu.description: Whether to enable the **Disable screen sharing when guests are in the meeting** setting.

dscp_marking.description: Enable DSCP marking for signaling and media packets. (Default is 56 for audio, 40 for video, and 40 for signaling.)

e2e_encryption.description: Require that all meetings are encrypted using AES.

far_end_camera_control.description: Allow another user to take control of the camera during a meeting.

feedback.description: Enable users to provide feedback to Zoom at the end of the meeting.

file_transfer.description: Indicates whether [in-meeting file transfer](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/209605493-In-meeting-file-transfer) setting has been enabled for all users on the account or not.

full_transcript.description: Whether full transcripts are available for viewing in the in-meeting side panel.

group_hd.description: Enable higher quality video for host and participants. This will require more bandwidth.

language_interpretation.description: Whether hosts can assign participants as interpreters to interpret one language into another in real-time.

sign_language_interpretation.description: Allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into sign language in real-time. Hosts can assign interpreters when scheduling, or during the meeting itself. This feature is only available with version 5.11.3 or later.

manual_captions.description: Whether to enable manual closed captioning. When [enabled](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207279736-Managing-closed-captioning-and-live-transcription), the host or assigned participant can provide manual captioning or a [3rd-party device](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002212983) can be assigned to provide captioning.

meeting_reactions.description: Whether meeting participants can [communicate using the emoji reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions) located in the **Reactions** menu in the meeting toolbar.

webinar_reactions.description: Set this field to true to use [webinar reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4803536268429).

meeting_survey.description: Whether the host can present a survey to participants once a meeting has ended. This feature is only available in version 5.7.3 or higher.

original_audio.description: Allow users to select original sound during a meeting.

polling.description: Add 'Polls' to the meeting controls. This allows the host to survey the attendees.

private_chat.description: Allow meeting participants to send a private 1:1 message to another participant.

remote_control.description: During screen sharing, allow the person who is sharing to let others control the shared content.

non_verbal_feedback.description: Whether to enable the [**Non-verbal feedback**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions-) setting.  This value defaults to false.

remote_support.description: Whether to enable the [**Remote support**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060951012-Enabling-remote-support) setting. This value defaults to false.

request_permission_to_unmute_participant.description: Whether to enable the [**Request permission to unmute participants**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203435537-Muting-and-unmuting-participants-in-a-meeting) setting.

save_caption.description: Whether participants can save closed captions or transcripts.

save_captions.description:
Whether participants can [save closed caption or transcripts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060958752). 

 **Note:** If the full_transcript field is set to false, participants **cannot** save captions.

screen_sharing.description: Allow host and participants to share their screen or content during meetings.

sending_default_email_invites.description: Allow users to invite participants by email only by default.

show_meeting_control_toolbar.description: Always show meeting controls during a meeting.

slide_control.description: Whether the person sharing during a presentation can allow others to control the slide presentation. This feature is only available in version 5.8.3 or higher.

stereo_audio.description: Allow users to select stereo audio during a meeting.

use_html_format_email.description: Allow  HTML formatting instead of plain text for meeting invitations scheduled with the Outlook plugin.

webinar_chat.description: Whether to allow webinar participants to send chat messages.

webinar_polling.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a webinar.

webinar_question_answer.description: Whether attendees can ask the host and panelists questions in the webinar.

meeting_question_answer.description: Allow participants to ask questions for the host and participants to answer.

webinar_survey.description: Whether the host can present surveys to attendees once a webinar has ended.

whiteboard.description: Allow participants to share a whiteboard that includes annotation tools.

alternative_host_reminder.description: Notify the alternative host who is set or removed.

cancel_meeting_reminder.description: Notify host and participants when the meeting is cancelled.

cloud_recording_available_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host when a cloud recording is available.

jbh_reminder.description: Notify host when participants join the meeting before them.

schedule_for_reminder.description: Notify the host there is a meeting is scheduled, rescheduled, or cancelled.

account_user_access_recording.description: Make cloud recordings accessible to account members only.

auto_delete_cmr.description: Allow Zoom to automatically delete recordings permanently after a specified number of days.

auto_recording.description: Record meetings automatically as they start.

cloud_recording.description: Allow hosts to record and save the meeting / webinar in the cloud.

cloud_recording_download.description: Allow anyone with a link to the cloud recording to download.

host_delete_cloud_recording.description: Allow the host to delete the recordings. If this option is disabled, the recordings cannot be deleted by the host and only admin can delete them.

ip_address_access_control.description: Setting to allow cloud recording access only from specific IP address ranges.

local_recording.description: Allow hosts and participants to record the meeting to a local file.

recording_authentication.description: Only authenticated users can view cloud recordings

archive.description: [Archiving solution](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360050431572-Archiving-Meeting-and-Webinar-data) settings. This setting can only be used if you have been granted archiving solution access by the Zoom support team.

third_party_audio.description: Allow users to join the meeting using the existing 3rd party audio configuration.

toll_free_and_fee_based_toll_call.description: Whether the account has the [**Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060950711-Enabling-Toll-free-and-Fee-based-Toll-Call#h_01F51680NJ7YHZDXGJNSKDGM2P) setting enabled.

share_files.description: Users can share files in chats and channels.

chat_emojis.description: Allow users to use the emoji library in direct messages or group conversations. Choose between allowing users to use any emoji in the library, or choose to allow only pre-selected emojis. If the setting is disabled, users can still use keyboard shortcuts to add emojis. Users can change their emoji skin tone in Settings.

record_voice_messages.description: Allow users to record voice messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations.

record_video_messages.description: Allow users to record video messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations. If the file share setting is disabled, they will not be able to record and send video messages.

screen_capture.description: Allow users to take and send screenshots in direct messages or group conversations.

share_links_in_chat.description: Share links to messages and channels in Team Chat.

schedule_meetings_in_chat.description: Schedule a meeting from chat or channel.

allow_users_to_add_contacts.description: Whether to allow users to add contacts.

allow_users_to_chat_with_others.description: Whether to Allow users to chat with others.

chat_etiquette_tool.description: Whether to enable the **Chat Etiquette Tool**.

send_data_to_third_party_archiving_servi.description: Whether to send data to third-party archiving service.

translate_messages.description: Allow users to translate team chat messages. [Learn more].(https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/12998089084685)

search_and_send_animated_gif_images.description: Whether to allow users to search GIF images from GIPHY when they compose messages.

blur_snapshot.description: If true, iOS blurs the screenshot in the task switcher when multiple apps are open. Android hides the screenshot in the system-level list of recent apps.

show_international_numbers_link.description: Show international numbers link on the invitation email

approved_or_denied_countries_or_regions.description: Whether to enable the [**Approve or block entry for users from specific countries/regions**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060086231-Joining-from-specific-countries-regions) setting.

auto_security.description:
Whether all meetings must be secured with at least one security option. 

 This setting can only be disabled by Enterprise, ISV, Business (with more than 100 licenses), and Education accounts.

block_user_domain.description: Whether users in specific domains are blocked from joining meetings and webinars.

chat_etiquette_tool.description: Whether to enable the **Chat Etiquette Tool**.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: Whether the meeting password is encrypted and included in the invitation link. The provided link will allow participants to join the meeting without having to enter the password.

encryption_type.description: Whether use encryption to start a meeting.

end_to_end_encrypted_meetings.description: Whether to enable end-to-end encryption for meetings.

meeting_password.description: Whether all instant and scheduled meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected. [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937) meetings are **not** included in this setting.

only_authenticated_can_join_from_webclie.description: Whether to specify that only authenticated users can join the meeting from the web client.

phone_password.description:
Whether passwords are required for participants joining by phone. 

 If enabled and the meeting is password-protected, a numeric password is required for participants to join by phone. For meetings with alphanumeric passwords, a numeric password will be generated.

pmi_password.description: Whether all Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected.

waiting_room.description:
Whether participants are placed in the [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) when they join a meeting. 

 If the **Waiting Room** feature is enabled, the [**Allow participants to join before host**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202828525-Allow-participants-to-join-before-host) setting is automatically disabled.

webinar_password.description: Whether to generate a password when scheduling webinars. Participants must use the generated password to join the scheduled webinar.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the lock setting was updated.

old_object.description: Information about the account's previous lock settings.

settings.description: Information about the updated account or sub account settings. This only returns modified settings.

audio_type.description: Determine how participants can join the audio portion of the meeting.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: If the value is set to true, the meeting password will be encrypted and included in the join meeting link to allow participants to join with just one click without having to enter the password.

enforce_login.description: Allow only signed-in users to join meetings.

enforce_login_with_domains.description: Allow only signed-in users with specified domains to join meetings.

host_video.description: Start meetings with host video on.

join_before_host.description: Allow participants to join the meeting before the host arrives

meeting_authentication.description: Only authenticated users can join meetings

not_store_meeting_topic.description: Whether to enable the [**Always display "Zoom Meeting" as the meeting topic**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Changing-account-settings#h_01EG9BJ646V2WJK1S3H2MP6YV6) setting.

participant_video.description: Start meetings with participant video on.

require_password_for_instant_meetings.description: Require password for instant meetings. If you use a PMI for your instant meetings, this option will be disabled. This setting is always enabled for free accounts and Pro accounts with a single host and cannot be modified for these accounts.

require_password_for_pmi_meetings.description: Require participants to enter password for PMI meetings. This setting is always enabled for free accounts and Pro accounts with a single host and cannot be modified for these accounts.

require_password_for_scheduling_new_meet.description: This setting applies for regular meetings that do not use a PMI. If enabled, a password will be generated while a host schedules a new meeting and participants will be required to enter the password before they can join the meeting. This setting is always enabled for free accounts and Pro accounts with a single host and cannot be modified for these accounts.

use_pmi_for_instant_meetings.description: Use a Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting.

use_pmi_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Use a Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting.

always_display_zoom_webinar_as_topic.description: Whether to enable the [**Always show "Zoom Webinar" as the webinar topic**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Changing-account-settings#h_01EG9BJ646V2WJK1S3H2MP6YV6) setting.

meeting_template.description: Whether to enable the **Meeting Templates** setting.

alert_guest_join.description: Allow participants who belong to your account to see that a guest (someone who does not belong to your account) is participating in the meeting or webinar.

allow_users_to_delete_messages_in_meetin.description: If the value of this field is set to true,  allow users to delete messages in the in-meeting chat.

allow_show_zoom_windows.description: Show Zoom windows during screen share.

annotation.description: Allow participants to use annotation tools to add information to shared screens.

attendee_on_hold.description:
Allow host to put attendee on hold.

**This field has been deprecated and is no longer supported.**

attention_mode_focus_mode.description:
Whether to enable the [**Focus Mode**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061113751-Using-focus-mode) feature. When enabled, this feature only displays the host and co-hosts' video and profile pictures during a meeting. 

 This value defaults to false.

auto_answer.description: Enable users to see and add contacts to 'auto-answer group' in the contact list on chat. Any call from members of this group will be automatically answered.

breakout_room.description: Allow host to split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms.

chat.description: Allow meeting participants to send chat message visible to all participants.

closed_caption.description: Allow host to type closed captions or assign a participant/third party device to add closed captions.

co_host.description: Allow the host to add co-hosts. Co-hosts have the same in-meeting controls as the host.

custom_data_center_regions.description: Displays whether or not custom [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042411451-Selecting-data-center-regions-for-hosted-meetings-and-webinars) have been selected for meetings/webinars hosted by the account.

disable_screen_sharing_for_host_meetings.description: Whether to enable the **Disable desktop screen sharing for meetings you host** setting.

disable_screen_sharing_for_in_meeting_gu.description: Whether to enable the **Disable screen sharing when guests are in the meeting** setting.

dscp_marking.description: Enable DSCP marking for signaling and media packets. (Default is 56 for audio, 40 for video, and 40 for signaling.)

e2e_encryption.description: Require that all meetings are encrypted using AES.

far_end_camera_control.description: Allow another user to take control of the camera during a meeting.

feedback.description: Enable users to provide feedback to Zoom at the end of the meeting.

file_transfer.description: Indicates whether [in-meeting file transfer](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/209605493-In-meeting-file-transfer) setting has been enabled for all users on the account or not.

full_transcript.description: Whether full transcripts are available for viewing in the in-meeting side panel.

group_hd.description: Enable higher quality video for host and participants. This will require more bandwidth.

language_interpretation.description: Whether hosts can assign participants as interpreters to interpret one language into another in real-time.

sign_language_interpretation.description: Allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into sign language in real-time. Hosts can assign interpreters when scheduling, or during the meeting itself. This feature is only available with version 5.11.3 or later.

manual_captions.description: Whether to enable manual closed captioning. When [enabled](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207279736-Managing-closed-captioning-and-live-transcription), the host or assigned participant can provide manual captioning or a [3rd-party device](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002212983) can be assigned to provide captioning.

meeting_reactions.description: Whether meeting participants can [communicate using the emoji reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions) located in the **Reactions** menu in the meeting toolbar.

webinar_reactions.description: Set this field to true to use [webinar reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4803536268429).

meeting_survey.description: Whether the host can present a survey to participants once a meeting has ended. This feature is only available in version 5.7.3 or higher.

original_audio.description: Allow users to select original sound during a meeting.

polling.description: Add 'Polls' to the meeting controls. This allows the host to survey the attendees.

private_chat.description: Allow meeting participants to send a private 1:1 message to another participant.

remote_control.description: During screen sharing, allow the person who is sharing to let others control the shared content.

non_verbal_feedback.description: Whether to enable the [**Non-verbal feedback**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions-) setting.  This value defaults to false.

remote_support.description: Whether to enable the [**Remote support**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060951012-Enabling-remote-support) setting. This value defaults to false.

request_permission_to_unmute_participant.description: Whether to enable the [**Request permission to unmute participants**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203435537-Muting-and-unmuting-participants-in-a-meeting) setting.

save_caption.description: Whether participants can save closed captions or transcripts.

save_captions.description:
Whether participants can [save closed caption or transcripts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060958752). 

 **Note:** If the full_transcript field is set to false, participants **cannot** save captions.

screen_sharing.description: Allow host and participants to share their screen or content during meetings.

sending_default_email_invites.description: Allow users to invite participants by email only by default.

show_meeting_control_toolbar.description: Always show meeting controls during a meeting.

slide_control.description: Whether the person sharing during a presentation can allow others to control the slide presentation. This feature is only available in version 5.8.3 or higher.

stereo_audio.description: Allow users to select stereo audio during a meeting.

use_html_format_email.description: Allow  HTML formatting instead of plain text for meeting invitations scheduled with the Outlook plugin.

webinar_chat.description: Whether to allow webinar participants to send chat messages.

webinar_polling.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a webinar.

webinar_question_answer.description: Whether attendees can ask the host and panelists questions in the webinar.

meeting_question_answer.description: Allow participants to ask questions for the host and participants to answer.

webinar_survey.description: Whether the host can present surveys to attendees once a webinar has ended.

whiteboard.description: Allow participants to share a whiteboard that includes annotation tools.

alternative_host_reminder.description: Notify the alternative host who is set or removed.

cancel_meeting_reminder.description: Notify host and participants when the meeting is cancelled.

cloud_recording_available_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host when a cloud recording is available.

jbh_reminder.description: Notify host when participants join the meeting before them.

schedule_for_reminder.description: Notify the host there is a meeting is scheduled, rescheduled, or cancelled.

account_user_access_recording.description: Make cloud recordings accessible to account members only.

auto_delete_cmr.description: Allow Zoom to automatically delete recordings permanently after a specified number of days.

auto_recording.description: Record meetings automatically as they start.

cloud_recording.description: Allow hosts to record and save the meeting / webinar in the cloud.

cloud_recording_download.description: Allow anyone with a link to the cloud recording to download.

host_delete_cloud_recording.description: Allow the host to delete the recordings. If this option is disabled, the recordings cannot be deleted by the host and only admin can delete them.

ip_address_access_control.description: Setting to allow cloud recording access only from specific IP address ranges.

local_recording.description: Allow hosts and participants to record the meeting to a local file.

recording_authentication.description: Only authenticated users can view cloud recordings

archive.description: [Archiving solution](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360050431572-Archiving-Meeting-and-Webinar-data) settings. This setting can only be used if you have been granted archiving solution access by the Zoom support team.

third_party_audio.description: Allow users to join the meeting using the existing 3rd party audio configuration.

blur_snapshot.description: If true, iOS blurs the screenshot in the task switcher when multiple apps are open. Android hides the screenshot in the system-level list of recent apps.

toll_free_and_fee_based_toll_call.description: Whether the account has the [**Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060950711-Enabling-Toll-free-and-Fee-based-Toll-Call#h_01F51680NJ7YHZDXGJNSKDGM2P) setting enabled.

share_files.description: Users can share files in chats and channels.

chat_emojis.description: Allow users to use the emoji library in direct messages or group conversations. Choose between allowing users to use any emoji in the library, or choose to allow only pre-selected emojis. If the setting is disabled, users can still use keyboard shortcuts to add emojis. Users can change their emoji skin tone in Settings.

record_voice_messages.description: Allow users to record voice messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations.

record_video_messages.description: Allow users to record video messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations. If the file share setting is disabled, they will not be able to record and send video messages.

screen_capture.description: Allow users to take and send screenshots in direct messages or group conversations.

share_links_in_chat.description: Share links to messages and channels in Team Chat.

schedule_meetings_in_chat.description: Schedule a meeting from chat or channel.

allow_users_to_add_contacts.description: Whether to allow users to add contacts.

allow_users_to_chat_with_others.description: Whether to Allow users to chat with others.

chat_etiquette_tool.description: Whether to enable the **Chat Etiquette Tool**.

send_data_to_third_party_archiving_servi.description: Whether to send data to third-party archiving service.

translate_messages.description: Allow users to translate team chat messages. [Learn more].(https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/12998089084685)

search_and_send_animated_gif_images.description: Whether to allow users to search GIF images from GIPHY when they compose messages.

approved_or_denied_countries_or_regions.description: Whether to enable the [**Approve or block entry for users from specific countries/regions**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060086231-Joining-from-specific-countries-regions) setting.

auto_security.description:
Whether all meetings must be secured with at least one security option. 

 This setting can only be disabled by Enterprise, ISV, Business (with more than 100 licenses), and Education accounts.

block_user_domain.description: Whether users in specific domains are blocked from joining meetings and webinars.

chat_etiquette_tool.description: Whether to enable the **Chat Etiquette Tool**.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: Whether the meeting password is encrypted and included in the invitation link. The provided link will allow participants to join the meeting without having to enter the password.

encryption_type.description: Whether use encryption to start a meeting.

end_to_end_encrypted_meetings.description: Whether to enable end-to-end encryption for meetings.

meeting_password.description: Whether all instant and scheduled meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected. [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937) meetings are **not** included in this setting.

only_authenticated_can_join_from_webclie.description: Whether to specify that only authenticated users can join the meeting from the web client.

phone_password.description:
Whether passwords are required for participants joining by phone. 

 If enabled and the meeting is password-protected, a numeric password is required for participants to join by phone. For meetings with alphanumeric passwords, a numeric password will be generated.

pmi_password.description: Whether all Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected.

waiting_room.description:
Whether participants are placed in the [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) when they join a meeting. 

 If the **Waiting Room** feature is enabled, the [**Allow participants to join before host**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202828525-Allow-participants-to-join-before-host) setting is automatically disabled.

webinar_password.description: Whether to generate a password when scheduling webinars. Participants must use the generated password to join the scheduled webinar.

share_files.description: Users can share files in chats and channels.

chat_emojis.description: Allow users to use the emoji library in direct messages or group conversations. Choose between allowing users to use any emoji in the library, or choose to allow only pre-selected emojis. If the setting is disabled, users can still use keyboard shortcuts to add emojis. Users can change their emoji skin tone in Settings.

record_voice_messages.description: Allow users to record voice messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations.

record_video_messages.description: Allow users to record video messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations. If the file share setting is disabled, they will not be able to record and send video messages.

screen_capture.description: Allow users to take and send screenshots in direct messages or group conversations.

share_links_in_chat.description: Share links to messages and channels in Team Chat.

schedule_meetings_in_chat.description: Schedule a meeting from chat or channel.

allow_users_to_add_contacts.description: Whether to allow users to add contacts.

allow_users_to_chat_with_others.description: Whether to Allow users to chat with others.

chat_etiquette_tool.description: Whether to enable the **Chat Etiquette Tool**.

send_data_to_third_party_archiving_servi.description: Whether to send data to third-party archiving service.

translate_messages.description: Allow users to translate team chat messages. [Learn more].(https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/12998089084685)

search_and_send_animated_gif_images.description: Whether to allow users to search GIF images from GIPHY when they compose messages.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.participant_role_changed

The **Participant role changed** event is triggered every time a host or webinar attendee changes the role during a webinar created by one of your app users or account users. A webinar host can invite other users to attend the webinar.

Zoom users with a [Webinar plan](https://zoom.us/webinar) have access to creating and managing webinars. [Zoom webinars](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar) let users to broadcast a Zoom meeting to up to 1,000 attendees.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant role changed** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.participant_role_changed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's webinar user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a webinar and is only valid for the duration of the webinar.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the webinar by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. For more information, read our [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) documentation.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the webinar **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

date_time.description: The time at which the participant changed the [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000252726-Roles-in-a-Zoom-Webinar).

old_role.description:
The participant's previous role: 
* host — Host. 
* co-host — Co-host. 
* attendee — Attendee.

new_role.description:
The participant's new role: 
* host — Host. 
* co-host — Co-host. 
* attendee — Attendee.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_jbh_waiting_left

The **Waiting participant left meeting before host joined** event is triggered every time an attendee waiting for the host to join the meeting leaves before the host. The host of the meeting must be a user in your account or users in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

When scheduling a meeting, the organizer or host of the meeting can enable the **Enable join before host** option. This allows attendees to join the meeting before the host of the meeting arrives. This meeting also starts as soon as the first meeting participant joins.

If this option is **disabled**, participants are prompted to wait for the host to arrive before joining the meeting.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* The **Enable join before host** option should be enabled for the scheduled meeting.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Waiting participant left meeting before host joined** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_jbh_waiting_left`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

requestBody.description:
# user.tsp_created

The **A user's TSP account was created** event is triggered every time a [TSP user account is created](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userTSPCreate) in Zoom.

Zoom allows certain carrier partners to provision Telephony Service Provider (TSP) audio to users. For users to use TSP audio, carrier partners must create a TSP user account with Zoom for the users.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan with TSP Configurations enabled.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* The **A user's TSP account was created** subscription must be enabled under the **TSP** event.



**Event type**: `user.tsp_created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the TSP.

operator.description: The email address of the user who created the TSP.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who created the TSP.

tsp_credentials.description: Information about the user's TSP credentials.

dial_in_numbers.description: Information about the TSP dial-in numbers.

type.description:
The type of the phone number: 
* toll — Toll number. 
* tollfree — Toll free number. 
* media_link — Media link.

country_label.description:
The TSP country label: 
* US_TSP_TB 
* EU_TSP_TB

requestBody.description:
# meeting.updated

The **Meeting has been updated** event is triggered every time a meeting scheduled by one of your app users or account users, is updated.

A meeting host or a user with admin privileges can update a scheduled meeting. The meeting can be manually updated via the **Edit** feature in the [Zoom web portal](https://zoom.us) or the Zoom client. You can also be programmatically update a meeting via the [**Update a meeting**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingUpdate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **Meeting has been updated** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who updated the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the meeting.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the meeting.

scope.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all meetings. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

join_url.description: The URL participants use to join the meeting.

password.description: The password required to join the meeting.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

status.description:
The meeting occurrence status: 
* available 
* deleted

settings.description: Information about the updated meeting settings. This **only** returns updated meeting settings.

host_video.description: Whether to start the meeting with the host's video on.

participant_video.description: Whether to turn a participant's video on when they join the meeting. Participants can change this setting during the meeting.

join_before_host.description: Whether to [allow participants to join the meeting before host arrives](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202828525-Allow-participants-to-join-before-host).

mute_upon_entry.description: Whether participants are muted upon entry.

audio.description:
The available audio options for participants joining the meeting: 
* telephony — Telephony only. 
* voip — VoIP only. 
* both - Both Telephony and VoIP.

auto_recording.description:
The [automatic recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202921119-Automatic-Recording) settings for the meeting: 
* local — Record and save to the local device. 
* cloud — Record and save to the cloud. 
* none — Automatic recording disabled.

use_pmi.description: Whether to use a [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937-Using-Personal-Meeting-ID-PMI) instead of an auto-generated meeting ID. PMIs are only available for scheduled meetings, instant meetings, and recurring meetings with no fixed time.

enforce_login.description: Whether to only allow signed in users to join the meeting.

enforce_login_domains.description: A list of the domains allowed to join the meeting.

approval_type.description:
The [approval type](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Scheduling-a-meeting-with-registration) for meeting registrants: 
* 0 — Automatically approve registrants. 
* 1 — Manually approve registrants. 
* 2 — Meeting registration not required.

registration_type.description:
The meeting registration setting for recurring meetings: 
* 1 — Attendees register once and can attend any of the meeting occurrences. 
* 2 — Attendees must register for each occurrence to attend. 
* 3 — Attendees register once and can select one or more occurrences to attend.

alternative_hosts.description: A semicolon-separated list of the meeting's alternative hosts' email addresses or IDs.

meeting_authentication.description: Whether only authenticated users can join the meeting.

authentication_name.description: The authentication name set in the [authentication profile](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037117472).

authentication_domains.description: A list of the allowed authenticated domains.

type.description:
The type of recurring meeting: 
* 1 — Daily. 
* 2 — Weekly. 
* 3 — Monthly.

repeat_interval.description:
The meeting's repeat interval: 
* For daily intervals, a max of 90 days. 
* For a weekly interval, a max of 12 weeks. 
* For monthly intervals, a max of 3 months.

weekly_days.description:
A comma-separated list of the days of the week on which the recurring weekly meeting occurs: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

monthly_day.description: The day of the month on which the recurring monthly meeting occurs. The value ranges from 1 to 31.

monthly_week_day.description:
The day of the week on which the recurring monthly meeting is scheduled: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

end_times.description: The number of times the recurring meeting will occur before it is canceled.

end_date_time.description: The recurring meeting's final ending date and time before it is canceled, in UTC format.

monthly_week.description:
The week of the month on which a recurring meeting occurs: 
* -1 — The last week of the month. 
* 1 — The first week. 
* 2 — The second week. 
* 3 — The third week. 
* 4 — The fourth week.

time_stamp.description: The meeting's update timestamp, in milliseconds.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

join_url.description: The URL participants use to join the meeting.

password.description: The password required to join the meeting.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

status.description:
The meeting occurrence status: 
* available 
* deleted

settings.description: Information about the updated meeting settings. This **only** returns updated meeting settings.

host_video.description: Whether to start the meeting with the host's video on.

participant_video.description: Whether to turn a participant's video on when they join the meeting. Participants can change this setting during the meeting.

join_before_host.description: Whether to [allow participants to join the meeting before host arrives](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202828525-Allow-participants-to-join-before-host).

mute_upon_entry.description: Whether participants are muted upon entry.

audio.description:
The available audio options for participants joining the meeting: 
* telephony — Telephony only. 
* voip — VoIP only. 
* both - Both Telephony and VoIP.

auto_recording.description:
The [automatic recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202921119-Automatic-Recording) settings for the meeting: 
* local — Record and save to the local device. 
* cloud — Record and save to the cloud. 
* none — Automatic recording disabled.

use_pmi.description: Whether to use a [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937-Using-Personal-Meeting-ID-PMI) instead of an auto-generated meeting ID. PMIs are only available for scheduled meetings, instant meetings, and recurring meetings with no fixed time.

enforce_login.description: Whether to only allow signed in users to join the meeting.

enforce_login_domains.description: A list of the domains allowed to join the meeting.

approval_type.description:
The [approval type](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Scheduling-a-meeting-with-registration) for meeting registrants: 
* 0 — Automatically approve registrants. 
* 1 — Manually approve registrants. 
* 2 — Meeting registration not required.

registration_type.description:
The meeting registration setting for recurring meetings: 
* 1 — Attendees register once and can attend any of the meeting occurrences. 
* 2 — Attendees must register for each occurrence to attend. 
* 3 — Attendees register once and can select one or more occurrences to attend.

alternative_hosts.description: A semicolon-separated list of the meeting's alternative hosts' email addresses or IDs.

meeting_authentication.description: Whether only authenticated users can join the meeting.

authentication_name.description: The authentication name set in the [authentication profile](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037117472).

authentication_domains.description: A list of the allowed authenticated domains.

type.description:
The type of recurring meeting: 
* 1 — Daily. 
* 2 — Weekly. 
* 3 — Monthly.

repeat_interval.description:
The meeting's repeat interval: 
* For daily intervals, a max of 90 days. 
* For a weekly interval, a max of 12 weeks. 
* For monthly intervals, a max of 3 months.

weekly_days.description:
A comma-separated list of the days of the week on which the recurring weekly meeting occurs: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

monthly_day.description: The day of the month on which the recurring monthly meeting occurs. The value ranges from 1 to 31.

monthly_week_day.description:
The day of the week on which the recurring monthly meeting is scheduled: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

end_times.description: The number of times the recurring meeting will occur before it is canceled.

end_date_time.description: The recurring meeting's final ending date and time before it is canceled, in UTC format.

monthly_week.description:
The week of the month on which a recurring meeting occurs: 
* -1 — The last week of the month. 
* 1 — The first week. 
* 2 — The second week. 
* 3 — The third week. 
* 4 — The fourth week.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.breakout_room_sharing_ended

The **User in breakout room stopped sharing** event is triggered when a user in a [breakout room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005769646-Participating-in-breakout-rooms) ends their [content-sharing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362153-Sharing-your-screen-or-desktop-on-Zoom), such as their desktop or the [classic whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205677665-Sharing-a-whiteboard).

Breakout rooms are sessions that are split off from the main Zoom meeting. They allow the participants to meet in smaller groups and are completely isolated in terms of audio and video from the main session.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **User in breakout room stopped sharing** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.breakout_room_sharing_ended`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The main meeting host's account ID.

uuid.description: The main meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

breakout_room_uuid.description: The breakout room's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each breakout room instance generates a breakout room UUID.

host_id.description: The main meeting host's user ID.

type.description:
The main meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

parent_user_id.description: The participant's main meeting user ID (user_id).

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

content.description:
The type of shared content: 
* application — An application. For example, a web browser. 
* whiteboard — The [classic whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205677665-Sharing-a-whiteboard). 
* desktop — A user's desktop. 
* airplay — A user's airplay. 
* camera — A user's camera. 
* unknown — An unrecognized application, such as a third party app.

link_source.description:
The Dropbox sharing method: 
* deep_link — A [deep link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_linking). 
* in_meeting — A link shared via Zoom. 
* An empty string value if the link source is **not** a Dropbox link.

file_link.description: The Dropbox file's link. This field returns an empty string value if the file link is **not** from a Dropbox source.

date_time.description: The screenshare's date and time.

source.description:
The source from which the file was shared: 
* dropbox — A Dropbox source. 
* An empty string value if the source is **not** Dropbox.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.registration_denied

The **Meeting Registration has been denied** event is triggered every time a registrant is denied from participating in a meeting.

A host with the Pro user type can enable the **Registration** feature when scheduling or updating a meeting. By [enabling registration for meetings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Registration-for-Meetings), participants must fill out a registration form receive information about joining the meeting.

A host can [manually reject](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360054446052-Managing-meeting-and-webinar-registration#h_01ETX8CE45EG3YT8S9JM32EW3Y) registrant. Hosts can also programmatically reject attendees via the [**Update registrant's status**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrantStatus) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* The meeting host should be a user on your account or a user of your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Registration has been denied** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.registration_denied`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who denied the meeting registration.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who denied the meeting registration.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.registration_denied

The **Webinar Registration has been denied** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users denies a user's registration.

[Scheduling a Webinar with registration](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204619915-Scheduling-a-Webinar-with-Registration) requires registrants to complete a brief form before receiving the link to join the Webinar.[Webinar Registration options](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202835649-Webinar-Registration-Customization#h_b74e0e26-5f3f-40d4-a3de-949dbfd85882) can be customized by a Zoom admin or a Webinar host. This customization allows them to choose whether to approve attendees automatically or manually.

When the registration is set to be approved manually, a pending registrant can be denied from joining the Webinar. To deny a registrant manually, navigate to your Webinars page and click on the name of the Webinar. Click **Edit** to the right of **Manage Attendees** option, select the user and click **Deny**. Alternatively, the registrant can be denied using the [**Update registrant's status**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/webinarRegistrantStatus) API.

## Prerequisites
* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Webinar Registration has been denied** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.registration_denied`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

operator.description: The email address of the user who denied the webinar registration.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who denied the webinar registration.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinars with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

tracking_source.description: Information about the source tracking. See [Creating webinar registration tracking links](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000315683-Creating-webinar-registration-tracking-links) for details.

id.description: Unique Identifier of the tracking source.

source_name.description: Name of the source (platform) where the registration URL was shared.

tracking_url.description: Tracking URL. The URL that was shared for the registration.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.registration_approved

The **Meeting Registration has been approved** event is triggered every time a registrant is approved for the meeting. The meeting host should be a user on your account or a user of your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

A meeting host or a user with admin privileges can restrict meeting registrations by manually approving registrants. With the **Manually Approve** option enabled for [meeting registrations](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Registration-for-Meetings), the host of the meeting must approve registrants before they receive information about how to join the meeting.

Meeting hosts can approve an attendee's meeting invitation via the [Zoom web portal](https://zoom.us). To do this, navigate to the scheduled meeting's page and click **Edit** next to the **Manage Attendees** section. Select the attendee to approve in the **Pending Approval** section, then click **Approve**.

To programmatically approve an attendee's registration, use the [**Update registrant's status**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrantStatus) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* **Manual Approval** enabled for [meeting registrations](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Registration-for-Meetings).
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Registration has been approved** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.registration_approved`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who approved the meeting registration.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who approved the meeting registration.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

join_url.description: The URL to join the meeting.

participant_pin_code.description: The participant PIN code is used to authenticate audio participants before they join the meeting.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.participant_left

The **Participant/Host left webinar** event is triggered every time a host of a Webinar or an attendee leaves the Webinar. The host must be a user on your account or on other accounts that have installed your webhook-enabled app.

Zoom users with a [Webinar Plan](https://zoom.us/webinar) have access to creating and managing Webinars. [Zoom Video Webinar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar) allows users to broadcast a Zoom meeting to upto 1000 attendees.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant/Host left webinar** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.participant_left`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

participant.description: Information about the webinar participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, email returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

user_id.description: The participant's webinar user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a webinar and is only valid for the duration of the webinar.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the webinar **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value. 

**Note:** Use the participant_user_id value instead of this value. We will remove this response in a future release.

leave_time.description: The time at which the participant left the webinar.

leave_reason.description:
The reason why the participant left the webinar, where $name is the participant's username: 
* $name left the meeting. 
* $name got disconnected from the meeting. 
* Host ended the meeting. 
* Host closed the meeting. 
* Host started a new meeting. 
* Network connection error. 
* Host did not join. 
* Exceeded free meeting minutes limit. 
* Removed by host. 
* Unknown reason. 
* Leave waiting room. 
* Removed by host from waiting room.
enum: Removed by host from waiting room.

email.description: The participant's email address. This field is returned if the participant joined the webinar by logging into their Zoom account. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the webinar **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

customer_key.description: The participant's SDK identifier. This value can be alphanumeric.

participant.leave_reason:
Jill Chill left the webinar.
Reason: Host ended the webinar.

requestBody.description:
# group.deleted

The **Group deleted** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users delete a group. Groups can be deleted in the [Zoom web portal](https://support.zoomus/hc/en-us/articles/204519819-Managing-user-groups-and-settings) or via the [**Delete a group**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/groupDelete) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Group deleted** subscription enabled under the **Group** event.



**Event type**: `group.deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The group's account ID.

operator.description: The email address of the user that deleted the group.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that deleted the group.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the group was deleted, in milliseconds.

requestBody.description:
# recording.batch_deleted

The **Batch recording deleted** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users permanently deletes one or more cloud recordings.

When a user initially deletes a recording, it is sent to the trash. At this stage, the recording can still be recovered for up to 30 days after deletion. To permanently delete a recording, users must delete it from the trash.

Users can permanently delete a recording via the [**Delete meeting recordings**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/recordingDelete) API with the `delete` query parameter or in the [Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Recording-Management).

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Recording files have been permanently deleted in batches** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.batch_deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that completed the meeting or webinar recording.

operator.description: The email address of the user who deleted the recording.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who deleted the recording.

object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

items.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

meeting_uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

recording_file_ids.description: The recording file's unique ID. If the current field value is NULL, it means to delete the whole Meeting Recording files.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.alert

The **Webinar issues alert** event is triggered every time a Webinar hosted by one of your app users or account users, encounters a service issue.

Zoom monitors the Webinar statistics in regard to the quality of service for each Webinar. An account owner or a user with admin permissions on a Business or higher plan can view these statistics via Dashboard. The following quality metrics can trigger an alert:

* Unstable audio
* Unstable video
* Poor screen share quality
* High CPU usage
* Call reconnection problems

To receive notifications for this event, you must meet the following prerequisites.

## Prerequisites

*  Business or a higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
  * A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
  * The **Webinar issues alert** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.alert`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

issues.description:
A list of issues that occurred during the webinar: 
* Unstable audio quality 
* Unstable video quality 
* Unstable screen share quality 
* High CPU occupation 
* Call Reconnection

requestBody.description:
# webinar.chat_message_sent

The **In-webinar chat message received** event is triggered when a user sends a public or private chat message during a webinar using the [chat feature](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205761999-Chatting-in-a-Zoom-Webinar). The event is sent to the configured endpoint in your Marketplace app.

## Prerequisites
* Have Zoom enable the DLP for in-meeting chat feature to use this webhook.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
  * The **In-webinar chat message received** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event category.



**Event type**: `webinar.chat_message_sent`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

date_time.description: The date and time at which the chat message was sent.

sender_email.description: The message sender's session email address.

sender_type.description:
The type of user that sent the message: 
* host — The webinar host. 
* alternative-host — The webinar's [alternative host](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/208220166). 
* panelist — A webinar [panelist](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000252726#:~:text=Panelists%20are%20full,a%20webinar%20host.). 
* guest — A webinar guest.

recipient_email.description: The message recipient's email address. Optional only included if it is a private message.

recipient_type.description:
The type of message recipient: 
* everyone — All webinar participants. 
* host — The webinar host. 
* guest — A webinar guest.

message_id.description: The chat message's universally unique identifier (UUID).

message_content.description: The content of the chat message.

requestBody.description:
# user.settings_updated

The **User's settings have been updated** event is triggered every time the settings of one of your app users or account users are updated.

Zoom users can update the settings on their profile manually from the [settings page on the Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/profile/setting). Alternatively, the settings can also be updated by calling the [**Update user settings**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userSettingsUpdate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **User's settings have been updated** subscription must be enabled under the **User** event.



**Event type**: `user.settings_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp, in milliseconds since epoch, at which the event occurred.

operator.description: The email address of the user who [disassociated the user](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269946-Removing-a-user-from-your-account#h_98a81098-0ca3-45ae-8d00-aab235cc781d).

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the settings.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the setting was updated.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account that updated the settings.

operator.description: The email address of the user who [disassociated the user](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269946-Removing-a-user-from-your-account#h_98a81098-0ca3-45ae-8d00-aab235cc781d).

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the settings.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the setting was updated.

schedule_meeting.description: Information about the scheduled meeting settings.

host_video.description: Whether to start meetings with the host video on.

participants_video.description: Whether to start meetings with the participant video on.

audio_type.description: The type of audio used to join the meeting.

join_before_host.description: Whether participants can join the meeting before its host.

force_pmi_jbh_password.description: Whether to require a password for personal meetings if attendees can join before host.

use_pmi_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Use a [PMI (Personal Meeting ID)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937-Using-Personal-Meeting-ID-PMI-) to schedule meeting.

pstn_password_protected.description: Require a password from participants before joining a meeting via [PSTN](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference).

jbh_time.description:
If the value of the join_before_host field is true, this field indicates the time limits within which a participant can join a meeting before the meeting's host:

* 0 — Allow the participant to join the meeting at anytime.
* 5 — Allow the participant to join 5 minutes before the meeting's start time.
* 10 — Allow the participant to join 10 minutes before the meeting's start time.

personal_meeting.description:
The personal meeting settings:
* true — Indicates that the **Enable Personal Meeting ID** setting is enabled. Users can use a personal meeting ID for their meetings.
* false — Indicates that the **Enable Personal Meeting ID** setting is [disabled](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843-Personal-meeting-ID-PMI-and-personal-link#h_aa0335c8-3b06-41bc-bc1f-a8b84ef17f2a). When this setting is **disabled**, meetings that were scheduled with a PMI will be invalid. You must manually update any scheduled meetings.

**For Zoom Phone only:**

If a user has been assigned a desk phone, the desk phone's **Elevate to Zoom Meeting** setting will be disabled.

default_password_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Whether to use the default password for already scheduled meetings.

require_password_for_instant_meetings.description:
Whether a random password will be generated on the end of user who starts the instant meeting. Other meeting participants **must** enter the generated password to join the meeting.

If instant meetings use a PMI, this option is **disabled**.

mute_upon_entry.description: Whether to automatically mute all participants when they join the meeting.

require_password_for_pmi_meetings.description:
Require participants to enter password for PMI meetings:
* jbh_only — Only when a participant joins before the host.
* all — All participants must enter a password to join the meeting.
* none — No password required.

use_pmi_for_instant_meetings.description: Whether PMI is enabled for all instant meetings.

require_password_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Require a passcode for meetings which have already been scheduled

require_password_for_scheduling_new_meet.description:
Whether a password is generated when a meeting host schedules a new meeting. Meeting participants will be required to enter the password before they can join the meeting.

This setting only applies to regular meetings that do **not** use a PMI.

upcoming_meeting_reminder.description: Whether to receive a desktop notification for upcoming meetings.

in_meeting.description: Information about the in meeting settings.

post_meeting_feedback.description: Whether to display a thumbs up or thumbs down feedback survey at the end of each meeting.

allow_users_to_delete_messages_in_meetin.description: If the value of this field is set to true,  allow users to delete messages in the in-meeting chat.

allow_participants_chat_with.description:
Whether participants can chat with certain groups:
* 1 — The participants cannot use chat.
* 2 — Host and co-hosts only.
 * 3 — The participants can chat with other participants publicly.
* 4 - The participants can chat with other participants publicly and privately.

**Note:** This setting is only available with client versions 5.7.3 and above.

allow_users_save_chats.description:
Whether participants can save meeting chats:
* 1 — Participants cannot save meeting chats.
* 2 — Participants can only save host and co-host meeting chats.
* 3 — Participants can save all meeting chats.

private_chat.description: Whether meeting participants can use private chat.

attention_mode_focus_mode.description: Whether the [**Focus Mode**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061113751-Using-focus-mode) feature is enabled. When enabled, this feature only displays the host and co-hosts' video and profile pictures during a meeting.

allow_host_to_enable_focus_mode.description: Whether the host can enable [**Focus Mode**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061113751-Using-focus-mode) when scheduling a meeting.

auto_saving_chat.description: Whether to automatically save all in-meeting chats.

entry_exit_chime.description:
The sound that plays when participants join or leave the meeting:
* host — Chime when host joins or leaves a meeting.
* all — Chime when any participant joins or leaves a meeting.
* none — Do not chime.

record_play_voice.description: When a participant joins by telephone, whether recording and playing the participant's own voice is enabled.

file_transfer.description: Whether file sharing via in-meeting chat is enabled.

feedback.description: Whether users can send feedback to Zoom at the end of the meeting.

co_host.description: Whether to allow the meeting host to add co-hosts.

polling.description: Whether polls are available in the meeting controls.

meeting_polling.description: Information about the account's meeting polling settings.

enable.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a meeting.

advanced_polls.description: Whether the host can create advanced polls and quizzes. Advanced polls and quizzes include single choice, multiple choice, drop down, matching, short answer, long answer, rank order, and fill-in-the-blank questions. Hosts can also set the correct answers for quizzes they create.

require_answers_to_be_anonymous.description: Whether to require answers to be anonymous.

allow_alternative_host_to_add_edit.description: Whether alternative hosts can add or edit polls and quizzes.

allow_host_to_upload_image.description: Whether to allow host to upload an image for each question.

attendee_on_hold.description: Whether hosts can temporarily remove an attendee from a meeting.

annotation.description: Whether participants can use annotation tools to add information to shared screens.

remote_control.description: Whether users can request remote control.

non_verbal_feedback.description: Whether non-verbal feedback through screensharing is enabled.

breakout_room.description: Whether the host can split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms.

breakout_room_schedule.description: Whether the host can assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling. This feature is **only** available in version 4.5.0 or higher.

remote_support.description: Whether the host can provide 1:1 remote support to a participant.
