screen_sharing.description: Whether to allow hosts and participants to share their screen or content during meetings.

who_can_share_screen.description:
The type of user who can share their screen or content during meetings: 
* host — Only hosts can screen share. 
* all — Both hosts and participants can screen share.

who_can_share_screen_when_someone_is_sha.description:
The type of user that can begin sharing their screen when someone else in the meeting is sharing their screen: 
* host — Only hosts can screen share when someone else is sharing. 
* all — Both hosts and participants can screen share when someone else is sharing.

participants_share_simultaneously.description:
Indicates how many participants can screen share at the same time. The value can be one of the following:
one: Only one participant can screen share at a time .
multiple: Multiple participants can screen share simultaneously (dual monitors recommended).

group_hd.description: Whether group HD video is enabled.

far_end_camera_control.description: Whether another user can take control of camera during a meeting.

share_dual_camera.description:
Share dual camera.

This field is **deprecated**.

waiting_room.description: Whether the [Waiting Room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) feature is enabled. When enabled, attendees can only join after the host approves their entry.

virtual_background.description: Whether users can change their background.

virtual_background_settings.description: Information about the virtual background settings.

enable.description: Whether virtual backgrounds are enabled.

allow_videos.description: Whether the use of videos for virtual backgrounds is enabled.

allow_upload_custom.description: Whether users can upload custom backgrounds.

items.description: Information about a virtual background file.

type.description: The file's type.

is_default.description: Whether the file is the default virtual background file.

custom_data_center_regions.description:
Whether custom [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042411451-Selecting-data-center-regions-for-hosted-meetings-and-webinars) are enabled for hosting real-time meeting and webinar traffic: 
* true — Enabled. Provide the data center regions in the data_center_regions field. 
* false — Disabled. Only use the default data center regions.

data_center_regions.description:
The user's selected custom data center regions. This field only returns if the custom_data_center_regions value is true: 
* AU — Australia.
* LA — Latin America. 
* CA — Canada. 
* CN — China. 
* DE — Germany. 
* HK — Hong Kong SAR. 
* IN — India. 
* IE — Ireland. 
* TY — Japan. 
* MX — Mexico. 
* NL — Netherlands. 
* SG — Singapore. 
* US — United States.

enable.description: Whether hosts can assign participants as interpreters to interpret one language into another in real-time.

custom_languages.description: A list of user-defined supported languages.

meeting_reactions.description: Whether meeting participants can [communicate using the emoji reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions) located in the **Reactions** menu in the meeting toolbar.

meeting_reactions_emojis.description:
Choose from the following meeting reaction options:
* all — All emojis: Allow meeting participants to use any emoji available in Zoom chat as a reaction in a meeting.
* selected — Selected emojis: Allow meeting participants to use the 6 standard meeting reaction emojis: Clapping Hands, Thumbs Up, Heart, Tears of Joy, Open Mouth, Party Popper (Tada, Celebration)
x-enum-descriptions: Allow meeting participants to use any emoji available in Zoom chat as a reaction in a meeting.
Allow meeting participants to use the 6 standard meeting reaction emojis: Clapping Hands, Thumbs Up, Heart, Tears of Joy, Open Mouth, Party Popper (Tada, Celebration) .

allow_host_panelists_to_use_audible_clap.description: Whether to allow host and panelist to use audible clap.

webinar_reactions.description: Set this field to true to use [webinar reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4803536268429).

show_a_join_from_your_browser_link.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their browser and bypass the Zoom application download process.

join_from_mobile.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their mobile browser.

join_from_desktop.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their desktop browser.

workplace_by_facebook.description: Whether to allow Workplace by Facebook livestreaming.

enable.description: Whether webinar livestreaming is enabled.

live_streaming_service.description:
The available livestreaming services:
* facebook
* workplace_by_facebook
* youtube
* custom_live_streaming_service

custom_service_instructions.description: The specific instructions to allow your account's meeting hosts to configure a custom livestream.

live_streaming_reminder.description: Whether to notify users to watch the livestream. This does not apply to custom RTMP (real-time messaging protocol).

enable.description: Whether webinar participants can send chat messages.

allow_panelists_chat_with.description:
Webinar panelists can chat with:
* 1 — Host and all panelists.
* 2 — Everyone.

allow_attendees_chat_with.description:
Webinar attendees can chat with:
* 1 — No one.
* 2 — Host and all panelists.
* 3 — Everyone.

default_attendees_chat_with.description:
By default, webinar attendees can chat with:
* 1 — Host and all panelists.
* 2 — Everyone.

allow_panelists_send_direct_message.description: Whether webinar panelists can send direct messages to other panelists.

allow_users_save_chats.description:
Whether webinar attendees can save chats:
* 0 — Attendees cannot save chats.
* 1 — Attendees can only save host and panelist chats.
* 2 — Attendees can save all chats.

allow_auto_save_local_chat_file.description: Whether chat messages are saved automatically to a local file on the host's computer when the webinar ends.

sign_language_interpretation.description: Allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into sign language in real-time. Hosts can assign interpreters when scheduling, or during the meeting itself. This feature is only available with version 5.11.3 or later.

enable.description: Whether to allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into another in real-time.

enable_sign_language_interpretation_by_d.description: Whether to enable sign language interpretation view by default in scheduler.

custom_languages.description: A list of user-defined supported languages.

meeting_question_answer.description: Allow participants to ask questions for the host and participants to answer.

closed_captioning.description: Information about the closed captioning settings.

enable.description: Whether to allow the host to type closed captions or assign a participant or 3rd-party service to provide closed captioning.

third_party_captioning_service.description: Whether to allow the use of an API token to integrate with 3rd-party closed captioning services.

auto_transcribing.description: Whether to allow a live transcription service to transcribe meetings.

view_full_transcript.description: Whether to allow the viewing of full transcripts in the in-meeting side panel.

save_caption.description: Whether to allow participants to save closed captions or transcripts.

slide_control.description: Whether the person sharing during a presentation can allow others to control the slide presentation. This feature is only available in version 5.8.3 or higher.

meeting_survey.description: Whether to allow the host to present a survey to participants once a meeting has ended. This feature is only available in version 5.7.3 or higher.

webinar_polling.description: Information about the account's webinar polling settings.

enable.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a webinar.

advanced_polls.description: Whether the host can create advanced polls and quizzes. Advanced polls and quizzes include single choice, multiple choice, drop down, matching, short answer, long answer, rank order, and fill-in-the-blank questions. Hosts can also set the correct answers for quizzes they create.

require_answers_to_be_anonymous.description: Whether to require answers to be anonymous.

allow_alternative_host_to_add_edit.description: Whether alternative hosts can add or edit polls and quizzes.

allow_host_to_upload_image.description: Whether to allow host to upload an image for each question.

webinar_survey.description: Whether to allow the host to present surveys to attendees once a webinar has ended.

disable_screen_sharing_for_host_meetings.description: Whether the **Disable desktop screen sharing for meetings you host** setting is enabled.

disable_screen_sharing_for_in_meeting_gu.description: Whether the **Disable screen sharing when guests are in the meeting** setting is enabled.

auto_answer.description: Whether the [**Auto-answer group in chat**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203736135-Auto-answering-invitations-to-meetings) setting is enabled.

allow_show_zoom_windows.description: Whether the [**Show Zoom windows during screen share**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061383571-Showing-Zoom-windows-during-screen-share) feature is enabled.

email_notification.description: Information about the email notification settings.

cloud_recording_available_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host when a cloud recording is available.

recording_available_reminder_schedulers.description: Whether to notify the person who scheduled the meeting or webinar for the host when a cloud recording is available.

recording_available_reminder_alternative.description: Whether to notify any alternative hosts when a cloud recording is available.

jbh_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host when participants join the meeting before them.

cancel_meeting_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host and participants when a meeting is canceled.

alternative_host_reminder.description: Whether to notify when an alternative host is added to or removed from a meeting.

schedule_for_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host that there is a meeting is scheduled, rescheduled, or canceled.

local_recording.description: Whether hosts and participants can record the meeting using a local file.

cloud_recording.description: Whether hosts can record and save the meeting or webinar in the cloud.

record_speaker_view.description: Whether recording the active speaker with a shared screen is enabled.

record_gallery_view.description: Whether recording the [gallery view](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000005883-Displaying-Participants-in-Gallery-View) with a shared screen is enabled.

record_audio_file.description: Whether recording an audio-only file is enabled.

save_chat_text.description: Whether saving the chat text from the meeting to the cloud is enabled.

show_timestamp.description: Whether adding a timestamp to the recording is enabled.

recording_audio_transcript.description: Whether automatically transcribing the audio of the meeting or webinar to the cloud is enabled.

auto_recording.description:
The automatic recording setting:
* local — Record locally
* cloud — Record on the cloud.
* none — Disabled.

auto_delete_cmr.description: Whether Zoom will permanently delete recordings automatically after a specified number of days is enabled. The number of days is displayed in the auto_delete_cmr_days field.

auto_delete_cmr_days.description:
When the auto_delete_cmr value is true, this value is the number of days before the auto-deletion of cloud recordings: 
* 30 — 30 days. 
* 60 — 60 days. 
* 90 — 90 days. 
* 120 — 120 days.

record_files_separately.description: The account's [**Record active speaker, gallery view and shared screen separately**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060316092-Changing-basic-and-advanced-cloud-recording-settings#h_01F4CYJTCTXNS2MXH00W9EFG6R) settings.

active_speaker.description: Whether recording only the active speaker is enabled.

gallery_view.description: Whether recording only the gallery view is enabled.

shared_screen.description: Whether recording only shared screen is enabled.

display_participant_name.description: Whether participants' names display in the recording.

recording_thumbnails.description: Whether thumbnails of the presenter are recorded when they are sharing their screen.

optimize_recording_for_3rd_party_video_e.description: Whether recordings will be optimized for a 3rd party video editor. This can increase the file size and the time it takes to generate recording files.

save_panelist_chat.description: Whether panelist chats are saved to the recording.

save_poll_results.description: Whether poll results shared during the meeting or webinar are saved. This also includes poll results shared during the meeting or webinar.

save_close_caption.description: Whether [closed captions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207279736) are saved as a VTT (Video Track Text) file.

record_audio_file_each_participant.description: Whether to record separate audio files for each participant is enabled.

host_pause_stop_recording.description: Whether the meeting's host can pause or stop the cloud's auto recording is enabled.

recording_disclaimer.description: Whether to display a disclaimer to participants before a recording begins is enabled.

ask_participants_to_consent_disclaimer.description: Whether to ask participants for consent when a recording begins is enabled. This is only available when the value of the recording_disclaimer field is set to true.

ask_host_to_confirm_disclaimer.description: Whether to ask the host to confirm the recording disclaimer is enabled.

recording_password_requirement.description: Information about the minimum password requirements for recordings via the Account Recording settings.

have_letter.description: Whether the password must contain at least one alphabetical letter.

have_number.description: Whether the password must contain at least one numeric character.

have_special_character.description: Whether the password must contain at least one special character (for example, !, @, or #).

only_allow_numeric.description: Whether the password must contain **only** numeric characters.

ip_address_access_control.description: Information about the settings to allow cloud recording access only from specific IP address ranges.

enable.description: Whether the cloud recordings of the account can only be accessed by the IP addresses defined in the ip_addresses_or_ranges property.

ip_addresses_or_ranges.description: The IP addresses or ranges that have access to the cloud recordings.

third_party_audio.description: Whether users can join the meeting using an existing third-party audio configuration.

audio_conference_info.description: Information about the third-party audio configuration.

show_international_numbers_link.description: Whether to display the international numbers link on the invitation email.

telephony_regions.description: Information about where most of the participants call into or call from during a meeting.

allowed_values.description: The telephony region options provided by Zoom.

selection_values.description: The account's selected telephony regions that indicates where most of the participants call into or call from during a meeting.

feature.description: Information about the features available to the user.

large_meeting.description: Whether the large meeting feature is enabled.

large_meeting_capacity.description:
The capacity for the user's large meetings:
* 500
* 1000

webinar.description: Whether the user has the Webinar feature.

webinar_capacity.description:
If the user has a Webinar capacity plan subscription, the user's Webinar capacity:
* 100
* 500
* 1000
* 3000
* 5000
* 10000

zoom_events.description: Whether the user has the Zoom Events feature.

zoom_events_capacity.description:
If the user has the Zoom Events feature, the user's Zoom Events plan capacity:
* 500
* 1000
* 3000
* 5000
* 10000
* 20000
* 30000
* 50000

zoom_phone.description: Whether the Zoom Phone feature is enabled.

concurrent_meeting.description:
The user's assigned [Concurrent Meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206122046) type: 
* Basic 
* Plus 
* None 

 **Note:** This feature requires a Concurrent Meeting Basic or Plus plan subscription.

auto_security.description:
Whether to require that all meetings are secured with at least one security option. 

 This setting can only be disabled by Enterprise, ISV, Business (with more than 100 licenses), and Education accounts.

waiting_room.description:
Whether participants are placed in the [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) when they join a meeting. 

 If the **Waiting Room** feature is enabled, the [**Allow participants to join before host**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202828525-Allow-participants-to-join-before-host) setting is automatically disabled.

waiting_room_settings.description: Information about the waiting room settings.

participants_to_place_in_waiting_room.description:
The type of participants to be admitted to the Waiting Room: 
* 0 — All attendees. 
* 1 — Users who are not in your account. 
* 2 — Users who are not in your account and are not part of your [allowed domains list](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037117472-Configuring-authentication-profiles#h_e3cf0d5f-eec7-4c2a-ad29-ef2a5079a7da).

whitelisted_domains_for_waiting_room.description: If the participants_to_place_in_waiting_room field is 2, a comma-separated list of the domains that can bypass the Waiting Room ("example.com,example2.com").

users_who_can_admit_participants_from_wa.description:
The users who can admit participants from the Waiting Room: 
* 0 — Host and co-hosts only. 
* 1 — Host, co-hosts, and anyone who bypassed the Waiting Room if the host and co-hosts are not present.

meeting_password.description: Whether all instant and scheduled meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected. [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937) meetings are **not** included in this setting.

require_password_for_scheduled_meeting.description: Whether to require a password for meetings that have already been scheduled.

pmi_password.description: Whether all Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected.

phone_password.description:
Whether to require a password for participants joining by phone. 

 If enabled and the meeting is password-protected, a numeric password is required for participants to join by phone. For meetings with alphanumeric passwords, a numeric password will be generated.

webinar_password.description: Whether to generate a password when scheduling webinars. Participants must use the generated password to join the scheduled webinar.

require_password_for_scheduled_webinar.description: Whether to require a password for webinars that have already been scheduled.

meeting_password_requirement.description: Information about the meeting and webinar [password requirements](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033559832-Meeting-and-webinar-passwords#h_a427384b-e383-4f80-864d-794bf0a37604).

have_letter.description: Whether the password must contain at least one letter character.

have_number.description: Whether the password must contain at least one numeric character.

have_special_character.description: Whether the password must contain at least one special character. For example, !, @, and/or # characters.

only_allow_numeric.description: Whether the password must contain **only** numeric characters.

have_upper_and_lower_characters.description: Whether the password must include uppercase and lowercase characters.

consecutive_characters_length.description:
The maximum length of consecutive characters (for example, abcdef) allowed in a password: 
* 4 through 8 — The maximum consecutive characters length. The length is n minus 1, where n is the provided value. For example, if you provide the 4 value, there can only be a maximum of 3 consecutive characters in a password (for example, abc1x@8fdh). 
* 0 — Do not apply a consecutive character restriction.

weak_enhance_detection.description: Whether users will be informed when the provided password is weak.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: Whether the meeting password will be encrypted and included in the invitation link. The provided link will allow participants to join the meeting without having to enter the password.

end_to_end_encrypted_meetings.description: Whether to enable end-to-end encryption for meetings. If enabled, you can specify the type of encryption in the encryption_type field.

encryption_type.description:
The type of encryption to use when starting a meeting: 
* enhanced_encryption — Use enhanced encryption. Encryption data is stored in the cloud. 
* e2ee — End-to-end encryption. The encryption key is stored on the local device and cannot be obtained by anyone else. Enabling E2EE also [**disables** certain features](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360048660871), such as cloud recording, live streaming, and allowing participants to join before the host.

block_user_domain.description: Whether to block users in specific domains from joining meetings and webinars.

only_authenticated_can_join_from_webclie.description: Whether to specify that only authenticated users can join the meeting from the web client.

block_user_domain_list.description: The domain to block, up to 20 domains. For example, the *.example.com domain.

tsp.description: Information about the Telephony Service Provider (TSP) settings.

call_out.description: Whether the [**Call Me**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200942859-Joining-meeting-audio-by-phone-call-me-) feature is enabled. When enabled, the user can enter their phone number to join meetings. As a meeting host, the user can use the **Invite by Phone** feature to invite participants to join by phone.

call_out_countries.description: A list of countries and regions to which the user can call out to.

show_international_numbers_link.description: Whether to show the international numbers link in the email invitation.

display_toll_free_numbers.description: Whether hosts can see the toll-free numbers in the email invitation or in the Zoom client.

old_object.description: Information about the user's previous settings.

settings.description: Information about the user's updated settings. This only returns modified settings.

$changed_field_name.description: The updated field name and its previous value.

requestBody.description:
# information_barriers.policy_created

The **Information barriers policy has been created** event is triggered when using an API or web page to add an [information barrier](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers).

An account owner or admin can create information barrier policies. Create an information barrier policy either by using the Create an information barrier policy API, or by logging into the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us) and navigating to the [**Information barrier**](https://zoom.us/account/information_barriers) page.

## Prerequisites

*  To enable information barriers for your account, [contact Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362003).



**Event type**: `information_barriers.policy_created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp when the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the policy.

settings.description:
The information barrier's policy's settings. 
* If the meeting setting is true, then a [hard block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups. 
* If the meeting setting is false but the screen_share, file_transfer, in_meeting_chat, im, and/or recording settings are true, then a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups.

complete_phone_calls.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** call each other.

file_transfer.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** transfer files in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

im.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** IM chat. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

in_meeting_chat.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** use chat in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

meeting.description: If true, the users between groups **cannot** meet. This also creates a [hard block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups.

message_via_sms.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** user SMS.

recording.description:
If true, users between groups **cannot** record the meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false. 

This feature is only available for Zoom Client v5.6.0 and higher.

screen_share.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** share screens in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

status.description:
The information barrier's policy's status: 
* 0 — Disabled. 
* 1 — Enabled.

type.description:
The information barrier's policy's type of settings restrictions: 
* 0 — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists, but users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 
* 1 — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists and only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* 2 — No blocks exist, but only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* 3 — No blocks exist and users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 

This field only supports 0.

requestBody.description:
# account.plan_updated

The **Plan has been updated** event occurs when an account makes updates to an existing base or add-on plan by increasing or decreasing the number of licenses.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* The **Plan has been updated** subscription enabled under the **Billing** event category.



**Event type**: `account.plan_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description:
The user's account ID: 
* For regular Zoom accounts, this value is the ID of the updated account. 
* For reseller partner accounts, this value is the ID of the Master account that updated the sub account's plan.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the account's plan subscription.

object.description: Information about the updated account's plan.

id.description:
The updated account's ID: 
* For regular Zoom accounts, this value is the ID of the updated account. 
* For reseller partner accounts, this value is the ID of the Master account that updated the sub account's plan.

plan_type.description:
The new plan type: 
* base — A [base plan](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#base-plans). 
* addon — An [add-on plan](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#additional-plans).

type.description: The [type](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans) of base or add-on subscription plan.

hosts.description: The number of purchased licenses after the plan update.

$changed_field_name.description: The updated field name and its previous value.

requestBody.description:
# group.updated

The **Group updated** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users update a group. Groups can be updated in the [Zoom web portal](https://support.zoomus/hc/en-us/articles/204519819-Managing-user-groups-and-settings) or via the [**Update a group**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/groupUpdate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Group updated** subscription enabled under the **Group** event.



**Event type**: `group.updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The group's account ID.

operator.description: The email address of the user that updated the group.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that updated the group.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the group was updated, in milliseconds.

old_object.description: Information about the group's previous settings.

$changed_field_name.description: The modified field its original value.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.ended

The **End Meeting** event is triggered every time a meeting host ends the meeting. The host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **End Meeting** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.ended`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

end_time.description: The date and time at which the meeting ended.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_joined_breakout_room

The **Meeting participant has joined a breakout room** event is triggered when a meeting participant joins a meeting [breakout room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005769646-Participating-in-breakout-rooms).

Breakout rooms are sessions that are split off from the main Zoom meeting. They allow the participants to meet in smaller groups and are completely isolated in terms of audio and video from the main session.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting participant has joined a breakout room** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_joined_breakout_room`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the main meeting.

uuid.description: The main meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

breakout_room_uuid.description: The breakout room's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each breakout room instance generates a breakout room UUID.

host_id.description: The main meeting host's user ID.

type.description:
The main meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

parent_user_id.description: The participant's main meeting user ID (user_id).

id.description:
The participant's unique ID. 
 * If meeting registration was **not** required and the participant joined by logging into Zoom, this value is the same as the userId field used in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API. 
* If registration was required for the meeting and the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the same as the id value in the [**List meeting registrants**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrants) API response. 
* If participant joins without logging into Zoom, this returns an empty value. 

**Note:** Use the participant_user_id value instead of this value. We will remove this response in a future release.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

join_time.description: The time at which the participant joined the meeting.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's unique ID. 
 * If meeting registration was **not** required and the participant joined by logging into Zoom, this value is the same as the userId field used in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API. 
* If registration was required for the meeting and the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the same as the id value in the [**List meeting registrants**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrants) API response. 
* If participant joins without logging into Zoom, this returns an empty value.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_left_waiting_room

The **Participant left a waiting room** event is triggered every time a meeting host **does not** admit a participant to the meeting and **removes** the participant from the Waiting Room. This event also triggers if a participant leaves the Waiting Room. The meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

The [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) feature allows the host to control when participants join a meeting. When a participant attempts to join a meeting with this feature enabled, the participant is first admitted to the Waiting Room.
The meeting host can then admit attendees one by one or hold all attendees in the waiting room and admit them all at once.

## Prerequisites

* The [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) feature enabled for the meeting.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The "**Participant left a waiting room**" subscription must be enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_left_waiting_room`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

participant.description: Information about the meeting participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, email returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

date_time.description: The time at which the participant joined the meeting.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.registration_cancelled

The **Meeting Registration has been canceled** event is triggered every time a registration is canceled for a meeting. The meeting host should be a user on your account or a user of your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

A host with the Pro user type can enable the **Registration** feature when scheduling or updating a meeting. By [enabling registration for meetings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Registration-for-Meetings), participants must fill out a registration form receive information about joining the meeting.

Meeting attendees can cancel their registration at any time. A meeting host can also cancel an attendee's meeting invitation via the [Zoom web portal](https://zoom.us). To do this, navigate to the scheduled meeting's page and click **Edit** next to the **Manage Attendees** section. The **Approved** section will display all approved attendees. Select the attendee whose meeting registration you want to revoke and click **Cancel Registration**.

To programmatically cancel a registration, use the [**Update registrant's status**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrantStatus) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Registration has been canceled** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.registration_cancelled`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who canceled the meeting registration.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who canceled the meeting registration.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

# meeting.started

The **Start Meeting** event is triggered every time a meeting host starts a meeting. The meeting host must either be a user on your account or a user of your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

A meeting host can [start a meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362423-How-do-I-Start-or-Join-a-Scheduled-Meeting-as-the-Host-) from the Zoom desktop client for Mac, PC or Linux, the Zoom app for Android or iOS, a web browser, or an H.323 or SIP device.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Start Meeting** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.started`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

# account.updated

The **Account/Sub Account's profile has been updated** event is triggered every time the [profile](https://zoom.us/account) of an account or a sub account is updated.

An account owner or a user with administrator privileges can update a Zoom account's profile. The account profile can be updated by logging into the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/) and editing fields in the [**Account Profile**](https://zoom.us/account) interface.

The account must belong to you or a user of your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher [plan](https://zoom.us/pricing).
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Account/Sub Account's profile has been updated** subscription enabled under the **Account** event.



**Event type**: `account.updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account's owner.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the account.

operation.description:
This field only returns for the following operations: 
* apply_vanity_url 
* managed_domains_added 
* managed_domains_deleted 
* managed_domains_verifying

account_support_name.description: The account's updated name for account support.

account_support_email.description: The account's updated email address for account support.

old_object.description: Information about the account's previous profile settings.

$changed_field_name.description: The updated field name and its previous value.

# meeting.participant_left

The **Participant/Host left meeting** event is triggered every time an attendee leaves a meeting. A meeting attendee is a meeting participant or the host. The meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant/Host left meeting** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_left`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

participant.description: Information about the meeting participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, email returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value. 

**Note:** Use the participant_user_id value instead of this value. We will remove this response in a future release.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

leave_time.description: The time at which the participant left the meeting.

leave_reason.description:
The reason why the participant left the meeting, where $name is the participant's username: 
* $name left the meeting. 
* $name got disconnected from the meeting. 
* Host ended the meeting. 
* Host closed the meeting. 
* Host started a new meeting. 
* Network connection error. 
* Host did not join. 
* Exceeded free meeting minutes limit. 
* Removed by host. 
* Unknown reason. 
* Leave waiting room. 
* Removed by host from waiting room.
enum: Removed by host from waiting room.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

customer_key.description: The participant's SDK identifier. This value can be alphanumeric.

participant.leave_reason:
Jill Chill left the meeting.
Reason: Host ended the meeting.

# user.created

The **User has been created** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users adds another user to the account.

Admins and account owners can add new users to an account. The user can be added either from the [Zoom Web Portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363183-User-Management#h_335dcf54-d106-4c8d-8533-68e2fc3d20a6) or by using the [**Create users**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userCreate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **User has been created** subscription must be enabled under the **User** event.



**Event type**: `user.created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the user.

operator.description: The email address of the user who created the new user.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that created the new user.

creation_type.description:
The method used to create the new user: 
* create 
* ssoCreate 
* autoCreate 
* custCreate

type.description:
The type of user: 
* 1 — Basic. 
* 2 — Licensed.

requestBody.description:
# account.plan_subscribed

The **Account has subscribed to a new plan** event occurs when a free or a new account subscribes to a billing plan for the first time.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* The **Account has subscribed to a new plan** subscription enabled under the **Billing** event category.



**Event type**: `account.plan_subscribed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description:
The user's account ID: 
* For regular Zoom accounts, this value is the ID of the account subscribed to the new plan. 
* For reseller partner accounts, this value is the ID of the Master account that subscribed the sub account to the new plan.

operator.description: The email address of the user who subscribed the account's new plan.

object.description: Information about the updated account's plan.

id.description:
The updated account's ID: 
* For regular Zoom accounts, this value is the ID of the account subscribed to the new plan. 
* For reseller partner accounts, this value is the ID of the Master account that subscribed the sub account to the new plan.

plan_type.description:
The new plan type: 
* base — A [base plan](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#base-plans). 
* addon — An [add-on plan](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans#additional-plans).

type.description: The [type](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/plans) of base or add-on subscription plan.

requestBody.description:
# information_barriers.policy_deleted

The **Information barriers policy has been deleted** event is triggered when using an API or web page to delete an [information barrier](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers).

An account owner or admin can create information barrier policies. Delete an information barrier policy either by using the Remove an information barrier policy API, or by logging into the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us) and navigating to the [**Information barrier**](https://zoom.us/account/information_barriers) page.


## Prerequisites

* To enable information barriers for your account, [contact Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362003).



**Event type**: `information_barriers.policy_deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp when the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who deleted the policy.

settings.description:
The information barriers policy's settings. 
* If the meeting setting is true, then a [hard block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups. 
* If the meeting setting is false but the screen_share, file_transfer, in_meeting_chat, im, and/or recording settings are true, then a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups.

complete_phone_calls.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** call each other.

file_transfer.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** transfer files in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

im.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** IM chat. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

in_meeting_chat.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** use chat in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

meeting.description: If true, the users between groups **cannot** meet. This also creates a [hard block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups.

message_via_sms.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** user SMS.

recording.description:
If true, users between groups **cannot** record the meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false. 

This feature is only available for Zoom Client v5.6.0 and higher.

screen_share.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** share screens in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

status.description:
The information barrier's policy's status: 
* 0 — Disabled. 
* 1 — Enabled.

type.description:
The information barrier's policy's type of settings restrictions: 
* 0 — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists, but users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 
* 1 — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists and only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* 2 — No blocks exist, but only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* 3 — No blocks exist and users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 

This field only supports 0.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.sharing_started

The **Webinar Sharing Started** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users share their screen during a Webinar.

Zoom supports [screen sharing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362153-Screen-Sharing-and-Annotations) by host or panelists on desktop, tablet and mobile devices running Zoom during Webinars.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Webinar Sharing Started** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.sharing_started`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's webinar user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a webinar and is only valid for the duration of the webinar.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the webinar **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

content.description:
The type of shared content: 
* application — An application. For example, a web browser. 
* whiteboard — The [classic whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205677665-Sharing-a-whiteboard). 
* desktop — A user's desktop. 
* airplay — A user's [AirPlay (Apple screen mirroring)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204726885-Sharing-screen-using-Apple-screen-mirroring-AirPlay-). 
* camera — A user's camera. 
* unknown — An unrecognized application, such as a third party app.

link_source.description:
The Dropbox sharing method: 
* deep_link — A [deep link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_linking). 
* in_meeting — A link shared via Zoom. 
* An empty string value if the link source is **not** a Dropbox link.

file_link.description: The Dropbox file's link. This field returns an empty string value if the file link is **not** from a Dropbox source.

date_time.description: The screenshare's date and time.

source.description:
The source from which the file was shared: 
* dropbox — A Dropbox source. 
* An empty string value if the source is **not** Dropbox.

requestBody.description:
# group.member_deleted

The **Group member deleted** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users delete members in a group. Group members can be removed in the [Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204519819-Managing-user-groups-and-settings#h_a96c2cc7-224b-4a02-9c35-c7b7fea8508a) or via the [**Delete group members**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/groupMembersDelete) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Group member deleted** subscription enabled under the **Group** event.



**Event type**: `group.member_deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The group's account ID.

operator.description: The email address of the user that removed members from the group.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that removed members from the group.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the group's members were deleted, in milliseconds.

members.description: Information about the members removed from the group.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.registration_created

The **Meeting Registration has been created** event is triggered every time a user [registers](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Registration-for-Meetings) for a meeting.

A host with the Pro user type can enable the **Registration** feature when scheduling or updating a meeting. By [enabling registration for meetings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Registration-for-Meetings), participants must fill out a registration form receive information about joining the meeting. You can also programmatically register a participant via the [**Add Meeting Registrant**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrantCreate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Registration has been created** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.registration_created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

zip.description: The registrant's ZIP or postal code.

purchasing_time_frame.description:
The registrant's purchasing time frame: 
* Within a month 
* 1-3 months 
* 4-6 months 
* More than 6 months 
* No timeframe 
* An empty string. — No purchasing time frame set.

role_in_purchase_process.description:
The registrant's role in the purchase process: 
* Decision Maker 
* Evaluator/Recommender 
* Influencer 
* Not involved 
* An empty string. — No role set.

no_of_employees.description:
The registrant's number of employees: 
* 1-20 
* 21-50 
* 51-100 
* 101-250 
* 251-500 
* 501-1,000 
* 1,001-5,000 
* 5,001-10,000 
* More than 10,000 
* An empty string. — No employee number set.

title.description: The title of the custom question.

value.description: The custom question's response value. This has a limit of 128 characters.

status.description:
The registrant's registration approval status: 
* approve — Approved registrant. 
* pending — Registration approval pending.

join_url.description: The URL to join the meeting.

participant_pin_code.description: The participant PIN code is used to authenticate audio participants before they join the meeting.

custom_questions.title: What do you hope to learn from this meeting?
custom_questions.value: Look forward to learning how you come up with new recipes and what other services you offer.

requestBody.description:
# user.deactivated

The **User has been deactivated** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users gets deactivated.

Admins and account owners can deactivate users in a Zoom account as well as activate the previously deactivated users. Deactivated users cannot log into their Zoom account and they do not have access to utilize any of the Zoom features. Users can be deactivated either from the [Zoom Web Portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269946-Remove-User-from-your-Account#h_6a9bc1c3-d739-4945-b1f2-00b3b88fb5cc) or by using the [**Update user status**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userStatus) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **User has been deactivated** subscription must be enabled under the **User** event.



**Event type**: `user.deactivated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account from which the user was deactivated.

operator.description: The email address of the user that deactivated the user.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that deactivated the user.

type.description:
The type of user: 
* 1 — Basic. 
* 2 — Licensed.

requestBody.description:
# recording.recovered

This event is triggered when a user recovers a recording from the trash.

Zoom allows users to recover their cloud recordings from the trash within 30 days of deletion. You can recover a deleted cloud recording via the [**Recordings**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/216378863-Recover-a-Deleted-Cloud-Recording) tab in the Zoom web client or via the [**Recover meeting recordings**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/recordingStatusUpdate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording files have been recovered from trash** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.recovered`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

download_token.description:
Use the generated token value with the download_url value to download the cloud recording via an [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app). The download token only lasts for 24 hours after its creation and you can only download the file within 24 hours of receiving the event notification. You can either include the download_token as a query parameter or pass it as a Bearer token in the Authorization header of your HTTP request: 

 **Using an Authorization header (Recommended)** 

 
curl --request GET \
  --url {download_url} \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {download_token} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
 

**Using a query parameter** 

 
{download_url}/?access_token={download_token}
 

 For example: https://zoom.us/recording/download/123456?access_token=abcdefgh

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that completed the meeting or webinar recording.

operator.description: The email address of the user who recovered the recording.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who recovered the recording.

object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that completed the meeting or webinar recording.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

share_url.description: The URL at which approved users can view the recording.

total_size.description: The recording file's total size, in bytes.

recording_count.description: The number of recovered recording files.

recording_files.description: Information about the recovered recording files.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which recording ended.

file_type.description: The file type of the recording file.

file_size.description: The recording file's size, in bytes.

file_extension.description: The file extension type of the recording file.

play_url.description: The URL at which the recording file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL at which to download the the recording. 

 **JWT apps** 

 To access a private or password-protected cloud recording of a user in your account, use a [Zoom JWT app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-jwt-app). Use the generated JWT token as the value of the access_token query parameter and include this query parameter at the end of the URL. 

 https://{{base-domain}}/recording/download/{{path-to-file-download}}?access_token={{JWT-token}} 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains recording scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the file. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/archive/download/xxx?access_token={{OAuth-access-token}}.  

**Note:** We recommend that you send the access_token as a Bearer token in the Authorization header, for example: "Authorization": "Bearer <ACCESS_TOKEN>”.

status.description:
The recording file's processing status: 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

recording_type.description:
The recording file type. 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view(CC) 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view 
* shared_screen_with_gallery_view 
* gallery_view 
* shared_screen 
* audio_only 
* audio_transcript 
* chat_file 
* active_speaker 
* host_video 
* audio_only_each_participant 
* cc_transcript 
* closed_caption 
* poll 
* timeline 
* thumbnail 
* audio_interpretation 
* summary 
* summary_next_steps 
* summary_smart_chapters 
*sign_interpretation 
*production_studio 

For more information, read our [Managing and sharing cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Managing-and-sharing-cloud-recordings#h_9898497b-e736-4980-a749-d55608f10773) documentation.

participant_audio_files.description: Information about the recovered participants' recording files.

file_size.description: The size of the recording file, in bytes.

play_url.description: The URL at which the recording file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL at which to download the the recording. 

 **JWT apps** 

 To access a private or password-protected cloud recording of a user in your account, use a [Zoom JWT app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-jwt-app). Use the generated JWT token as the value of the access_token query parameter and include this query parameter at the end of the URL. 

 https://{{base-domain}}/recording/download/{{path-to-file-download}}?access_token={{JWT-token}} 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains recording scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the file. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/archive/download/xxx?access_token={{OAuth-access-token}} 

 **Note:** This field does **not** return for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). Instead, this API will return the file_path field.

file_path.description:
The file path to the On-Premise account recording. 

 **Note:** This API returns this field for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). It does **not** return the download_url field.

status.description:
The participant audio file's processing status: 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

requestBody.description:
# group.created

The **Group created** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users creates a group. Groups can be added in the [Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204519819-Managing-user-groups-and-settings#h_1e8d02d6-3ab6-4084-81e1-27e47864f262) or via the [**Create a group**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/groupCreate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Group created** subscription enabled under the **Group** event.



**Event type**: `group.created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The group's account ID.

operator.description: The email address of the user that created the group.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that created the group.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the group was created, in milliseconds.

requestBody.description:
# recording.cloud_storage_usage_updated

The **Recording Cloud Storage Usage Updated** event is triggered every time storage usage changes.

States such as recording completed, trashed, or recovered trigger this event.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Enable Cloud recording on the users' account.
* Enable **Event Subscriptions** for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording Cloud Storage Usage Updated** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.cloud_storage_usage_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp when the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the host who recorded the webinar.

max_exceed_date.description: The maximum date that overage storage.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.sharing_ended

The **Meeting Sharing Ended** event is triggered every time an attendee or a host stops sharing their screen during a Zoom meeting. The meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

Zoom allows [screen sharing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362153-Screen-Sharing-and-Annotations) by host and attendees on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices running Zoom during meetings.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Sharing Ended** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.sharing_ended`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

content.description:
The type of shared content: 
* application — An application. For example, a web browser. 
* whiteboard — The [classic whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205677665-Sharing-a-whiteboard). 
* desktop — A user's desktop. 
* airplay — A user's [AirPlay (Apple screen mirroring)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204726885-Sharing-screen-using-Apple-screen-mirroring-AirPlay-). 
* camera — A user's camera. 
* unknown — An unrecognized application, such as a third party app.

link_source.description:
The Dropbox sharing method: 
* deep_link — A [deep link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_linking). 
* in_meeting — A link shared via Zoom. 
* An empty (””) value if the link source is **not** a Dropbox link.

file_link.description: The Dropbox file's link. This field returns an empty (””) value if the file link is **not** from a Dropbox source.

date_time.description: The screenshare's date and time.

source.description:
The source from which the file was shared: 
* dropbox — A Dropbox source. 
* An empty (””) value if the source is **not** Dropbox.

requestBody.description:
# group.settings_updated

The **Group's setting updated** event is triggered when a Group's [settings](https://zoom.us/account/group/{groupId}/setting) are updated. Account owners or users can update group settings.
## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** are enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The "**Group's setting updated**" subscription enabled under the **Group** event.



**Event type**: `group.settings_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that updated the group's settings.

operator.description: The email address of the user that updated the group's settings.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that updated the group's settings.

object.description: Information about the group's updated settings.

toll_free_and_fee_based_toll_call.description: The group's [**Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060950711-Enabling-Toll-free-and-Fee-based-Toll-Call#h_01F51844DRCX3K7BRTMZ40381R) settings.
