allow_webinar_attendees_dial.description: Whether webinar attendees can dial in through the group's **Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call** phone numbers. This feature is only available with version 5.2.2 or later.

enable.description: Whether the group has the [**Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060950711-Enabling-Toll-free-and-Fee-based-Toll-Call#h_01F51844DRCX3K7BRTMZ40381R) setting enabled.

numbers.description: The group's **Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call** phone number information.

alternative_host_reminder.description: Whether alternative hosts receive an email when they are added or removed to a meeting.

cancel_meeting_reminder.description: Whether meeting participants and hosts receive a notification when the meeting is canceled.

cloud_recording_available_reminder.description: Whether the host is notified when a cloud recording is available.

jbh_reminder.description: Whether the host is notified when participants join the meeting before them.

recording_available_reminder_alternative.description: Whether to notify any alternative hosts when a cloud recording is available.

recording_available_reminder_schedulers.description: Whether to notify the person who scheduled the meeting or webinar for the host when a cloud recording is available.

schedule_for_reminder.description: Notify the host there is a meeting is scheduled, rescheduled, or canceled.

alert_guest_join.description: Whether participants that belong to your account can see that a guest (someone who does not belong to your account) is participating in the meeting.

allow_users_to_delete_messages_in_meetin.description: If the value of this field is set to true,  allow users to delete messages in the in-meeting chat.

allow_participants_chat_with.description:
Whether participants can only chat with certain groups: 
* 1 — Participants cannot use chat. 
* 2 — Host and co-hosts only. 
* 3 — Participants can chat with other participants publicly. 
* 4 - Participants can chat with other participants publicly and privately. 

**Note:** This setting is only available with client versions 5.7.3 and above.

allow_show_zoom_windows.description: Whether Zoom windows display screen share.

allow_users_save_chats.description:
Whether participants can save meeting chats: 
* 1 — Participants cannot save meeting chats. 
* 2 — Participants can only save host and co-host meeting chats. 
* 3 — Participants can save all meeting chats.

annotation.description: Whether meeting participants can use annotation tools to add information to shared screens.

auto_answer.description: Whether users can view and add contacts to the [**Auto-answer group in chat**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203736135-Auto-answering-invitations-to-meetings) feature. Calls from members of the **Auto Answer Group** will be automatically answered the user.

auto_saving_chat.description: Whether all in-meeting chats are automatically saved.

breakout_room.description: Whether hosts can split meeting participants into [breakout rooms](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206476093-Enabling-breakout-rooms).

breakout_room_schedule.description: Whether hosts can assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling. This feature is **only** available in version 4.5.0 or higher.

chat.description: Whether meeting participants can send chat messages that are visible to all participants.

meeting_question_answer.description: Allow participants to ask questions for the host and participants to answer.

closed_caption.description: Whether the host can type closed captions or assign a participant/third party device to add closed captions.

closed_captioning.description: Information about the group's closed captioning settings.

auto_transcribing.description: Whether live transcription services are allowed to transcribe meetings.

enable.description: Whether the host can type closed captions or assign a participant/third party device to add closed captions.

save_caption.description: Whether participants can save closed captions or transcripts.

third_party_captioning_service.description: Whether the use of an API token to integrate with third-party closed captioning services is enabled.

view_full_transcript.description: Whether participants can view full transcripts in the in-meeting side panel.

co_host.description: Whether the host can add co-hosts. Co-hosts have the same in-meeting controls as the host.

custom_data_center_regions.description: Whether to display the custom [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042411451-Selecting-data-center-regions-for-hosted-meetings-and-webinars) selected for meetings hosted by this group.

custom_service_instructions.description: The specific instructions to allow your account's meeting hosts to configure a custom livestream.

data_center_regions.description:
If the value of custom_data_center_regions is true, a comma-separated list of the following [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360059254691-Datacenter-abbreviation-list) to opt in to: 
* AU — Australia.
* LA — Latin America. 
* CA — Canada. 
* CN — China. 
* DE — Germany. 
* HK — Hong Kong SAR. 
* IN — India. 
* IE — Ireland. 
* TY — Japan. 
* MX — Mexico. 
* NL — Netherlands. 
* SG — Singapore. 
* US — United States.

disable_screen_sharing_for_host_meetings.description: Whether the [**Disable desktop screen sharing for meetings you host**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037710871-Disabling-desktop-screen-sharing-in-meetings) setting is enabled.

disable_screen_sharing_for_in_meeting_gu.description: Whether the **Disable screen sharing when guests are in the meeting** setting is enabled.

e2e_encryption.description: Whether all meetings are required to use [End-to-end (E2EE) encryption](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360048660871-End-to-end-E2EE-encryption-for-meetings).

entry_exit_chime.description: Whether a chime plays when participants join or leave the meeting.

far_end_camera_control.description: Whether other users are allowed to take control of the camera during a meeting.

feedback.description: Whether users can provide feedback to Zoom at the end of the meeting.

file_transfer.description: Whether the in-meeting [**Send files via meeting chat**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/209605493-In-meeting-file-transfer) setting is enabled.

group_hd.description: Whether higher quality video is enabled for hosts and participants.

join_from_desktop.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their desktop browser.

join_from_mobile.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their mobile browser.

custom_languages.description: A list of the user-defined supported languages.

enable_language_interpretation_by_defaul.description: Whether enable language interpretation by default.

allow_participants_to_speak_in_listening.description: Whether to allow participants to speak in listening channel.

allow_up_to_25_custom_languages_when_sch.description: Whether to allow up to 25 custom languages when scheduling meetings.

enable.description: Whether hosts can assign participants as interpreters who can interpret one language into another in real-time.

sign_language_interpretation.description: Allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into sign language in real-time. Hosts can assign interpreters when scheduling, or during the meeting itself. This feature is only available with version 5.11.3 or later.

enable.description: Whether to allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into another in real-time.

enable_sign_language_interpretation_by_d.description: Whether to enable sign language interpretation view by default in scheduler.

custom_languages.description: A list of user-defined supported languages.

allow_to_type.description: Whether the host can manually caption or let the host assign a participant to provide manual captioning.

full_transcript.description: Whether to enable the viewing of full transcripts in the in-meeting side panel.

save_captions.description:
Whether participants can [save closed captions or transcripts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060958752). 

**Note:** If the full_transcript field is set to false, participants **cannot** save captions.

third_party_captioning_service.description: Whether the use of an API token to integrate with a [third-party device](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002212983) for closed captioning is enabled.

meeting_polling.description: Information about the account's meeting polling settings.

advanced_polls.description: Whether hosts can create advanced polls and quizzes. Advanced polls and quizzes include single choice, multiple choice, drop down, matching, short answer, long answer, rank order, and fill-in-the-blank questions. Hosts can also set the correct answers for quizzes they create.

require_answers_to_be_anonymous.description: Whether to require answers to be anonymous.

allow_alternative_host_to_add_edit.description: Whether alternative hosts can add or edit polls and quizzes.

manage_saved_polls_and_quizzes.description: Whether to allow users to manage saved polls and quizzes from Meetings

allow_host_to_upload_image.description: Whether to allow host to upload an image for each question.

enable.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a meeting.

meeting_reactions.description: Whether meeting participants can [communicate using the emoji reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions) located in the **Reactions** menu in the meeting toolbar.

meeting_reactions_emojis.description:
Choose from the following meeting reaction options:
* all — All emojis: Allow meeting participants to use any emoji available in Zoom chat as a reaction in a meeting.
* selected — Selected emojis: Allow meeting participants to use the 6 standard meeting reaction emojis: Clapping Hands, Thumbs Up, Heart, Tears of Joy, Open Mouth, Party Popper (Tada, Celebration)
x-enum-descriptions: Allow meeting participants to use any emoji available in Zoom chat as a reaction in a meeting.
Allow meeting participants to use the 6 standard meeting reaction emojis: Clapping Hands, Thumbs Up, Heart, Tears of Joy, Open Mouth, Party Popper (Tada, Celebration) .

allow_host_panelists_to_use_audible_clap.description: Whether to allow host and panelist to use audible clap.

webinar_reactions.description: Set this field to true to use [webinar reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4803536268429).

meeting_survey.description: Whether the host can present a survey to participants once a meeting has ended. This feature is only available in version 5.7.3 or higher.

non_verbal_feedback.description: Whether meeting participants can provide nonverbal feedback and express opinions by clicking on icons in the **Participants** panel.

only_host_view_device_list.description: Whether to display the list of [H.323/SIP devices](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363273) available to the host.

original_audio.description: Whether users can toggle the [**Use Original Audio**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115003279466-Using-and-preserving-original-sound-in-a-meeting) setting during a meeting.

polling.description: Whether the [**Polls**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4412324684685) feature is included in the meeting controls. This allows the host to survey the attendees.

post_meeting_feedback.description: Whether an [post-meeting feedback survey](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4404969060621-Post-meeting-survey-and-reporting) is enabled for the end of each meeting.

private_chat.description: Whether meeting participants can send private 1:1 chat message other meeting participants.

record_play_own_voice.description: Whether to allow participants who join by telephone to record and play their own voice as entry and exit chimes.

remote_control.description: During screen sharing, whether the person who is presenting can let others control the shared content.

remote_support.description: Whether the meeting host can provide 1:1 remote support to another participant.

request_permission_to_unmute.description: Whether the [**Request permission to unmute participants**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203435537-Muting-and-unmuting-participants-in-a-meeting#h_01EGK4XFWS1SJGZ71MYGKF7260) setting is enabled.

screen_sharing.description: Whether hosts and participants can share their screen or content during meetings.

sending_default_email_invites.description: Whether users can invite participants by email only by default.

show_a_join_from_your_browser_link.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their browser and bypass the Zoom application download process. This is useful for participants who cannot download, install, or run applications. Note that the meeting experience from the browser is limited.

show_device_list.description: Whether the available [H.323/SIP devices](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363273) are visible to users.

show_meeting_control_toolbar.description: Whether to always display the meeting controls toolbar during a meeting.

slide_control.description: Whether the person sharing during a presentation can allow others to control the slide presentation. This feature is only available in version 5.8.3 or higher.

stereo_audio.description: Whether users can select stereo audio during a meeting.

unchecked_data_center_regions.description:
If the value of custom_data_center_regions is true, a comma-separated list of the following [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360059254691-Datacenter-abbreviation-list) to **not** opt in to: 
* EU — Europe. 
* HK — Hong Kong. 
* AU — Australia. 
* IN — India. 
* LA — Latin America. 
* TY — Tokyo. 
* CN — China. 
* US — United States. 
* CA — Canada.

use_html_format_email.description: Whether HTML formatting is allowed for meeting invitations scheduled with the Outlook plugin.

virtual_background_settings.description: Information about the Virtual Background settings.

allow_upload_custom.description: Whether users can upload custom Virtual Backgrounds.

allow_videos.description: Whether users can upload videos for Virtual Backgrounds.

enable.description: Whether the [**Virtual Background**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/210707503-Changing-your-Virtual-Background-image) feature is enabled.

files.description: Information about the Virtual Background files.

is_default.description: Whether the file is a default Virtual Background file.

type.description: The file type.

waiting_room.description: Whether participants cannot join a meeting until the host admits them from the waiting room.

allow_attendees_chat_with.description:
The webinar attendees' chat permissions: 
* 1 — Attendees cannot use chat. 
* 2 — Attendees can only chat with the host and panelists. 
* 3 — Attendees can chat with everyone.

allow_auto_save_local_chat_file.description: Whether chat messages are automatically saved to a local file on the host's computer when the webinar ends.

allow_panelists_chat_with.description:
The webinar panelists chat permissions: 
* 1 — Panelists can only chat with the host and panelists. 
* 2 — The panelists can chat with everyone.

allow_panelists_send_direct_message.description: Whether webinar panelists can send direct messages to other panelists.

allow_users_save_chats.description:
Whether webinar attendees can save chats: 
* 0 — Attendees cannot save chats. 
* 1 — Attendees can only save host and panelist chats. 
* 2 — Attendees can save all chats.

default_attendees_chat_with.description:
By default, webinar attendees can chat with: 
* 1 — Host and all panelists. 
* 2 — Everyone.

enable.description: Whether in-webinar chat is enabled.

custom_service_instructions.description: The specific instructions to allow your account's meeting hosts to configure a custom livestream.

enable.description: Whether webinar livestreaming is enabled.

live_streaming_reminder.description: Whether users are notified to watch the livestream. This does not apply to custom RTMP (real-time messaging protocol).

live_streaming_service.description:
The available livestreaming services: 
* facebook 
* workplace_by_facebook 
* youtube 
* custom_live_streaming_service

advanced_polls.description: Whether hosts can create advanced polls and quizzes. Advanced polls and quizzes include single choice, multiple choice, drop down, matching, short answer, long answer, rank order, and fill-in-the-blank questions. Hosts can also set the correct answers for quizzes they create.

require_answers_to_be_anonymous.description: Whether to require answers to be anonymous.

allow_alternative_host_to_add_edit.description: Whether alternative hosts can add or edit polls and quizzes.

manage_saved_polls_and_quizzes.description: Whether to allow users to manage saved polls and quizzes from Meetings

allow_host_to_upload_image.description: Whether to allow host to upload an image for each question.

enable.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a webinar.

webinar_question_answer.description: Whether attendees can ask the host and panelists questions in the webinar.

webinar_survey.description: Whether the host can present surveys to attendees once a webinar has ended.

whiteboard.description: Whether participants can share a whiteboard that includes annotation tools.

who_can_share_screen.description:
The users who share their screen or content during meetings: 
* host — Only the host can share their screen. 
* all — Hosts and panelists can share their screen. Attendees **cannot** share their screen.

who_can_share_screen_when_someone_is_sha.description:
The users who can start sharing screen when someone else in the meeting is sharing their screen: 
* host — Only the host can share the screen when someone else is sharing. 
* all — Hosts and panelists can share their screen when someone else is sharing. Attendees **cannot** share their screen when someone else is sharing.

participants_share_simultaneously.description:
Indicates how many participants can screen share at the same time. The value can be one of the following:
one: Only one participant can screen share at a time .
multiple: Multiple participants can screen share simultaneously (dual monitors recommended).

workplace_by_facebook.description: Whether Workplace by Facebook is enabled.

allow_users_contact_support_via_chat.description: Whether the [**Allow users to contact Zoom's Support via Chat**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360059513751-Allowing-users-to-contact-Zoom-Support-via-Chat) setting is enabled.

blur_snapshot.description: Whether iOS blurs screenshots in the task switcher when multiple apps are open. Android hides the screenshot in the system-level list of recent apps.

allow_host_to_enable_social_share_button.description: Allow host to enable "Show social share buttons on registration page"

recording_storage_location.description: Information about the group's [**Communications Content Storage**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360050781131) settings.

allowed_values.description: A list of the countries where the group's recorded content is stored.

account_user_access_recording.description: Whether cloud recordings are accessible to account members.

archive.description: The group's [Meeting and Webinar Archiving solution](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360050431572-Archiving-Meeting-and-Webinar-data) settings.

enable.description: Whether the **Meeting and Webinar Archiving solution** feature is enabled. This feature must be enabled for your account by [Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362003).

audio_file.description: Whether audio is included in the archive.

cc_transcript_file.description: Whether closed captions are included in the archive.

chat_file.description: Whether chat files are included in the archive.

chat_with_sender_email.description: Whether user emails are included in the chat file.

video_file.description: Whether video is included in the archive.

type.description:
The type archiving: 
* 1 — Only archive meetings. 
* 2 — Only archive webinars. 
* 3 — Archive both meetings and webinars.

auto_recording.description: Whether meetings are automatically recorded when they begin.

cloud_recording.description: Whether hosts can record and save the meetings and webinars in the cloud.

cloud_recording_download.description: Whether anyone with a link to the cloud recording can download the file.

cloud_recording_download_host.description: Whether the host with a link to the cloud recording can download the file.

display_participant_name.description: Whether participants' names display in the recording.

host_delete_cloud_recording.description: Whether the host can delete cloud recordings. If false, only the admin can delete cloud recordings.

ip_address_access_control.description: Information about the cloud recording access from specific IP address ranges.

enable.description: Whether cloud recording access is only available for a specific range of IP addresses.

ip_addresses_or_ranges.description: The IP addresses or ranges with access to the cloud recordings.

local_recording.description: Whether hosts and participants can record meetings to a local file.

optimize_recording_for_3rd_party_video_e.description: Whether recordings are optimized for a third-party video editor. This can increase the file size and the time it takes to generate recording files.

prevent_host_access_recording.description: Whether meeting hosts do not have access to their meeting cloud recordings. Only the admins who have recording management privilege can access them.

record_audio_file.description: Whether a single audio file is recorded for all participants.

record_audio_file_each_participant.description: Whether a separate audio file is recorded of each participant. This only supports the first 200 participant speakers' audio files.

record_files_separately.description: The account's [**Record active speaker, gallery view and shared screen separately**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060316092-Changing-basic-and-advanced-cloud-recording-settings#h_01F4CYJTCTXNS2MXH00W9EFG6R) settings.

active_speaker.description: Whether recording only the active speaker is enabled.

gallery_view.description: Whether recording only the gallery view is enabled.

shared_screen.description: Whether recording only shared screen is enabled.

record_gallery_view.description: Whether the active speaker displays in the top right corner of a shared screen when someone is sharing their screen.

record_speaker_view.description: Whether to record the active speaker when screen sharing is active.

recording_audio_transcript.description: Whether the automatic transcription of a meeting or webinar's audio for cloud recordings is enabled.

smart_recording.description: By selecting this option, your recording will have meeting smart chapters, and next steps. You are directing Zoom to access, process, and use your account's recording data for the purpose of analysis and insights.

create_recording_highlights.description: By selecting this option, meeting details in the audio transcript will be highlighted. Hosts can modify highlighted sections and generate a video summary (highlighted sections may have a 3-second offset) based on these sections. The summary is for informational purposes only and may not be complete.

create_smart_chapters.description: By selecting this option, your recording will have chapters with overview. Hosts can edit the chapters.

create_next_steps.description: By selecting this option, there will be a summary of actions to take after the recorded meeting.

recording_thumbnails.description: Whether thumbnails of the presenter are recorded when they are sharing their screen.

save_chat_text.description: Whether chat messages are saved from meetings or webinars.

save_close_caption.description: Whether [closed captions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207279736) are saved as a VTT (Video Track Text) file.

save_panelist_chat.description: Whether panelist chats are saved to the recording.

save_poll_results.description: Whether poll results shared during the meeting or webinar are saved. This also includes poll results shared during the meeting or webinar.

show_timestamp.description: Whether a timestamp is included in the recording.

audio_type.description: Whether participants can join only the audio portion of meetings.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: Whether the meeting password is encrypted and included in the meeting links that allow participants to join with just one click without having to enter the password.

force_pmi_jbh_password.description: Whether passwords are required to join before the host in personal meetings.

host_video.description: Whether host video defaults to on when they join meetings.

join_before_host.description: Whether participants can join meetings before the host.

mute_upon_entry.description: Whether all participants are automatically muted when they join meetings.

participant_video.description: Whether participant video defaults to on when they join meetings.

personal_meeting.description: Whether the [**Personal Meeting ID (PMI)**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937-Using-Personal-Meeting-ID-PMI) feature is enabled. If disabled, meetings that were previously-scheduled via PMI will need to be manually updated. For Zoom Phone, if a user has been assigned a desk phone, the **Elevate to Zoom Meeting** setting is disabled.

pstn_password_protected.description: Whether new passwords are generated and sent for newly-scheduled or edited meetings.

require_password_for_instant_meetings.description: Whether passwords are required for instant meetings. If you use a PMI for instant meetings, this is disabled.

require_password_for_pmi_meetings.description:
Whether participants are required to enter a password for PMI meetings: 
* none — Do not require a password for PMI meetings. 
* all — Require participants to enter password for all PMI-enabled meetings. 
* jbh_only — Only require a password for meetings where the **Join Before Host** setting is enabled.

require_password_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Whether a password is required for meetings which have already been scheduled.

require_password_for_scheduling_new_meet.description: Whether a password is generated when a host schedules a new meeting. Participants are required to enter the password before they can join the meeting.

upcoming_meeting_reminder.description: Whether desktop notification are sent for upcoming meetings.

use_pmi_for_instant_meetings.description: Whether PMI is enabled for all instant meetings.

use_pmi_for_schedule_meetings.description: Whether a PMI is enabled for all scheduled meetings.

always_display_zoom_meeting_as_topic.description: Information about the [**Always display "Zoom Meeting" as the meeting topic**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Changing-account-settings#h_01EG9BJ646V2WJK1S3H2MP6YV6) setting.

enable.description: Whether the **Always display "Zoom Meeting" as the meeting topic** setting is enabled.

display_topic_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Whether "Zoom Meeting" displays as the topic for already-scheduled meetings.

always_display_zoom_webinar_as_topic.description: Information about the [**Always show "Zoom Webinar" as the webinar topic**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Changing-account-settings#h_01EG9BJ646V2WJK1S3H2MP6YV6) setting.

enable.description: Whether the **Always show "Zoom Webinar" as the webinar topic** setting is enabled.

display_topic_for_scheduled_webinars.description: Whether "Zoom Webinar" displays as the topic for already-scheduled meetings.

audio_conference_info.description: Information about the third-party audio configuration.

telephony_regions.description: The telephony regions from which participants call in to or call from.

selection_values.description: The account's selected telephony regions that indicate where most participants call into or call from during a meeting.

third_party_audio.description: Whether users can join meetings using the existing third party audio configurations.

auto_security.description:
Whether all meetings are required to be secured with at least one security option. 

This setting can only be disabled by Enterprise, ISV, Business (with more than 100 licenses), and Education accounts.

block_user_domain.description: Whether users in specific domains are blocked from joining meetings and webinars.

chat_etiquette_tool.description: Information about the Chat Etiquette Tool.

enable.description: Whether the **Chat Etiquette Tool** is enabled.

policies.description: Information about the defined **Chat Etiquette Tool** policies.

is_locked.description: Whether the policy is locked by an account-level user. When it is locked, users cannot update the policy.

keywords.description: A list of defined rule keywords.

regular_expression.description: The regular expression to match to the content of chat messages.

status.description:
The policy's current status: 
* activated — Activated. 
* deactivated — Deactivated.

trigger_action.description:
The policy's trigger action: 
* 1 — Ask the user to confirm before they send the message. 
* 2 — Block the user's message.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: Whether the meeting password is encrypted and included in the invitation link. The provided link will allow participants to join the meeting without having to enter the password.

encryption_type.description:
The type of encryption used when starting a meeting: 
* enhanced_encryption — Enhanced encryption. Encryption data is stored in the cloud. 
* e2ee — End-to-end encryption. The encryption key is stored on the local device and cannot be obtained by anyone else. Enabling E2EE also [**disables** certain features](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360048660871), such as cloud recording, live streaming, and allowing participants to join before the host.

end_to_end_encrypted_meetings.description: Whether end-to-end encryption is enabled for meetings.

meeting_password.description: Whether all instant and scheduled meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected. [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937) meetings are **not** included in this setting.

meeting_password_requirement.description: Information about the meeting and webinar [password requirements](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033559832-Meeting-and-webinar-passwords#h_a427384b-e383-4f80-864d-794bf0a37604).

consecutive_characters_length.description:
The maximum length of consecutive characters (for example, abcdef) allowed in a password: 
* 4 through 8 — The maximum consecutive characters length. The length is n minus 1, where n is the provided value. For example, if you provide the 4 value, there can only be a maximum of 3 consecutive characters in a password (for example, abc1x@8fdh). 
* 0 — Do not apply a consecutive character restriction.

have_letter.description: Whether the password must contain at least one letter character.

have_number.description: Whether the password must contain at least one numeric character.

have_special_character.description: Whether the password must contain at least one special character. For example, !, @, and/or # characters.

have_upper_and_lower_characters.description: Whether the password must include uppercase and lowercase characters.

only_allow_numeric.description: Whether the password must contain **only** numeric characters.

weak_enhance_detection.description: Whether users will be informed when the provided password is weak.

only_authenticated_can_join_from_webclie.description: Whether only authenticated users can join meetings from the web client.

phone_password.description:
Whether a password is required for participants joining by phone. 

If enabled and the meeting is password-protected, a numeric password is required for participants to join by phone. For meetings with alphanumeric passwords, a numeric password will be generated.

pmi_password.description: Whether all Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected.

require_password_for_scheduled_meeting.description: Whether a password is required for meetings that have already been scheduled.

require_password_for_scheduled_webinar.description: Whether a password is required for webinars that have already been scheduled.

waiting_room.description:
Whether participants are placed in the [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) when they join a meeting. 

When the **Waiting Room** feature is enabled, the [**Allow participants to join before host**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202828525-Allow-participants-to-join-before-host) setting is disabled.

participants_to_place_in_waiting_room.description:
The type of participants to be admitted to the Waiting Room: 
* 0 — All attendees. 
* 1 — Users who are not in your account. 
* 2 — Users who are not in your account and are not part of your [allowed domains list](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037117472-Configuring-authentication-profiles#h_e3cf0d5f-eec7-4c2a-ad29-ef2a5079a7da).

users_who_can_admit_participants_from_wa.description:
The users who can admit participants from the Waiting Room: 
* 0 — Host and co-hosts only. 
* 1 — Host, co-hosts, and anyone who bypassed the Waiting Room if the host and co-hosts are not present.

whitelisted_domains_for_waiting_room.description: If the participants_to_place_in_waiting_room field is 2, a comma-separated list of the domains that can bypass the Waiting Room (for example, example.com,example2.com).

webinar_password.description: Whether a password is generated when scheduling webinars. Participants must use the generated password to join the scheduled webinar.

share_files.description: Users can share files in chats and channels.

enable.description: Allow users of this account to send and receive files in chats and channels. When disabled, users can still take and share screenshots.

share_option.description: Allow users of this account to send and receive files in chats and channels. When disabled, users can still take and share screenshots.

enable.description: Allow users to use the emoji library in direct messages or group conversations. Choose between allowing users to use any emoji in the library, or choose to allow only pre-selected emojis. If the setting is disabled, users can still use keyboard shortcuts to add emojis. Users can change their emoji skin tone in Settings.

record_voice_messages.description: Allow users to record voice messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations.

record_video_messages.description: Allow users to record video messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations. If the file share setting is disabled, they will not be able to record and send video messages.

screen_capture.description: Allow users to take and send screenshots in direct messages or group conversations.

create_public_channels.description: Allow users to create public channels.

create_private_channels.description: Allow users to create private channels.

share_links_in_chat.description: Share links to messages and channels in Team Chat.

schedule_meetings_in_chat.description: Schedule a meeting from chat or channel.

allow_users_to_search_others_options.description:
Allow users to search others, when selecting multiple items, separate them with commas: 
* ''-none. 
* '1' — In the same account. 
* '2' — Under the same master account, including all sub acounts. 
* '3' — Under the same organization.

enable.description: By disabling this setting, users will not be able to add contacts.

selected_option.description:
The type of allowing users to add contacts: 
* 1 — Anyone (internal and external contacts). 
* 2 — In the same organization. 
* 3 — In the same organization and specified domains. 
* 4 — In the same organization and specified users.

user_email_addresses.description:
The domains or emails (internal or external). 
* When the selected_option field value is 3, the value is internal or external domains. Use a comma to separate multiple domains. Example: company.com. 
* When the selected_option field value is 4, the value is internal or external email addresses. Use a comma to separate multiple emails.

allow_users_to_chat_with_others.description: Allow users to chat with others.

enable.description: If you select 'In the same organization', users may still be able to chat with external users if they are added to channels or group chats with external users.

selected_option.description:
The type of allowing users to add contacts: 
* 1 — Anyone (internal and external contacts). 
* 2 — In the same organization. 
* 3 — In the same organization and specified domains. 
* 4 — In the same organization and specified users.

user_email_addresses.description:
The domains or emails (internal or external). 
* When the selected_option field value is 3, the value is internal or external domains. Use a comma to separate multiple domains. Example: company.com. 
* When the selected_option field value is 4, the value is internal or external email addresses. Use a comma to separate multiple emails.

enable.description:
Whether to enable the **Chat Etiquette Tool**. This value defaults to false. 

 The **Chat Etiquette Tool** allows you to define specific keywords and text patterns in chat to prevent users from inadvertently sharing unwanted messages.

policies.description: Information about the defined **Chat Etiquette Tool** policies.

status.description:
The policy's current status: 
* activated — Activated. 
* deactivated — Deactivated.

send_data_to_third_party_archiving_servi.description: Send data to third-party archiving service.

enable.description: Allow users to send data to third-party archiving service.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the group's settings were updated, in milliseconds.

old_object.description: Information about the group's previous settings.

settings.description: Information about the group's updated settings. This only returns modified settings.

$changed_field_name.description: The modified field its original value.

requestBody.description:
# recording.transcript_completed

The **Recording transcript files have completed** event is triggered every time the transcript of the recording is made available for one of your app users or account users after the recorded meeting/webinar ends.

Zoom supports audio transcription of cloud recordings. To utilize audio transcription, users must first [enable](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004794983-Automatically-Transcribe-Cloud-Recordings) it. An account owner or a user with admin permissions can enable cloud recording for an account or a group of users.

## Prerequisites

* A Business, Education, or Enterprise license.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording transcript files have completed** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.transcript_completed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

download_token.description:
Use the generated token value with the download_url value to download the cloud recording via an [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app). The download token only lasts for 24 hours after its creation and you can only download the file within 24 hours of receiving the event notification. You can either include the download_token as a query parameter or pass it as a Bearer token in the Authorization header of your HTTP request: 

 **Using an Authorization header (Recommended)** 

 
curl --request GET \
  --url {download_url} \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {download_token} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
 

**Using a query parameter** 

 
{download_url}/?access_token={download_token}
 

 For example: https://zoom.us/recording/download/123456?access_token=abcdefgh

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that hosted the meeting or the webinar.

object.description: Information about the webinar or meeting recording.

id.description: The ID of the meeting (meetingId) or the webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance. Each meeting or webinar instance generates its own meeting UUID.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the archived meeting or webinar.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that ended the meeting and completed the recording.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

share_url.description: The URL at which approved users can view the recording.

total_size.description: The recording file's total size, in bytes.

recording_count.description: The number of completed recording files.

recording_files.description: Information about the completed recording files.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which recording ended.

file_size.description: The recording file's size, in bytes.

play_url.description: The URL at which the recording file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL at which to download the the recording. 

 **JWT apps** 

 To access a private or password-protected cloud recording of a user in your account, use a [Zoom JWT app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-jwt-app). Use the generated JWT token as the value of the access_token query parameter and include this query parameter at the end of the URL. 

 https://{{base-domain}}/recording/download/{{path-to-file-download}}?access_token={{JWT-token}} 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains recording scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the file. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/archive/download/xxx?access_token={{OAuth-access-token}} 

 **Note:** This field does **not** return for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). Instead, this API will return the file_path field.

file_path.description:
The file path to the On-Premise account recording. 

 **Note:** This API returns this field for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). It does **not** return the download_url field.

status.description:
The recording file's processing status: 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

recording_type.description:
The type of recording file: 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view(CC) 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view 
* shared_screen_with_gallery_view 
* gallery_view 
* shared_screen 
* audio_only 
* audio_transcript 
* chat_file 
* active_speaker 
* host_video 
* audio_only_each_participant 
* cc_transcript 
* closed_caption 
* poll 
* timeline 
* thumbnail 

For more information, read our [Managing and sharing cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Managing-and-sharing-cloud-recordings#h_9898497b-e736-4980-a749-d55608f10773) documentation.

requestBody.description:
# recording.stopped

The **Recording Stopped** event is triggered every time a recording is stopped by one of your app's users or account users.

All users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). An account owner or account admin can [enable cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_29fc1846-190d-4f05-ab23-1070c8106ec8) for all account members as well as for members that belong to a certain group. Users can also enable cloud recordings [for their own use](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_4cca2458-cbd5-4439-933c-57c0d62a2753).

Only a host or a co-host of the meeting/webinar can start, pause, resume, or stop a [cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording).

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording Stopped** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.stopped`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that stopped the meeting or webinar recording.

object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which the recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which the recording ended.

requestBody.description:
# recording.batch_trashed

The **All recording files have been deleted to the Trash** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users temporarily delete all of their cloud recordings.

When a user initially deletes recordings, the recordings are sent to the trash. Users can delete a recording temporarily via the [**Delete meeting recordings**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/recordingDelete) API or via the [**Zoom web client**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Recording-Management). At this point, recordings can be recovered up to 30 days after deletion.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
  * A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
  * The **All recording files have been deleted to the Trash** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.batch_trashed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who batch deleted recordings to trash.

operator.description: The email address of the user who batch deleted recordings to trash.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who batch deleted recordings to trash.

operation.description:
The type of batch operation: 
* trash_user_recordings — User recordings trashed. 
* trash_account_recordings — Account recordings trashed.

object.description: Information about the webinar or meeting recording.

items.description: A list of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId) UUIDs.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.started

The **Start Webinar** event is triggered every time a user in your account or your app starts a Webinar.

Zoom users with a [Webinar Plan](https://zoom.us/webinar) have permissions for creating and managing webinars. [Zoom Video Webinar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar) allows users to broadcast a Zoom meeting to up to 1000 attendees. A Webinar host can [start a Webinar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar#h_816c5048-c9d3-4930-894d-af63cd41de3d) from the Zoom Client or from the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us).

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Start Webinar** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.started`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who started the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.sharing_ended

The **Webinar Sharing Ended** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users stop sharing their screen during a Webinar.

Zoom supports [screen sharing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362153-Screen-Sharing-and-Annotations) by host or panelists on desktop, tablet and mobile devices running Zoom during webinars.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Webinar Sharing Ended** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.sharing_ended`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's webinar user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a webinar and is only valid for the duration of the webinar.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the webinar **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

content.description:
The type of shared content: 
* application — An application. For example, a web browser. 
* whiteboard — The [classic whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205677665-Sharing-a-whiteboard). 
* desktop — A user's desktop. 
* airplay — A user's [AirPlay (Apple screen mirroring)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204726885-Sharing-screen-using-Apple-screen-mirroring-AirPlay-). 
* camera — A user's camera. 
* unknown — An unrecognized application, such as a third party app.

link_source.description:
The Dropbox sharing method: 
* deep_link — A [deep link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_linking). 
* in_meeting — A link shared via Zoom. 
* An empty string value if the link source is **not** a Dropbox link.

file_link.description: The Dropbox file's link. This field returns an empty string value if the file link is **not** from a Dropbox source.

date_time.description: The screenshare's date and time.

source.description:
The source from which the file was shared: 
* dropbox — A Dropbox source. 
* An empty string if the source is **not** Dropbox.

requestBody.description:
# account.disassociated

The **Sub Account has been disassociated** event is triggered every time a sub account is [disassociated](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/accountDisassociate) from a Master account.

An administrator or Zoom account owner can disassociate a sub account from their Master account. To do this in the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us), click the **Disassociate** button next to the sub account in the [**Account List**](https://zoomdev.us/account/sub/list) interface. To programmatically disassociate a sub account, use the [**Disassociate a sub account**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/accountDisassociate) API.

The Master account owner must be you or a user of your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher [plan](https://zoom.us/pricing) with the **Master account** option enabled.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Sub Account has been disassociated** subscription enabled under the **Account** event.



**Event type**: `account.disassociated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID under which the account was [disassociated](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269946-Removing-a-user-from-your-account#h_98a81098-0ca3-45ae-8d00-aab235cc781d).

operator.description: The email address of the user who disassociated the account.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who disassociated the account.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.sharing_started

The **Meeting Sharing Started** event is triggered every time an attendee or a host begins sharing their screen during a Zoom meeting. The meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

Zoom allows [screen sharing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362153-Screen-Sharing-and-Annotations) by host and attendees on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices running Zoom during meetings.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Sharing Started** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.sharing_started`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

content.description:
The type of shared content: 
* application — An application. For example, a web browser. 
* whiteboard — The [classic whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205677665-Sharing-a-whiteboard). 
* desktop — A user's desktop. 
* airplay — A user's [AirPlay (Apple screen mirroring)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204726885-Sharing-screen-using-Apple-screen-mirroring-AirPlay-). 
* camera — A user's camera. 
* unknown — An unrecognized application, such as a third party app.

link_source.description:
The Dropbox sharing method: 
* deep_link — A [deep link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_linking). 
* in_meeting — A link shared via Zoom. 
* An empty (””) value if the link source is **not** a Dropbox link.

file_link.description: The Dropbox file's link. This field returns an empty (””) value if the file link is **not** from a Dropbox source.

date_time.description: The screenshare's date and time.

source.description:
The source from which the file was shared: 
* dropbox — A Dropbox source. 
* An empty (””) value if the source is **not** Dropbox.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.chat_message_sent

The **In-meeting chat message received** event is triggered when a user sends a public or private chat message during a meeting using the [in-meeting Zoom chat feature](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203650445-Chatting-in-a-Zoom-meeting). The event is sent to the configured endpoint in your Marketplace app.

## Prerequisites

* Have Zoom enable the DLP for in-meeting chat feature to use this webhook.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* The **In-meeting chat message received** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event category.



**Event type**: `meeting.chat_message_sent`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

date_time.description: The date and time at which the chat message was sent.

sender_type.description:
The type of user that sent the message: 
* host — The meeting host. 
* guest — A meeting guest.

recipient_email.description: The message recipient's email address. Optional only included if it is a private message.

recipient_type.description:
The type of message recipient: 
* host — The meeting host. 
* guest — A meeting guest.

message_id.description: The chat message's universally unique identifier (UUID).

message_content.description: The content of the chat message.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.registration_created

The **Webinar Registration has been created** event is triggered every time someone registers for a Webinar created by one of your app users or account users.

Zoom users with a [Webinar Plan](https://zoom.us/webinar) have access to creating and managing Webinars. [Zoom Video Webinar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar) allows users to broadcast a Zoom meeting to up to 1000 attendees. [Scheduling a Webinar with registration](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204619915-Scheduling-a-Webinar-with-Registration) requires your registrants to complete a brief form before receiving the link to join the Webinar.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace App](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event notification endpoint URL**
	* The **Webinar Registration has been created** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.registration_created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinar with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

zip.description: The registrant's ZIP or postal code.

purchasing_time_frame.description:
The registrant's purchasing time frame: 
* Within a month 
* 1-3 months 
* 4-6 months 
* More than 6 months 
* No timeframe

role_in_purchase_process.description:
The registrant's role in the purchase process: 
* Decision Maker 
* Evaluator/Recommender 
* Influencer 
* Not involved

title.description: The title of the custom question.

value.description: The custom question's response value. This has a limit of 128 characters.

status.description:
The registrant's registration approval status: 
* approve — Approved registrant. 
* pending — Registration approval pending.

join_url.description: The URL to join the webinar.

tracking_source.description: Information about the source tracking. See [Creating webinar registration tracking links](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000315683-Creating-webinar-registration-tracking-links) for details.

id.description: Unique Identifier of the tracking source.

source_name.description: Name of the source (platform) where the registration URL was shared.

tracking_url.description: Tracking URL. The URL that was shared for the registration.

custom_questions.title: What do you hope to learn from this Webinar?
custom_questions.value: Look forward to learning how you come up with new recipes and what other services you offer.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_role_changed

The **Participant role changed** event is triggered every time a host or meeting attendee changes their [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040324512-Roles-in-a-meeting) during the meeting. A meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant role changed** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_role_changed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. For more information, read our [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) documentation.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

date_time.description: The time at which the participant changed the [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040324512-Roles-in-a-meeting).

old_role.description:
The participant's previous role: 
* host — Host. 
* co-host — Co-host. 
* attendee — Attendee.

new_role.description:
The participant's new role: 
* host — Host. 
* co-host — Co-host. 
* attendee — Attendee.

requestBody.description:
# account.settings_updated

Account settings can be updated either by an account owner or user with admin privileges. The account settings can be [updated manually](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Account-Settings#h_419c57b8-0d83-4ff3-8910-3e5dfb7be3a0) from the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/). Alternatively, the account owner or the user with admin permissions can update the settings using the [Update Settings](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/accountSettingsUpdate) API.

The **Account/Sub Account's setting has been updated** event is triggered every time an account or a Sub Account's [settings](https://zoom.us/account/setting) are updated. The account must belong either to you or a user of your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app. To receive notifications for this event, you must meet the following prerequisites.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The "**Account/Sub Account's setting has been updated**" subscription enabled under the **Account** event.



**Event type**: `account.settings_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account's owner.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the account's settings.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the account's settings.

settings.description: Information about the account's updated settings.

schedule_meeting.description: Information about the schedule meeting settings.

host_video.description: Whether to start meetings with the host video on.

participant_video.description: Whether to start meetings with the participant video on.

audio_type.description: The type of audio used to join the meeting.

join_before_host.description: Whether participants can join the meeting before its host.

enforce_login.description: Whether only users who are signed in to Zoom can join meetings.

enforce_login_with_domains.description: Whether only users with a specific domain can join meetings.

enforce_login_domains.description: The specified domains for users to sign in to in order to join meetings.

not_store_meeting_topic.description: Whether to display the "Zoom Meeting" message as the meeting's topic.

force_pmi_jbh_password.description: Whether to require a password for personal meetings if attendees can join before host.

use_pmi_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Use a [PMI (Personal Meeting ID)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937-Using-Personal-Meeting-ID-PMI-) to schedule meeting.

pstn_password_protected.description: Require a password from participants before joining a meeting via [PSTN](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference).

jbh_time.description:
If the value of the join_before_host field is true, this field indicates the time limits within which a participant can join a meeting before the meeting's host:

* 0 — Allow the participant to join the meeting at anytime.
* 5 — Allow the participant to join 5 minutes before the meeting's start time.
* 10 — Allow the participant to join 10 minutes before the meeting's start time.

personal_meeting.description:
The personal meeting settings:
* true — Indicates that the **Enable Personal Meeting ID** setting is enabled. Users can use a personal meeting ID for their meetings.
* false — Indicates that the **Enable Personal Meeting ID** setting is [disabled](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843-Personal-meeting-ID-PMI-and-personal-link#h_aa0335c8-3b06-41bc-bc1f-a8b84ef17f2a). When this setting is **disabled**, meetings that were scheduled with a PMI will be invalid. You must manually update any scheduled meetings.

**For Zoom Phone only:**

If a user has been assigned a desk phone, the desk phone's **Elevate to Zoom Meeting** setting will be disabled.

require_password_for_instant_meetings.description:
Whether a random password will be generated on the end of user who starts the instant meeting. Other meeting participants **must** enter the generated password to join the meeting.

If instant meetings use a PMI, this option is **disabled**.

mute_upon_entry.description: Whether to automatically mute all participants when they join the meeting.

require_password_for_pmi_meetings.description:
Require participants to enter password for PMI meetings:
* jbh_only — Only when a participant joins before the host.
* all — All participants must enter a password to join the meeting.
* none — No password required.

use_pmi_for_instant_meetings.description: Whether PMI is enabled for all instant meetings.

require_password_for_scheduling_new_meet.description:
Whether a password is generated when a meeting host schedules a new meeting. Meeting participants will be required to enter the password before they can join the meeting.

This setting only applies to regular meetings that do **not** use a PMI.

upcoming_meeting_reminder.description: Whether to receive a desktop notification for upcoming meetings.

always_display_zoom_meeting_as_topic.description: Information about the [**Always display "Zoom Meeting" as the meeting topic**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Changing-account-settings#h_01EG9BJ646V2WJK1S3H2MP6YV6) setting.

enable.description: Whether the **Always display "Zoom Meeting" as the meeting topic** setting is enabled.

display_topic_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Whether to display "Zoom Meeting" as the topic for already-scheduled meetings.

hide_meeting_description.description: Information about the **Hide meeting description** feature.

enable.description: Whether the **Hide meeting description** setting is enabled.

hide_description_for_scheduled_meetings.description: Whether to hide the description for already-scheduled meetings.

always_display_zoom_webinar_as_topic.description: Information about the [**Always show "Zoom Webinar" as the webinar topic**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Changing-account-settings#h_01EG9BJ646V2WJK1S3H2MP6YV6) setting.

enable.description: Whether the **Always show "Zoom Webinar" as the webinar topic** setting is enabled.

display_topic_for_scheduled_webinars.description: Whether to display "Zoom Webinar" as the topic for already-scheduled meetings.

hide_webinar_description.description: Information about the **Hide webinar description** feature.

enable.description: Whether the **Hide webinar description** setting is enabled.

hide_description_for_scheduled_webinars.description: Whether to hide webinar description for the webinars which have already been scheduled.

in_meeting.description: Information about the in meeting settings.

allow_users_to_delete_messages_in_meetin.description: If the value of this field is set to true,  allow users to delete messages in the in-meeting chat.

allow_participants_chat_with.description:
Whether participants can chat with certain groups:
* 1 — The participants cannot use chat.
* 2 — Host and co-hosts only.
 * 3 — The participants can chat with other participants publicly.
* 4 - The participants can chat with other participants publicly and privately.

**Note:** This setting is only available with client versions 5.7.3 and above.

allow_users_save_chats.description:
Whether participants can save meeting chats:
* 1 — Participants cannot save meeting chats.
* 2 — Participants can only save host and co-host meeting chats.
* 3 — Participants can save all meeting chats.

private_chat.description: Whether meeting participants can use private chat.

auto_saving_chat.description: Whether to automatically save all in-meeting chats.

file_transfer.description: Whether file sharing via in-meeting chat is enabled.

feedback.description: Whether users can send feedback to Zoom at the end of the meeting.

post_meeting_feedback.description: Whether to display a post-meeting feedback survey at the end of a meeting.

co_host.description: Whether to allow the meeting host to add co-hosts.

polling.description: Whether polls are available in the meeting controls.

meeting_polling.description: Information about the account's meeting polling settings.

enable.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a meeting.

advanced_polls.description: Whether the host can create advanced polls and quizzes. Advanced polls and quizzes include single choice, multiple choice, drop down, matching, short answer, long answer, rank order, and fill-in-the-blank questions. Hosts can also set the correct answers for quizzes they create.

require_answers_to_be_anonymous.description: Whether to require answers to be anonymous.

allow_alternative_host_to_add_edit.description: Whether alternative hosts can add or edit polls and quizzes.

manage_saved_polls_and_quizzes.description: Whether to allow users to manage saved polls and quizzes from Meetings

allow_host_to_upload_image.description: Whether to allow host to upload an image for each question.

attendee_on_hold.description: Whether hosts can temporarily place an attendee on hold.

show_meeting_control_toolbar.description: Whether to always display the meeting control bar.

allow_show_zoom_windows.description: Whether to display the Zoom desktop application when sharing access.

annotation.description: Whether participants can use annotation tools to add information to shared screens.

whiteboard.description: Whether participants can share a whiteboard that includes annotation tools.

webinar_question_answer.description: Whether Q&A is enabled in a webinar.

meeting_question_answer.description: Allow participants to ask questions for the host and participants to answer.

anonymous_question_answer.description: Whether anonymous Q&A is enabled in a webinar.

breakout_room.description: Whether the host can split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms.

breakout_room_schedule.description: Whether the host can assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling. This feature is **only** available in version 4.5.0 or higher.

closed_caption.description: Whether the host can add closed captions.

far_end_camera_control.description: Whether another user can take control of camera during a meeting.

group_hd.description: Whether higher quality video for the host and participants is enabled.

virtual_background.description: Whether users can change their background.

watermark.description: Whether to add watermark when viewing a shared screen.

watermark_by_default.description: Whether to turn on watermark by default when scheduling a meeting.

audio_watermark_by_default.description: Whether to turn on [audio watermark](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021839031-Adding-audio-watermark) by default when scheduling a meeting.

attention_mode_focus_mode.description: Whether the [**Focus Mode**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061113751-Using-focus-mode) feature is enabled. When enabled, this feature only displays the host and co-hosts' video and profile pictures during a meeting.

allow_host_to_enable_focus_mode.description: Whether the host can enable [**Focus Mode**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061113751-Using-focus-mode) when scheduling a meeting.

alert_guest_join.description: Whether to alert when a guest joins a meeting.

auto_answer.description: Whether users can see and add contacts to the **auto-answer** group in the chat contact list. Any call from members of this group will automatically be answered.

p2p_connetion.description: Whether peer-to-peer connection when only two people are in a meeting is enabled.

p2p_ports.description: Whether a peer-to-peer listening ports range is enabled.

ports_range.description: The comma-separated peer-to-peer listening ports range (for example, 55,56), between 1 to 65535.

sending_default_email_invites.description: Whether to display the default email when sending email invites.

use_html_format_email.description: Whether to use HTML-formatted email for the Outlook plugin.

dscp_marking.description: Whether to use DSCP (differentiated services code point) marking.

stereo_audio.description: Whether users can select stereo audio in their client settings.

original_audio.description: Whether users can select original sound in their client settings.

remote_control.description: Whether users can request remote control.

non_verbal_feedback.description: Whether to enable the [**Non-verbal feedback**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions-) setting.  This value defaults to false.

remote_support.description: Whether to enable the [**Remote support**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060951012-Enabling-remote-support) setting. This value defaults to false.

custom_data_center_regions.description:
