Whether custom [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042411451-Selecting-data-center-regions-for-hosted-meetings-and-webinars) are enabled for hosting real-time meeting and webinar traffic: 
* true — Enabled. Provide the data center regions in the data_center_regions field. 
* false — Disabled. Only use the default data center regions.

data_center_regions.description:
The user's selected custom data center regions. This field only returns if the custom_data_center_regions value is true: 
* AU — Australia.
* LA — Latin America. 
* CA — Canada. 
* CN — China. 
* DE — Germany. 
* HK — Hong Kong SAR. 
* IN — India. 
* IE — Ireland. 
* TY — Japan. 
* MX — Mexico. 
* NL — Netherlands. 
* SG — Singapore. 
* US — United States.

enable.description: Whether hosts can assign participants as interpreters to interpret one language into another in real-time.

enable_language_interpretation_by_defaul.description: Whether enable language interpretation by default.

allow_participants_to_speak_in_listening.description: Whether to allow participants to speak in listening channel.

allow_up_to_25_custom_languages_when_sch.description: Whether to allow up to 25 custom languages when scheduling meetings.

custom_languages.description: A list of user-defined supported languages.

sign_language_interpretation.description: Allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into sign language in real-time. Hosts can assign interpreters when scheduling, or during the meeting itself. This feature is only available with version 5.11.3 or later.

enable.description: Whether to allow hosts to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into another in real-time.

enable_sign_language_interpretation_by_d.description: Whether to enable sign language interpretation view by default in scheduler.

custom_languages.description: A list of user-defined supported languages.

meeting_reactions.description: Whether meeting participants can [communicate using the emoji reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183-Nonverbal-feedback-and-meeting-reactions) located in the **Reactions** menu in the meeting toolbar.

meeting_reactions_emojis.description:
Choose from the following meeting reaction options:
* all — All emojis: Allow meeting participants to use any emoji available in Zoom chat as a reaction in a meeting.
* selected — Selected emojis: Allow meeting participants to use the 6 standard meeting reaction emojis: Clapping Hands, Thumbs Up, Heart, Tears of Joy, Open Mouth, Party Popper (Tada, Celebration)
x-enum-descriptions: Allow meeting participants to use any emoji available in Zoom chat as a reaction in a meeting.
Allow meeting participants to use the 6 standard meeting reaction emojis: Clapping Hands, Thumbs Up, Heart, Tears of Joy, Open Mouth, Party Popper (Tada, Celebration) .

allow_host_panelists_to_use_audible_clap.description: Whether to allow host and panelist to use audible clap.

webinar_reactions.description: Set this field to true to use [webinar reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4803536268429).

show_a_join_from_your_browser_link.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their browser and bypass the Zoom application download process.

join_from_mobile.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their mobile browser.

join_from_desktop.description: Whether participants can join a meeting directly from their desktop browser.

workplace_by_facebook.description: Whether to allow Workplace by Facebook livestreaming.

enable.description: Whether webinar livestreaming is enabled.

live_streaming_service.description:
The available livestreaming services:
* facebook
* workplace_by_facebook
* youtube
* custom_live_streaming_service

custom_service_instructions.description: The specific instructions that allow the account's meeting hosts to configure a custom livestream.

live_streaming_reminder.description: Whether to notify users to watch the livestream. This does not apply to custom RTMP (real-time messaging protocol).

enable.description: Whether webinar participants can send chat messages.

allow_panelists_chat_with.description:
Webinar panelists can chat with:
* 1 — Host and all panelists.
* 2 — Everyone.

allow_attendees_chat_with.description:
Webinar attendees can chat with:
* 1 — No one.
* 2 — Host and all panelists.
* 3 — Everyone.

default_attendees_chat_with.description:
By default, webinar attendees can chat with:
* 1 — Host and all panelists.
* 2 — Everyone.

allow_panelists_send_direct_message.description: Whether webinar panelists can send direct messages to other panelists.

allow_users_save_chats.description:
Whether webinar attendees can save chats:
* 0 — Attendees cannot save chats.
* 1 — Attendees can only save host and panelist chats.
* 2 — Attendees can save all chats.

allow_auto_save_local_chat_file.description: Whether chat messages are saved automatically to a local file on the host's computer when the webinar ends.

enable.description: Whether to allow the host to type closed captions or assign a participant or 3rd-party service to provide closed captioning.

third_party_captioning_service.description: Whether to allow the use of an API token to integrate with 3rd-party closed captioning services.

auto_transcribing.description: Whether to allow a live transcription service to transcribe meetings.

view_full_transcript.description: Whether to allow the viewing of full transcripts in the in-meeting side panel.

save_caption.description: Whether to allow participants to save closed captions or transcripts.

slide_control.description: Whether the person sharing during a presentation can allow others to control the slide presentation. This feature is only available in version 5.8.3 or higher.

meeting_survey.description: Whether to allow the host to present a survey to participants once a meeting has ended. This feature is only available in version 5.7.3 or higher.

webinar_polling.description: Information about the account's webinar polling settings.

enable.description: Whether the host can add polls before or during a webinar.

advanced_polls.description: Whether the host can create advanced polls and quizzes. Advanced polls and quizzes include single choice, multiple choice, drop down, matching, short answer, long answer, rank order, and fill-in-the-blank questions. Hosts can also set the correct answers for quizzes they create.

require_answers_to_be_anonymous.description: Whether to require answers to be anonymous.

allow_alternative_host_to_add_edit.description: Whether alternative hosts can add or edit polls and quizzes.

manage_saved_polls_and_quizzes.description: Whether to allow users to manage saved polls and quizzes from Meetings

allow_host_to_upload_image.description: Whether to allow host to upload an image for each question.

webinar_survey.description: Whether to allow the host to present surveys to attendees once a webinar has ended.

disable_screen_sharing_for_host_meetings.description: Whether the **Disable desktop screen sharing for meetings you host** setting is enabled.

disable_screen_sharing_for_in_meeting_gu.description: Whether the **Disable screen sharing when guests are in the meeting** setting is enabled.

who_can_share_screen.description:
The type of user who can share their screen or content during meetings: 
* host — Only hosts can screen share. 
* all — Both hosts and participants can screen share.

who_can_share_screen_when_someone_is_sha.description:
The type of user that can begin sharing their screen when someone else in the meeting is sharing their screen: 
* host — Only hosts can screen share when someone else is sharing. 
* all — Both hosts and participants can screen share when someone else is sharing.

participants_share_simultaneously.description:
Indicates how many participants can screen share at the same time. The value can be one of the following:
one: Only one participant can screen share at a time .
multiple: Multiple participants can screen share simultaneously (dual monitors recommended).

email_notification.description: Information about the email notification settings.

cloud_recording_available_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host when a cloud recording is available.

recording_available_reminder_schedulers.description: Whether to notify the person who scheduled the meeting or webinar for the host when a cloud recording is available.

recording_available_reminder_alternative.description: Whether to notify any alternative hosts when a cloud recording is available.

jbh_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host when participants join the meeting before them.

cancel_meeting_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host and participants when a meeting is canceled.

low_host_count_reminder.description: Whether to notify the user when host licenses are running low.

alternative_host_reminder.description: Whether to notify when an alternative host is added to or removed from a meeting.

schedule_for_reminder.description: Whether to notify the host that there is a meeting is scheduled, rescheduled, or canceled.

zoom_rooms.description: Information about the Zoom Rooms settings.

upcoming_meeting_alert.description: Whether upcoming meeting alerts are enabled.

start_airplay_manually.description: Whether to start the AirPlay service manually.

weekly_system_restart.description: Whether weekly system restarts are enabled.

list_meetings_with_calendar.description: Whether to display meeting lists with calendar integration.

zr_post_meeting_feedback.description: Whether Zoom Room post-meeting feedback is enabled.

ultrasonic.description: Whether the automatic direct sharing using an ultrasonic proximity signal is enabled.

force_private_meeting.description: Whether to force all meetings to be [private meetings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001051063-Zoom-Rooms-Private-Meetings).

hide_host_information.description: Whether hiding of the host and meeting ID in private meetings is enabled.

cmr_for_instant_meeting.description: Whether cloud recording for instant meetings is enabled.

auto_start_stop_scheduled_meetings.description: Whether an automatic start time and stop time for scheduled meetings is enabled.

admin_change_name_pic.description: Whether only account administrators can change a user's username and picture.

import_photos_from_devices.description: Whether users can import photos from a photo library on a device.

hide_billing_info.description: Whether hiding of billing information is enabled.

password_requirement.description: Information about the [enhanced password rules](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034675592-Advanced-security-settings#h_bf8a25f6-9a66-447a-befd-f02ed3404f89) that allows Zoom account administrators and owners to apply additinal requirements to the users' Zoom login password.

minimum_password_length.description:
A password's required minimum length value. The password length can be between a minimum of 8 characters, up to 14 characters.

If this is a 0 value, this setting is **disabled** and is not used. The default password length requirement will be a minimum of 8 characters.

have_special_character.description: Whether a password requires at least one special character (for example, !, @, and #).

consecutive_characters_length.description:
The password's maximum length of consecutive characters (for example, abcde).

If this is a 0 value, there is no consecutive character restriction.

weak_enhance_detection.description: Whether passwords must pass detection through a weak password dictionary.

enable.description: Whether to allow users to sign in with single sign-on (SSO). Enabling this requires you to configure your account's SSO settings. This lets users sign in with SSO through your company's vanity URL.

require_sso_for_domains.description: Whether to require users to sign in with single sign-on (SSO) if their e-mail address belongs to one of the domains.

domains.description: Users using these domains are required to sign in with single sign-on (SSO).

sso_bypass_users.description: The users can bypass SSO sign-in.

signin_with_sso.description: Allow users to sign in with single sign-on (SSO).

local_recording.description: Whether hosts and participants can record the meeting using a local file.

cloud_recording.description: Whether hosts can record and save the meeting in the cloud.

record_speaker_view.description: Whether recording the active speaker with a shared screen is enabled.

record_gallery_view.description: Whether recording the [gallery view](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000005883-Displaying-Participants-in-Gallery-View) with a shared screen is enabled.

record_audio_file.description: Whether recording an audio-only file is enabled.

save_chat_text.description: Whether saving the chat text from the meeting is enabled.

show_timestamp.description: Whether adding a timestamp to the recording is enabled.

recording_audio_transcript.description: Whether automatically transcribing the audio of the meeting or webinar to the cloud is enabled.

auto_recording.description:
The automatic recording setting:
* local — Record locally
* cloud — Record on the cloud.
* none — Disabled.

cloud_recording_download.description: Whether cloud recording downloads are enabled.

cloud_recording_download_host.description: Whether only the host can download cloud recordings.

account_user_access_recording.description: Whether cloud recordings are only accessible to account members. People outside of your organization **cannot** open links that provide access to cloud recordings.

auto_delete_cmr.description: Whether Zoom will permanently delete recordings automatically after a specified number of days is enabled. The number of days is displayed in the auto_delete_cmr_days field.

auto_delete_cmr_days.description:
When the auto_delete_cmr value is true, this value is the number of days before the auto-deletion of cloud recordings: 
* 30 — 30 days. 
* 60 — 60 days. 
* 90 — 90 days. 
* 120 — 120 days.

record_files_separately.description: The account's [**Record active speaker, gallery view and shared screen separately**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060316092-Changing-basic-and-advanced-cloud-recording-settings#h_01F4CYJTCTXNS2MXH00W9EFG6R) settings.

active_speaker.description: Whether recording only the active speaker is enabled.

gallery_view.description: Whether recording only the gallery view is enabled.

shared_screen.description: Whether recording only the gallery view is enabled.

display_participant_name.description: Whether participants' names display in the recording.

recording_thumbnails.description: Whether thumbnails of the presenter are recorded when they are sharing their screen.

optimize_recording_for_3rd_party_video_e.description: Whether recordings will be optimized for a 3rd party video editor. This can increase the file size and the time it takes to generate recording files.

smart_recording.description: By selecting this option, your recording will have meeting smart chapters, and next steps. You are directing Zoom to access, process, and use your account's recording data for the purpose of analysis and insights.

create_recording_highlights.description: By selecting this option, meeting details in the audio transcript will be highlighted. Hosts can modify highlighted sections and generate a video summary (highlighted sections may have a 3-second offset) based on these sections. The summary is for informational purposes only and may not be complete.

create_smart_chapters.description: By selecting this option, your recording will have chapters with overview. Hosts can edit the chapters.

create_next_steps.description: By selecting this option, there will be a summary of actions to take after the recorded meeting.

save_panelist_chat.description: Whether panelist chats are saved to the recording.

save_poll_results.description: Whether poll results shared during the meeting or webinar are saved. This also includes poll results shared during the meeting or webinar.

save_close_caption.description: Whether [closed captions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207279736) are saved as a VTT (Video Track Text) file.

record_audio_file_each_participant.description: Whether to record separate audio files for each participant is enabled.

host_pause_stop_recording.description: Whether the meeting's host can pause or stop the cloud's auto recording is enabled.

recording_disclaimer.description: Whether to display a disclaimer to participants before a recording begins is enabled.

ask_participants_to_consent_disclaimer.description: Whether to ask participants for consent when a recording begins is enabled. This is only available when the value of the recording_disclaimer field is set to true.

ask_host_to_confirm_disclaimer.description: Whether to ask the host to confirm the recording disclaimer is enabled.

recording_password_requirement.description: Information about the minimum password requirements for recordings via the Account Recording settings.

have_letter.description: Whether the password must contain at least one alphabetical letter.

have_number.description: Whether the password must contain at least one numeric character.

have_special_character.description: Whether the password must contain at least one special character (for example, !, @, or #).

only_allow_numeric.description: Whether the password must contain **only** numeric characters.

ip_address_access_control.description: Information about the settings to allow cloud recording access only from specific IP address ranges.

enable.description: Whether the cloud recordings of the account can only be accessed by the IP addresses defined in the ip_addresses_or_ranges property.

ip_addresses_or_ranges.description: The IP addresses or ranges that have access to the cloud recordings.

prevent_host_access_recording.description: Whether meeting hosts are prevented from accessing their meeting cloud recordings. Only the administrators with recording management privileges can access them.

host_delete_cloud_recording.description: Whether the host can delete recordings. If this is disabled, the recordings cannot be deleted by the host. Only an administrator can delete the recordings.

allow_recovery_deleted_cloud_recordings.description:
Whether the recovery of deleted cloud recordings from the trash is enabled.

If enabled, then deleted cloud recordings are kept in the trash for 30 days after deletion. The recordings can be recovered within that period.

archive.description: Information about the [archiving solution](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360050431572-Archiving-Meeting-and-Webinar-data) settings. This is only available if granted archiving solution access by the Zoom support team.

enable.description: Whether the archiving feature is enabled.

type.description:
The archive solution type:
* 1 — Only meetings are archived.
* 2 — Only webinars are archived.
* 3 — Both meetings and webinars are archived.

chat_file.description: Whether to include in-meeting chat in the archive.

chat_with_sender_email.description: Whether to include user emails in the in-meeting chat file.

audio_file.description: Whether to include in-meeting and/or in-webinar audio in the archive.

video_file.description: Whether to include in-meeting and/or in-webinar video in the archive.

cc_transcript_file.description: Whether to include closed captions or transcripts in the archive.

chat_with_direct_message.description: Include direct message in in-meeting chat file.

archive_retention.description: The retention period for archiving content, in days.

action_when_archive_failed.description:
Perform the action when meetings or webinars cannot be archived.
1 - Participants can stay in the meeting and will receive a notification.
2 - Nobody can join or stay in the meeting.

notification_when_archiving_starts.description:
Show notification when video or audio archiving starts.
1 - Participants can stay in the meeting and will receive a notification.
2 - Nobody can join or stay in the meeting.

play_voice_prompt_when_archiving_starts.description:
Play voice prompt when video or audio archiving starts.
1 - Participants can stay in the meeting and will receive a notification.
2 - Nobody can join or stay in the meeting.

third_party_audio.description: Whether users can join the meeting using an existing third-party audio configuration.

audio_conference_info.description: Information about the third-party audio configuration.

telephony_regions.description: Information about where most of the participants call into or call from during a meeting.

allowed_values.description: The telephony region options provided by Zoom.

selection_values.description: The account's selected telephony regions that indicates where most of the participants call into or call from during a meeting.

google_calendar.description: Whether meetings can be scheduled using Google Calendar.

google_drive.description: Whether users who join a meeting from their mobile device can share content from their Google Drive.

dropbox.description: Whether users who join a meeting from their mobile device can share content from their Dropbox account.

box.description: Whether users who join a meeting from their mobile device can share content from their Box account.

microsoft_one_drive.description: Whether users who join a meeting from their mobile device can share content from their Microsoft OneDrive account.

kubi.description: Whether users can control a connected Kubi device from within a Zoom meeting.

meeting_capacity.description: The maximum number of participants a host can have in a single meeting.

allow_auto_active_users.description: Whether administrators can activate users with a single default password when they add users. This immediately activates the users without waiting for them to set their own password.

blur_snapshot.description: Whether iOS blurs the screenshot in the task switcher when multiple apps are open. Android hides the screenshot in the system-level list of recent apps.

display_meetings_scheduled_for_others.description: Whether a user with the [scheduling privilege](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362803-Scheduling-privilege) can view other users' meetings.

use_cdn.description:
Allow connections to different CDNs (content delivery networks) for a better web browsing experience. All users in your organization will use the selected CDN to access static resources: 
* none — Do not use a CDN. 
* default — Use the Amazon CloudFront CDN for users **except** Chinese Mainland users. Chinese Mainland users will use the Wangsu CDN (China). 
* wangsu — Use the Wangsu CDN for all users.
x-enum-descriptions: Do not use use a CDN
All users will use the Amazon CloudFront CDN except Chinese Mainland users. Chinese Mainland users will use the Wangsu CDN (China)
All users use the Wangsu CDN (China)

allow_users_contact_support_via_chat.description: Whether to display the Zoom Help badge on the bottom-right of the page.

show_one_user_meeting_on_dashboard.description: Whether meetings with only one person will display on the Dashboard and in reports.

meeting_qos_and_mos.description:
The Dashboard meeting [quality scores and network alerts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651) setting: 
* 0 — Do not enable meeting quality scores and network alerts on the Dashboard. 
* 1 — Display the meeting quality score and network alerts on the Dashboard. 
* 2 — Use custom thresholds for quality scores and network alerts. 
* 3 —Both Use custom thresholds for quality scores and network alerts and Display the meeting quality score and network alerts on the Dashboard.
x-enum-descriptions: Do not display meeting quality scores and network alerts on the Dashboard
Display the meeting quality score and network alerts on the Dashboard
Use custom thresholds for quality scores and network alerts

allow_users_enter_and_share_pronouns.description: Whether users can add pronouns to their profile cards and share them during meetings and webinars.

allow_host_to_enable_social_share_button.description: Allow host to enable "Show social share buttons on registration page"

toll_free_and_fee_based_toll_call.description: The account's [**Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060950711-Enabling-Toll-free-and-Fee-based-Toll-Call#h_01F51680NJ7YHZDXGJNSKDGM2P) settings.

enable.description: Whether the account has the [**Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060950711-Enabling-Toll-free-and-Fee-based-Toll-Call#h_01F51680NJ7YHZDXGJNSKDGM2P) setting enabled.

allow_webinar_attendees_dial.description: Whether webinar attendees can dial in through the account's **Toll-free and Fee-based Toll Call** phone numbers. This feature is only available with version 5.2.2 or later.

allow_bots_chat.description: Whether chatbots added to chats and channels can read and write messages.

share_files.description: Users can share files in chats and channels.

enable.description: Allow users of this account to send and receive files in chats and channels. When disabled, users can still take and share screenshots.

share_option.description: Allow users of this account to send and receive files in chats and channels. When disabled, users can still take and share screenshots.

restrictions.description: The restrictions of users can share files in chats and channels

file_size_restrictions_for_external.description: Maximum file size for external users

enable.description: Allow users to use the emoji library in direct messages or group conversations. Choose between allowing users to use any emoji in the library, or choose to allow only pre-selected emojis. If the setting is disabled, users can still use keyboard shortcuts to add emojis. Users can change their emoji skin tone in Settings.

record_voice_messages.description: Allow users to record voice messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations.

record_video_messages.description: Allow users to record video messages that can be sent in direct messages or group conversations. If the file share setting is disabled, they will not be able to record and send video messages.

screen_capture.description: Allow users to take and send screenshots in direct messages or group conversations.

create_public_channels.description: Allow users to create public channels.

create_private_channels.description: Allow users to create private channels.

share_links_in_chat.description: Share links to messages and channels in Team Chat.

schedule_meetings_in_chat.description: Schedule a meeting from chat or channel.

set_retention_period_in_cloud.description: Set retention period for messages and files in Zoom's cloud.

enable.description: By default, messages and files are stored in Zoom's cloud. Enable this setting to specify when they are deleted. When retention is disabled, messages sent by offline users can be received within 7 days before they are deleted.

retention_period_of_direct_messages_and_.description: Delete direct messages and group conversations after retention period. 'y' - year, 'm' - month, 'd' - day

retention_period_of_channels.description: Delete data in channels after retention period. 'y' - year, 'm' - month, 'd' - day

set_retention_period_in_local.description: Store messages on local devices, excluding personal channel messages.

enable.description: Specify how long your messages are saved on local devices. If this setting is disabled, messages are never deleted locally.

retention_period_of_direct_messages_and_.description: Delete direct messages and group conversations after retention period. 'y' - year, 'm' - month, 'd' - day

retention_period_of_channels.description: Delete data in channels after retention period. 'y' - year, 'm' - month, 'd' - day

enable.description: By disabling this setting, users will not be able to add contacts.

selected_option.description:
The type of allowing users to add contacts: 
* 1 — Anyone (internal and external contacts). 
* 2 — In the same organization. 
* 3 — In the same organization and specified domains. 
* 4 — In the same organization and specified users.

user_email_addresses.description:
The domains or emails (internal or external). 
* When the selected_option field value is 3, the value is internal or external domains. Use a comma to separate multiple domains. Example: company.com. 
* When the selected_option field value is 4, the value is internal or external email addresses. Use a comma to separate multiple emails.

allow_users_to_chat_with_others.description: Allow users to chat with others.

enable.description: If you select 'In the same organization', users may still be able to chat with external users if they are added to channels or group chats with external users.

selected_option.description:
The type of allowing users to add contacts: 
* 1 — Anyone (internal and external contacts). 
* 2 — In the same organization. 
* 3 — In the same organization and specified domains. 
* 4 — In the same organization and specified users.

user_email_addresses.description:
The domains or emails (internal or external). 
* When the selected_option field value is 3, the value is internal or external domains. Use a comma to separate multiple domains. Example: company.com. 
* When the selected_option field value is 4, the value is internal or external email addresses. Use a comma to separate multiple emails.

enable.description: Whether to enable the **Chat Etiquette Tool**.

policies.description: Information about the defined **Chat Etiquette Tool** policies.

is_locked.description: Whether the policy is locked by an account-level user. When it is locked, users cannot update the policy.

keywords.description: A list of defined rule keywords.

regular_expression.description: The regular expression to match to the content of chat messages.

status.description:
The policy's current status. 
* activated — Activated. 
* deactivated — Deactivated.

trigger_action.description:
The policy's trigger action. 
* 1 — Ask the user to confirm before they send the message. 
* 2 — Block the user's message.
x-enum-descriptions: Ask the user to confirm before they send the message.

policy_max_count.description: The read-only maximum number of **Chat Etiquette Tool** policies.

send_data_to_third_party_archiving_servi.description: Send data to third-party archiving service.

enable.description: Allow users to send data to third-party archiving service.

type.description:
The type of global relay. 
* global_relay — The participant cannot use chat.
* smarsh — Host and co-hosts only.

smtp_delivery_address.description: SMTP delivery address. It is used when the field type value is global_relay.

user_name.description: User name. It is used when the field type value is global_relay.

passcode.description: passcode. It is used when the field type value is global_relay.

authorized_channel_token.description: Authorized channel token. It is used when the field type value is smarsh.

apply_local_storage_to_personal_channel.description: Store personal channel messages on local devices.

enable.description: Specify how long your messages sent in your personal channel are saved on local devices. If this setting is disabled, messages are never deleted locally.

retention_period.description: Delete data after retention period. 'y' - year, 'm' - month, 'd' - day.

translate_messages.description: Allow users to translate team chat messages. [Learn more].(https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/12998089084685)

search_and_send_animated_gif_images.description: Allow users to search GIF images from GIPHY when they compose messages. See GIPHY's website for more information about content ratings.

enable.description: Whether to allow users to search GIF images from GIPHY when they compose messages.

giphy_content_rating.description: Set the GIPHY content rating. This feature is only available for Zoom Client v5.11.0 or later.

auto_security.description:
Whether to require that all meetings are secured with at least one security option. 

 This setting can only be disabled by Enterprise, ISV, Business (with more than 100 licenses), and Education accounts.

waiting_room.description:
Whether participants are placed in the [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) when they join a meeting. 

 If the **Waiting Room** feature is enabled, the [**Allow participants to join before host**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202828525-Allow-participants-to-join-before-host) setting is automatically disabled.

waiting_room_settings.description: Information about the waiting room settings.

participants_to_place_in_waiting_room.description:
The type of participants to be admitted to the Waiting Room: 
* 0 — All attendees. 
* 1 — Users who are not in your account. 
* 2 — Users who are not in your account and are not part of your [allowed domains list](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037117472-Configuring-authentication-profiles#h_e3cf0d5f-eec7-4c2a-ad29-ef2a5079a7da).

whitelisted_domains_for_waiting_room.description: If the participants_to_place_in_waiting_room field is 2, a comma-separated list of the domains that can bypass the Waiting Room ("example.com,example2.com").

users_who_can_admit_participants_from_wa.description:
The users who can admit participants from the Waiting Room: 
* 0 — Host and co-hosts only. 
* 1 — Host, co-hosts, and anyone who bypassed the Waiting Room if the host and co-hosts are not present.

meeting_password.description: Whether all instant and scheduled meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected. [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203276937) meetings are **not** included in this setting.

require_password_for_scheduled_meeting.description: Whether to require a password for meetings that have already been scheduled.

pmi_password.description: Whether all Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings that users can join via client or Zoom Rooms systems are password-protected.

phone_password.description:
Whether to require a password for participants joining by phone. 

 If enabled and the meeting is password-protected, a numeric password is required for participants to join by phone. For meetings with alphanumeric passwords, a numeric password will be generated.

webinar_password.description: Whether to generate a password when scheduling webinars. Participants must use the generated password to join the scheduled webinar.

require_password_for_scheduled_webinar.description: Whether to require a password for webinars that have already been scheduled.

meeting_password_requirement.description: Information about the meeting and webinar [password requirements](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033559832-Meeting-and-webinar-passwords#h_a427384b-e383-4f80-864d-794bf0a37604).

have_letter.description: Whether the password must contain at least one letter character.

have_number.description: Whether the password must contain at least one numeric character.

have_special_character.description: Whether the password must contain at least one special character. For example, !, @, and/or # characters.

only_allow_numeric.description: Whether the password must contain **only** numeric characters.

have_upper_and_lower_characters.description: Whether the password must include uppercase and lowercase characters.

consecutive_characters_length.description:
The maximum length of consecutive characters (for example, abcdef) allowed in a password: 
* 4 through 8 — The maximum consecutive characters length. The length is n minus 1, where n is the provided value. For example, if you provide the 4 value, there can only be a maximum of 3 consecutive characters in a password (for example, abc1x@8fdh). 
* 0 — Do not apply a consecutive character restriction.

weak_enhance_detection.description: Whether users will be informed when the provided password is weak.

embed_password_in_join_link.description: Whether the meeting password will be encrypted and included in the invitation link. The provided link will allow participants to join the meeting without having to enter the password.

end_to_end_encrypted_meetings.description: Whether to enable end-to-end encryption for meetings. If enabled, you can specify the type of encryption in the encryption_type field.

encryption_type.description:
The type of encryption to use when starting a meeting: 
* enhanced_encryption — Use enhanced encryption. Encryption data is stored in the cloud. 
* e2ee — End-to-end encryption. The encryption key is stored on the local device and cannot be obtained by anyone else. Enabling E2EE also [**disables** certain features](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360048660871), such as cloud recording, live streaming, and allowing participants to join before the host.

block_user_domain.description: Whether to block users in specific domains from joining meetings and webinars.

block_user_domain_list.description: The domain to block, up to 20 domains. For example, the *.example.com domain.

only_authenticated_can_join_from_webclie.description: Whether to specify that only authenticated users can join the meeting from the web client.

enable.description:
Whether to enable the **Chat Etiquette Tool**. This value defaults to false. 

 The **Chat Etiquette Tool** allows you to define specific keywords and text patterns in chat to prevent users from inadvertently sharing unwanted messages.

policies.description: Information about the defined **Chat Etiquette Tool** policies.

trigger_action.description:
The policy's trigger action: 
* 1 — Ask the user to confirm before they send the message. 
* 2 — Block the user's message.
x-enum-descriptions: Ask the user to confirm before they send the message.

keywords.description: A list of defined rule keywords.

regular_expression.description: The regular expression to match to the content of chat messages.

status.description:
The policy's current status: 
* activated — Activated. 
* deactivated — Deactivated.

is_locked.description: Whether to lock the policy. When it is locked, users cannot update the policy. This value defaults to false.

custom_data_center_regions.description:
Whether to use custom [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042411451-Selecting-data-center-regions-for-meetings-webinars): 
* true — Users can [select data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042411451-Selecting-data-center-regions-for-hosted-meetings-and-webinars) to use for hosting real-time meeting traffic. The data center regions can be provided in the data_center_regions field. 
* false — Only use the default data center regions.

data_center_regions.description:
If the value of custom_data_center_regions is true, a comma-separated list of the following [data center regions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360059254691-Datacenter-abbreviation-list) to opt in to: 
* AU — Australia.
* LA — Latin America. 
* CA — Canada. 
* CN — China. 
* DE — Germany. 
* HK — Hong Kong SAR. 
* IN — India. 
* IE — Ireland. 
* TY — Japan. 
* MX — Mexico. 
* NL — Netherlands. 
* SG — Singapore. 
* US — United States.

p2p_connetion.description: Whether to enable the [**Peer to Peer connection while only 2 people are in a meeting**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061410851-Enabling-Peer-to-Peer-connection-for-2-people-in-a-meeting) setting.

p2p_ports.description: Whether to enable the **Listening ports range** setting.

ports_range.description: When the p2p_ports value is true, the value is a semi-colon list of the peer to peer listening ports range, between 1 to 65535. This value defaults to an empty string.

dscp_audio.description: The DSCP audio marking value. This value defaults to 56.

dscp_marking.description: Whether to enable [differentiated services code point (DSCP)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Differentiated_services) marking.

dscp_video.description: The DSCP video marking value. This value defaults to 40.

dscp_dual.description: Whether to use the differentiated services code point classifiers ('dscp_video', 'dscp_audio') in the dual way (incoming and outgoing).

subsession.description: Allow host to split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms.

approved_or_denied_countries_or_regions.description: Approve or block users from specific regions or countries from joining this meeting.

approved_list.description: List of countries/regions from where participants can join this meeting.

denied_list.description: List of countries/regions from where participants can not join this meeting.

enable.description:
true: Setting enabled to either allow or block users from specific regions from joining your meetings.
false: Setting disabled.

method.description:
Specify whether to allow users from specific regions to join this meeting; or block users from specific regions from joining this meeting.

approve: Allow users from specific regions or countries to join this meeting. If this setting is selected, the approved regions or countries must be included in the approved_list.

deny: Block users from specific regions or countries from joining this meeting. If this setting is selected, the approved regions or countries must be included in the denied_list

time_stamp.description: A timestamp that indicates when the setting was updated.

old_object.description: Information about the account's previous settings.

settings.description: Information about the updated account or sub account settings. This only returns modified settings.

$changed_field_name.description: The updated field name and its previous value.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.permanently_deleted

The **Meeting has been permanently deleted** event is triggered every time a meeting scheduled by one of your app users or account users, is permanently deleted.

A meeting host or a user with admin privileges [permanently delete a meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360048488451-Deleting-local-or-cloud-recordings#h_b35c92a6-ec9e-4025-ab77-f0b52168aed2) via the [Zoom web portal](https://zoom.us). You can also programmatically delete a meet via the [**Delete a meeting**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingDelete) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting has been permanently deleted** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.permanently_deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who permanently deleted the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who permanently deleted the meeting.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who permanently deleted the meeting.

operation.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all meetings. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

requestBody.description:
# recording.registration_created

The **View registrant has registered for this recording** event is triggered every time a user registers for an on-demand cloud recording.

[Cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording) of Zoom meetings and webinars can be made [on-demand](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488283-On-demand-Recordings). With on-demand recordings, users can view the recordings of past meetings and webinars at any time as long as they have not been removed. To view cloud recordings, users can register manually by filling out the registration form that pops up when users click on the **Recording URL**.

Users can also be programmatically registered via the [**Create a recording registrant**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/meetingRecordingRegistrantCreate) API.
Once they complete the registration they can view the recording.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **View registrant has registered for this recording** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.registration_created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the host that recorded the meeting or webinar.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The webinar or meeting host's user ID.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The scheduled meeting or webinar duration.

status.description:
The registrant's status: 
* approved — Registrant is approved. 
* denied — Registrant is denied. 
* pending — Registrant is waiting for approval. 
* all — The default status code.

zip.description: The registrant's ZIP or postal code.

purchasing_time_frame.description:
The registrant's purchasing time frame: 
* Within a month 
* 1-3 months 
* 4-6 months 
* More than 6 months 
* No timeframe

role_in_purchase_process.description:
The registrant's role in the purchase process: 
* Decision Maker 
* Evaluator/Recommender 
* Influencer 
* Not involved

title.description: The title of the custom question.

value.description: The custom question's response value. This has a limit of 128 characters.

custom_questions.title: What do you hope to learn from this Webinar?
custom_questions.value: Look forward to learning how you come up with new recipes and what other services you offer.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.live_streaming_started

The **Meeting Live Streaming Started** event is triggered every time a meeting's live stream begins on a streaming platform. The host that begins the live stream must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

Zoom lets users live stream their Zoom meetings on [YouTube Live](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028478292-Streaming-a-Meeting-or-Webinar-on-YouTube-Live), [Facebook](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000350406-Streaming-a-meeting-or-webinar-on-Facebook-Live), [Workplace by Facebook](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005460286-Live-Stream-Meetings-or-Webinars-on-Workplace-by-Facebook), and via a [custom live streaming services](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001777826-Live-Streaming-Meetings-or-Webinars-Using-a-Custom-Service).

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Live Streaming Started** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.live_streaming_started`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the meeting.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

service.description:
The name of the live streaming service: 
* Facebook 
* Workplace_by_Facebook 
* YouTube 
* Twitch 
* Custom_Live_Streaming_Service

custom_live_streaming_settings.description: Information about the custom live stream.

resolution.description: The number of pixels in each dimension that the video camera can display.

date_time.description: The date and time the live stream started.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.created

The **Meeting has been created** event is triggered every time a meeting is created by one of your app users or account users.

Zoom offers multiple methods for users to schedule new meetings. Users can manually create meetings via the Zoom client or the [Zoom web portal](https://zoom.us/). Users can also programmatically create meetings via the [**Create a Meeting**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingCreate) API.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting has been created** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who created the meeting.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who created the meeting.

operation.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all meetings. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

join_url.description: The URL to join the meeting.

password.description: The password required to join the meeting.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

status.description:
The meeting occurrence status: 
* available 
* deleted

use_pmi.description: Whether the use of PMI is enabled.

alternative_hosts.description: A semicolon-separated list of the meeting's alternative hosts' email addresses or IDs.

type.description:
The type of recurring meeting: 
* 1 — Daily. 
* 2 — Weekly. 
* 3 — Monthly.

repeat_interval.description:
The meeting's repeat interval: 
* For daily intervals, a max of 90 days. 
* For a weekly interval, a max of 12 weeks. 
* For monthly intervals, a max of 3 months.

weekly_days.description:
A comma-separated list of the days of the week on which the recurring weekly meeting occurs: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

monthly_day.description: The day of the month on which the recurring monthly meeting occurs. The value ranges from 1 to 31.

monthly_week_day.description:
The day of the week on which the recurring monthly meeting is scheduled: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

end_times.description: The number of times the recurring meeting will occur before it is canceled.

end_date_time.description: The recurring meeting's final ending date and time before it is canceled, in UTC format.

monthly_week.description:
The week of the month on which a recurring meeting occurs: 
* -1 — The last week of the month. 
* 1 — The first week. 
* 2 — The second week. 
* 3 — The third week. 
* 4 — The fourth week.

visible.description: Whether the tracking field is visible in the meeting scheduling options in the Zoom web portal. When the tracking field is disabled, the field can be only be set by users via API.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_room_system_callout_accepted

The **Invited party answered a meeting invitation through phone (call out) via Zoom room** event is triggered every time a user [joins a meeting through phone (call out) from a Zoom room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205369035).

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Invited party answered a meeting invitation through phone (call out) via Zoom room** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_room_system_callout_accepted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the meeting host.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

host_id.description: The user ID of the meeting host.

inviter_name.description: The user name of the event's trigger.

call_type.description: The type of call out. Use a value of h323 or sip.

requestBody.description:
# information_barriers.policy_updated

The **Information barriers policy has been updated** event is triggered when using an API or web page to update an [information barrier](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers).

As an account owner or admin can update information barrier policies. Update an information barrier policy either by using the Update an information barriers policy API, or by logging into the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us) and navigating to the [**information barrier**](https://zoom.us/account/information_barriers) page.



## Prerequisites

* To enable information barriers for yout account, [contact Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362003).



**Event type**: `information_barriers.policy_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who updated the policy.

settings.description:
The Information Barriers policy's settings. 
* If the meeting setting is true, then a [hard block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups. 
* If the meeting setting is false but the screen_share, file_transfer, in_meeting_chat, im, and/or recording settings are true, then a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups.

complete_phone_calls.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** call each other.

file_transfer.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** transfer files in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

im.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** IM chat. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

in_meeting_chat.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** use chat in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

meeting.description: If true, the users between groups **cannot** meet. This also creates a [hard block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups.

message_via_sms.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** user SMS.

recording.description:
If true, users between groups **cannot** record the meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false. 

This feature is only available for Zoom Client v5.6.0 and higher.

screen_share.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** share screens in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the meeting value is false.

status.description:
The Information Barriers policy's status: 
* 0 — Disabled. 
* 1 — Enabled.

type.description:
The Information Barriers policy's type of settings restrictions: 
* 0 — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists, but users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 
* 1 — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists and only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* 2 — No blocks exist, but only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* 3 — No blocks exist and users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 

This field only supports 0.

object.description: The diff of the [Information Barrier](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers) policy and its information.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.registration_approved

The **Webinar Registration has been approved** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users approve a user's registration.

[Scheduling a Webinar with registration](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204619915-Scheduling-a-Webinar-with-Registration) requires registrants to complete a brief form before receiving the link to join a Webinar. [Webinar Registration options](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202835649-Webinar-Registration-Customization#h_b74e0e26-5f3f-40d4-a3de-949dbfd85882) can be customized by a Zoom admin or a Webinar host. This customization allows them to choose whether to approve attendees automatically or manually.

When the registration is set to be approved manually, a pending registrant can either be approved or denied from joining the Webinar.

To approve a registrant manually, navigate to the [Webinars](https://zoom.us/webinar/list) page and click on the name of the webinar. Click **Edit** to the right of **Manage Attendees** option, select the registrant and click **Approve**. Alternatively, use the [**Update registrant's status**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/webinarRegistrantStatus) API to approve the registrant programmatically.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Manual Approval** enabled for [Webinar Registrations](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/211579443-Registration-for-Meetings).
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **Webinar Registration has been approved** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.registration_approved`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who approved the registration.

operator.description: The email address of the user who approved the webinar registration.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who approved the webinar registration.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinar with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

join_url.description: The URL to join the webinar.

tracking_source.description: Information about the source tracking. See [Creating webinar registration tracking links](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000315683-Creating-webinar-registration-tracking-links) for details.

id.description: Unique Identifier of the tracking source.

source_name.description: Name of the source (platform) where the registration URL was shared.

tracking_url.description: Tracking URL. The URL that was shared for the registration.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.breakout_room_sharing_started

The **User in breakout room started sharing** event is triggered when a user in a [breakout room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005769646-Participating-in-breakout-rooms) begins [sharing content](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362153-Sharing-your-screen-or-desktop-on-Zoom), such as their desktop or the [classic whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205677665-Sharing-a-whiteboard).

Breakout rooms are sessions that are split off from the main Zoom meeting. They allow the participants to meet in smaller groups and are completely isolated in terms of audio and video from the main session.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **User in breakout room started sharing** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.breakout_room_sharing_started`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The main meeting host's account ID.

uuid.description: The main meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

breakout_room_uuid.description: The breakout room's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each breakout room instance generates a breakout room UUID.

host_id.description: The main meeting host's user ID.

type.description:
The main meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

user_id.description: The participant's ID. This is a unique ID assigned to the participant upon joining the meeting and is only valid for that meeting.

parent_user_id.description: The participant's main meeting user ID (user_id).

id.description: The participant's user ID. This is the same value used in the [**Users**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#tag/Users) APIs if the participant logged in to join the meeting.

content.description:
The type of shared content: 
* application — An application. For example, a web browser. 
* whiteboard — The [Zoom Whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4410916881421). 
* desktop — A user's desktop. 
* airplay — A user's airplay. 
* camera — A user's camera. 
* unknown — An unrecognized application, such as a third party app.

link_source.description:
The Dropbox sharing method: 
* deep_link — A [deep link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_linking). 
* in_meeting — A link shared via Zoom. 
* An empty string value if the link source is **not** a Dropbox link.

file_link.description: The Dropbox file's link. This field returns an empty string value if the file link is **not** from a Dropbox source.

date_time.description: The screenshare's date and time.

source.description:
The source from which the file was shared: 
* dropbox — A Dropbox source. 
* An empty string value if the source is **not** Dropbox.

requestBody.description:
# meeting.participant_feedback

The **Get participant survey feedback for meetings** event is triggered every time an attendee completes an [end-of-meeting experience feedback survey](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005855266-End-of-meeting-experience-feedback-survey) for a meeting. A meeting attendee is a meeting participant or the host.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Get participant survey feedback for meetings** subscription must be enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_feedback`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who commit the feedback.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

feedback_details.description: The feedback details. This returns null if the satisfied field is true.

id.description:
The Id of the feedback: 
* 1 — Poor video quality. 
* 2 — Poor audio quality. 
* 5 — Unable to present using share.zoom.us. 
* 7 — Unable to make phone call. 
* 8 — They could not hear us. 
* 9 — We could not hear them. 
* 10 — They could not see us. 
* 11 — We could not see them. 
* 12 — Could not present computer screen. 
* 999 — Others.

comments.description: The participant's comments. This returns null if the satisfied field is true.

requestBody.description:
# account.entitlement_removed

The **Account's entitlement removed** event is triggered each time an account or sub account's entitlement is removed.

requestBody.description:
# user.personal_notes_updated

The **User's personal notes have been updated** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users updates personal notes on the Zoom Client app.

Users that are signed in to Zoom can set their presence status in the [Zoom Client apps](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207373866-Zoom-Installers) can specify a personal note that appears at the top of the chat profile to anyone who can see the profile. The note can be changed as often as needed and is commonly used to provide a meaningful note, a job title, or to include detailed information about the user's presence status.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **User's personal notes have been updated** subscription must be enabled under the **User Activity** event.



**Event type**: `user.personal_notes_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user's account owner.

date_time.description: The date and time at which the user's personal note was updated.

old_object.description: Information about the user's previous personal note.

requestBody.description:
# recording.deleted

This event is triggered when a user permanently deletes a cloud recording.

When a user initially deletes a recording, it is sent to the trash. At this stage, the recording can still be recovered for up to 30 days after deletion. To permanently delete a recording, users must delete it from the trash.

Users can permanently delete a recording via the [**Delete meeting recordings**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/recordingDelete) API with the `delete` query parameter or in the [Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Recording-Management).

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording files have been permanently deleted** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.deleted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that completed the meeting or webinar recording.

operator.description: The email address of the user who deleted the recording.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who deleted the recording.

object.description: Information about the webinar or meeting recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that completed the meeting or webinar recording.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

share_url.description: The URL at which approved users can view the recording.

total_size.description: The recording file's total size, in bytes.

recording_count.description: The number of recording files deleted.

recording_files.description: Information about the deleted recording files.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which recording ended.

file_type.description: The type of the recording file.

file_size.description: The recording file's size, in bytes.

file_extension.description: The file extension type of the recording file.

play_url.description: The URL at which the recording file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL at which to download the the recording. 

 **JWT apps** 

 To access a private or password-protected cloud recording of a user in your account, use a [Zoom JWT app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-jwt-app). Use the generated JWT token as the value of the access_token query parameter and include this query parameter at the end of the URL. 

 https://{{base-domain}}/recording/download/{{path-to-file-download}}?access_token={{JWT-token}} 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains recording scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the file. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/archive/download/xxx?access_token={{OAuth-access-token}}. 

**Note:** We recommend that you send the access_token as a Bearer token in the Authorization header, for example: "Authorization": "Bearer <ACCESS_TOKEN>”.

status.description:
The recording file's processing status: 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

recording_type.description:
The recording file type. 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view(CC) 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view 
* shared_screen_with_gallery_view 
* gallery_view 
* shared_screen 
* audio_only 
* audio_transcript 
* chat_file 
* active_speaker 
* host_video 
* audio_only_each_participant 
* cc_transcript 
* closed_caption 
* poll 
* timeline 
* thumbnail 
* audio_interpretation 
* summary 
* summary_next_steps 
* summary_smart_chapters 
*sign_interpretation 
*production_studio 

 For more information, read our [Managing and sharing cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Managing-and-sharing-cloud-recordings#h_9898497b-e736-4980-a749-d55608f10773) documentation.

participant_audio_files.description: Information about the participants' deleted audio files.

recording_start.description: The participant audio file's start time.

recording_end.description: The participant audio file's end time.

file_size.description: The participant audio file's size, in bytes.

play_url.description: The URL at which the participant audio file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL at which to download the the recording. 

 **JWT apps** 

 To access a private or password-protected cloud recording of a user in your account, use a [Zoom JWT app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-jwt-app). Use the generated JWT token as the value of the access_token query parameter and include this query parameter at the end of the URL. 

 https://{{base-domain}}/recording/download/{{path-to-file-download}}?access_token={{JWT-token}} 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains recording scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the file. For example: 

https://{{base-domain}}/rec/archive/download/xxx?access_token={{OAuth-access-token}} 

 **Note:** This field does **not** return for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). Instead, this API will return the file_path field.

file_path.description:
The file path to the On-Premise account recording. 

 **Note:** This API returns this field for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). It does **not** return the download_url field.

status.description:
The participant audio file's processing status: 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

# recording.paused

The **Recording Paused** event is triggered every time a recording is paused by one of your app's users or account users.

All users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). An account owner or account admin can [enable cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_29fc1846-190d-4f05-ab23-1070c8106ec8) for all account members as well as for members that belong to a certain group. Users can also enable cloud recordings [for their own use](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_4cca2458-cbd5-4439-933c-57c0d62a2753).

Only a host or a co-host of the meeting/webinar can start, pause, resume or stop a [cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording).

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording Paused** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.paused`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that started the meeting or webinar recording.

object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which the recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which the recording ended.
