# meeting.participant_room_system_callout_ringing

The **Invited party's phone (call out) ringing in Zoom room** event is triggered every time a user's phone is ringing when they were invited to [join a meeting through phone (call out) from a Zoom room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205369035).

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Invited party's phone (call out) ringing in Zoom room** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_room_system_callout_ringing`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the meeting host.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

host_id.description: The user ID of the meeting host.

inviter_name.description: The user name of the event's trigger.

call_type.description: The type of call out. Use a value of h323 or sip.

# recording.started

The **Recording Started** event is triggered every time a recording is started by one of your app users or account users.

All users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). An account owner or account admin can [enable cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_29fc1846-190d-4f05-ab23-1070c8106ec8) for all account members as well as for members that belong to a certain group. Users can also enable cloud recordings [for their own use](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_4cca2458-cbd5-4439-933c-57c0d62a2753).

Only a host or a co-host of the meeting/webinar can [start cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_7420acb5-1897-4061-87b4-5b76e99c03b4) of the meeting/webinar.

## Prerequisites

# user.tsp_updated

The **A user's TSP account was updated** event is triggered every time a [user's TSP account information is updated](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userTSPUpdate).

Zoom allows certain carrier partners to provision Telephony Service Provider (TSP) audio to users. For users to use TSP audio, carrier partners must create a TSP user account with Zoom for the users.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan with TSP Configurations enabled.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* The **A user's TSP account was updated** subscription must be enabled under the **TSP** event.



**Event type**: `user.tsp_updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who updated the TSP.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the TSP.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the TSP.

tsp_credentials.description: Information about the updated user's TSP credentials.

dial_in_numbers.description: Information about the TSP dial-in numbers.

type.description:
The type of the phone number: 
* toll — Toll number. 
* tollfree — Toll free number. 
* media_link — Media link.

country_label.description:
The TSP country label: 
* US_TSP_TB 
* EU_TSP_TB

old_object.description: Information about the updated user's previous settings.

changed_field_name.description: The updated field name and its previous value.

$changed_field_name.description: The updated field name and its previous value.

# meeting.participant_admitted

The **Participant was admitted into a meeting** event is triggered every time [a meeting host admits the participant from a waiting room to the meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room#h_f493a86f-7d08-4e3b-9d6d-9b236fe9cdcd). The meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

When a participant joins a [Waiting Room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room), the meeting host is notified in the Zoom client. The host has the option to admit the participant to the meeting or remove the participant from the Waiting Room and the meeting.

## Prerequisites

* The [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) feature enabled for the meeting.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant was admitted into a meeting** subscription must be enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_admitted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

participant.description: Information about the meeting participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, email returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty (””) value.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

date_time.description: The time at which the participant joined the meeting.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

requestBody.description:
# user.invitation_accepted

The **User has accepted the account invitation** event is triggered every time a user accepts the invitation to join a Zoom account.

Admins and account owners can add new users as well as existing users with free Zoom accounts to an account. The user can be added either from the [Zoom Web Portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363183-User-Management#h_335dcf54-d106-4c8d-8533-68e2fc3d20a6) or by using the [**Create users**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userCreate) API. Once a user is added, an invitation email is sent to the user.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **User has accepted the account invitation** subscription must be enabled under the **User** event.



**Event type**: `user.invitation_accepted`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account from which the invitation was sent to the user.

type.description:
The type of user: 
* 1 — Basic. 
* 2 — Licensed.

# meeting.participant_room_system_callout_failed

The **Meeting invitation through phone (call out) via Zoom room failed** event is triggered every time an invitation to [join a meeting through phone (call out) from a Zoom room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205369035) fails.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Meeting invitation through phone (call out) via Zoom room failed** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_room_system_callout_failed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the meeting host.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

host_id.description: The user ID of the meeting host.

inviter_name.description: The user name of the event's trigger.

reason_type.description:
reason type for failure: 
* 1 — Encryption_Fail. 
* 2 — Disconnected_By_Remote. 
* 3 — Retry. 
* 4 — Bad_Seq. 
* 5 — Call_Limit. 
* 6 — Not_Registered. 
* 7 — Timeout. 
* 8 — Bad_Addr. 
* 9 — Unreachable 
* 10 — Disconnect_By_Local 
* 11 — Server_Internal_Error 
* 12 — Exceed_Free_Port 
* 13 — Connect_Error 
* 14 — Proxy_Connect_Error 
* 0 — Other_Failed_Reason.

call_type.description: The type of call out. Use a value of h323 or sip.

# recording.resumed

The **Recording Resumed** event is triggered every time a previously paused recording of a meeting or webinar is resumed.

All users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). An account owner or account admin can [enable cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_29fc1846-190d-4f05-ab23-1070c8106ec8) for all account members as well as for members that belong to a certain group. Users can also enable cloud recordings [for their own use](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_4cca2458-cbd5-4439-933c-57c0d62a2753).

Only a host or a co-host of the meeting/webinar can start, pause, resume, and stop a [cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). A host/co-host can resume a paused recording of a meeting or a webinar.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording Resumed** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.resumed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that resumed the meeting or webinar recording.

object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which the recording ended.

event_ts.description: A timestamp when the event occurred.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.participant_joined The **Participant/Host joined webinar** event is triggered every time a host or an attendee joins a Webinar that was created by one of your app users or account users. Zoom users with a [Webinar Plan](https://zoom.us/webinar) have access to creating and managing Webinars. A Webinar host can invite other users to attend the webinar.
[Zoom Video Webinar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar) allows users to broadcast a Zoom meeting to up to 1000 attendees. ## Prerequisites * Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license. * **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations: * A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**. * The **Participant/Host joined webinar** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event. **Event type**: `webinar.participant_joined`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

participant.description: Information about the webinar participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, email returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

user_id.description: The participant's webinar user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a webinar and is only valid for the duration of the webinar.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the webinar **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value. 

 **Note:** Use the participant_user_id value instead of this value. We will remove this response in a future release.

join_time.description: The date and time at which the participant joined the webinar.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the webinar by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

registrant_id.description: The participant's registrant ID. (A host or a user with administrative permissions can require [registration for Zoom meetings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/articles/211579443)).

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the webinar **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's UUID for this specific webinar. This value is assigned to a participant when they join a webinar, and is only valid for the duration of that webinar.

customer_key.description: The participant's SDK identifier. This value can be alphanumeric.

requestBody.description:
# recording.renamed

The **Recording Renamed** event is triggered every time the title of a cloud recording is changed.

All users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). After a meeting or a webinar which was being recorded to the cloud ends, the recording is made available on the host's [Zoom account](https://zoom.us/recording).

By default, the title of the recording is the same as the topic of the meeting or the webinar that was recorded. However, a meeting host, an account admin or an account owner can rename the title of the recording using the Zoom Web Portal. To do so, the user must navigate to the [**Cloud Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) in the Zoom Web Portal, click on the recording that needs to be renamed and click on the pencil icon to rename the title of the recording.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event notification endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording Renamed** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.renamed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that renamed the meeting or webinar recording.

operator.description: The email address of the user that renamed the meeting or webinar recording.

operator_id.description: The user Id of the user that renamed the meeting or webinar recording.

time_stamp.description: A timestamp at which the user renamed the meeting or webinar recording.

object.description: Information about meeting or webinar recording.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting.

* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time.

* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

# meeting.participant_room_system_callout_missed

The **Invited party missed a meeting invitation through phone (call out) via Zoom room** event is triggered every time an invitation to [join a meeting through phone (call out) from a Zoom room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205369035) times out.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Invited party missed a meeting invitation through phone (call out) via Zoom room** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_room_system_callout_missed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the meeting host.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

host_id.description: The user ID of the meeting host.

inviter_name.description: The user name of the event's trigger.

call_type.description: The type of call out. Use a value of h323 or sip.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.created

The **Webinar has been created** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users creates a Webinar.

Zoom users with a [Webinar Plan](https://zoom.us/webinar) have access to creating and managing webinars. [Zoom Video Webinar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar) allows users to broadcast a Zoom meeting to up to 1000 attendees.

A user can create a Webinar manually by logging into the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/) and clicking on **Schedule a Webinar** button in the [Webinars](https://zoom.us/webinar/list) page. Alternatively, users can also use the [**Create a Webinar**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/webinarCreate) API to schedule a Webinar programmatically.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscription** must be enabled for your [Marketplace App](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event notification endpoint URL**
	* The **Webinar has been created** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.created`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

operator.description: The email address of the user who created the webinar.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who created the webinar.

operation.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all webinar. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

join_url.description: The URL to join the webinar.

password.description: The password required to join the webinar.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinars with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

status.description:
The webinar occurrence status: 
* available 
* deleted

use_pmi.description: Whether the use of PMI is enabled.

alternative_hosts.description: A semicolon-separated list of the webinar's alternative hosts' email addresses or IDs.

type.description:
The type of recurring meeting: 
* 1 — Daily. 
* 2 — Weekly. 
* 3 — Monthly.

repeat_interval.description:
The meeting's repeat interval: 
* For daily intervals, a max of 90 days. 
* For a weekly interval, a max of 12 weeks. 
* For monthly intervals, a max of 3 months.

weekly_days.description:
A comma-separated list of the days of the week on which the recurring weekly meeting occurs: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

monthly_day.description: The day of the month on which the recurring monthly meeting occurs. The value ranges from 1 to 31.

monthly_week_day.description:
The day of the week on which the recurring monthly meeting is scheduled: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

end_times.description: The number of times the recurring meeting will occur before it is canceled.

end_date_time.description: The recurring meeting's final ending date and time before it is canceled, in UTC format.

monthly_week.description:
The week of the month on which a recurring meeting occurs: 
* -1 — The last week of the month. 
* 1 — The first week. 
* 2 — The second week. 
* 3 — The third week. 
* 4 — The fourth week.

# user.signed_out

The **User has signed out** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users signs out of Zoom.

Users that are signed in can sign out of their Zoom accounts using the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/signin) as well as any of the [Zoom Client](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207373866-Zoom-Installers) apps.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **User has signed out** subscription must be enabled under the **User Activity** event.



**Event type**: `user.signed_out`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the account from which the user signed out.

client_type.description:
The user's client [type](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207373866-Zoom-Installers): 
* browser — Browser. 
* mac — MacOS. 
* win — Windows. 
* iphone — iPhone. 
* android — Android. 
* ipad — iPad. 
* chromeos — Chrome OS. 
* linux — Linux.

date_time.description: The date and time at which the user signed out.

version.description: The [Zoom client version number](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207373866-Zoom-Installers). If the user signs in via browser, the value of this field will return a - value.

The method the user logged in with: 
* 0 — Facebook. 
* 1 — Google. 
* 100 — Zoom. 
* 101 — Single Sign-On (SSO).

# recording.registration_denied

The **View registrant has denied for this recording** event is triggered every time a registrant is denied from viewing a cloud recording.

[Cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording) of Zoom meetings and webinars can be made [on-demand](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488283-On-demand-Recordings). With on-demand recordings, users can view the recordings of past meetings and webinars at any time as long as they have not been removed. To view these recordings, users can register manually by filling out the registration form that pops up when users click on the **Recording URL** provided by the Webinar organizer. After the registration, only registrants that are approved will be able to view the recording.

An account owner, a host of the meeting/webinar or a user with admin privileges can customize the [registration approval settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488283-On-demand-Recordings) for cloud recordings. The [registrants' information](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488283-On-demand-Recordings) can be viewed from the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/recording). A pending or a previously approved registrant can be denied from viewing the recording by clicking **Deny**. The registrants can also be denied by using the [**Update registrant's status**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/meetingRecordingRegistrantStatus) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Cloud recording must be enabled on the users' account.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event notification endpoint URL**.
	* The **View registrant has denied for this recording** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.registration_denied`

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who denied the recording registration.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The webinar or meeting host's user ID.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

# meeting.live_streaming_stopped

The **Meeting Live Streaming Stopped** event is triggered every time a meeting's live stream ends. The host of the live stream must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

Zoom lets users live stream their Zoom meetings on [YouTube Live](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028478292-Streaming-a-Meeting-or-Webinar-on-YouTube-Live), [Facebook](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000350406-Streaming-a-meeting-or-webinar-on-Facebook-Live), [Workplace by Facebook](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005460286-Live-Stream-Meetings-or-Webinars-on-Workplace-by-Facebook), and via a [custom live streaming services](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001777826-Live-Streaming-Meetings-or-Webinars-Using-a-Custom-Service).

## **Prerequisites**:
  * **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting Live Streaming Stopped** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.live_streaming_stopped`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the meeting.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

service.description:
The name of the live streaming service: 
* Facebook 
* Workplace_by_Facebook 
* YouTube 
* Twitch 
* Custom_Live_Streaming_Service

custom_live_streaming_settings.description: Information about the custom live stream.

resolution.description: The number of pixels in each dimension that the video camera can display.

date_time.description: The date and time the live stream ended.

requestBody.description:
# webinar.registration_cancelled

The **Webinar Registration has been canceled** event is triggered whenever one of these two conditions are met:

* A registrant cancels their registration for a Webinar created by one of your app users or account users.
* A host who is also a user of your app or your Zoom account cancels the registration of a registrant who was previously approved.

[Scheduling a Webinar with registration](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204619915-Scheduling-a-Webinar-with-Registration) requires registrants to complete a brief form before receiving the link to join the Webinar. [Webinar Registration options](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202835649-Webinar-Registration-Customization#h_b74e0e26-5f3f-40d4-a3de-949dbfd85882) can be customized by a Zoom admin or a Webinar host. This customization allows them to choose whether to approve attendees automatically or manually.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **Webinar Registration has been canceled** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.registration_cancelled`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the webinar.

operator.description: The email address of the user who canceled the webinar registration.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who canceled the webinar registration.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinars with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

tracking_source.description: Information about the source tracking. See [Creating webinar registration tracking links](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000315683-Creating-webinar-registration-tracking-links) for details.

id.description: Unique Identifier of the tracking source.

source_name.description: Name of the source (platform) where the registration URL was shared.

tracking_url.description: Tracking URL. The URL that was shared for the registration.

# user.activated

The **User has been activated** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users activates a deactivated user.

Admins and account owners can deactivate users in a Zoom account as well as activate the previously deactivated users. To activate a user who was previously deactivated, call the [**Update user status**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userStatus) API or [activate the user from the Zoom Web Portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269946-Remove-User-from-your-Account#h_16319724-d120-4be6-af5d-31582d134ea0). Any licenses or plans that the user had prior to deactivation will have to be reassigned after activation.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **User has been activated** subscription must be enabled under the **User** event.



**Event type**: `user.activated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user's account owner.

operator.description: The email address of the user that activated the user.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user that activated the user.

type.description:
The type of user: 
* 1 — Basic. 
* 2 — Licensed.

# meeting.recovered

The **Meeting has been recovered** event is triggered every time a user recovers a previously-deleted meeting. The user must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

Zoom users can restore previously-deleted meetings for up to one week after deletion. Any invitations, links, and meeting IDs sent prior to the meeting's deletion will still work after a user [recovers](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038297111-Recovering-a-deleted-meeting) it.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Meeting has been recovered** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.recovered`

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who recovered the meeting.

operator.description: The email address of the user who recovered the meeting.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who recovered the meeting.

operation.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all meetings. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring meetings with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the meeting's type value is 8.

# user.signed_in

The **User has signed in** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users signs in to Zoom.

Users that are registered with Zoom can sign in and sign out of their Zoom accounts at any time using their email and password via [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/signin) as well as any of the [Zoom Client apps](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/207373866-Zoom-Installers). For users that have SSO enabled, they can also [log in with their SSO](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201800126-Log-in-with-SSO). The exceptions to this are [deactivated users](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269946-Remove-User-from-your-Account#h_6a9bc1c3-d739-4945-b1f2-00b3b88fb5cc), and users created using the `custCreate` option via the [**Create users**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/userCreate) API. These users do not have the ability to sign in with Zoom.

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**
	* The **User has signed in** subscription must be enabled under the **User Activity** event.



**Event type**: `user.signed_in`

account_id.description: The account ID of the account from which the user signed in.

* iphone — iPhone. 
* android — Android.

* linux — Linux.

The method the user logged in with:

* 1 — Google. 
* 100 — Zoom. 
* 101 — Single Sign-On (SSO).

# recording.completed

This event is triggered when a recording of a meeting or webinar becomes available to view or download.

Users with a Pro or a higher plan have access to [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). Account owners and account admins can [enable cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_29fc1846-190d-4f05-ab23-1070c8106ec8) for account members.
Users can also enable cloud recordings [for their own use](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording#h_4cca2458-cbd5-4439-933c-57c0d62a2753).

Only meeting or webinar hosts and co-hosts can start and complete a [cloud recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855-Cloud-Recording). A recording is considered complete **after** the host or co-host ends the meeting or webinar.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* Enable Cloud recording on the users' account.
* Enable **Event Subscriptions** for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with:
	* A valid **Event notification endpoint URL**.
	* The **All Recordings have completed** subscription must be enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.completed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp when the event occurred.

download_token.description:
Use the generated token value with the download_url value to download the cloud recording via an [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app). The download token only lasts for 24 hours after its creation, and you can only download the file within 24 hours of receiving the event notification. Pass download_token as a bearer token in the authorization header of your HTTP request. 

 
curl --request GET \
  --url {download_url} \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {download_token} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who completed the meeting or webinar recording.

object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who completed the meeting or webinar recording.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar. 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting's or webinar's start time.

share_url.description: The URL where approved users can view the recording.

total_size.description: The recording file's total size, in bytes.

recording_count.description: The number of completed recording files.

on_prem.description: Whether the recording is an [on-premise](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment) recording.

recording_play_passcode.description: The cloud recording's password to be used in the URL. This recording's password can be directly spliced in play_url or share_url with ?pwd= to access and play, such as in 'https://zoom.us/rec/share/**************?pwd=yNYIS408EJygs7rE5vVsJwXIz4-VW7MH'. See [Embedding meeting passcode in invite link](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360060396571-Embedding-meeting-passcode-in-invite-link) for details. If you want to use this field, please contact Zoom support.

recording_files.description: Information about the completed recording files.

recording_start.description: The date and time when recording started.

file_type.description: The type of the recording file.

file_size.description: The recording file's size, in bytes.

file_extension.description: The file extension type of the recording file.

play_url.description: The URL where the recording file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the the recording. To download the recording file of a meeting or a webinar, use the download_token value to download the file. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/webhook_download/download/xxx--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{your-download_token-value}}

 **Note:** This API returns this field for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). It does **not** return the download_url field.

status.description:
The recording file's processing status.

recording_type.description:
The recording file type. 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view(CC)

participant_audio_files.description: Information about the participants' audio files.

recording_start.description: The participant audio file's start time.

recording_end.description: The participant audio file's end time.

file_size.description: The participant audio file's size, in bytes.

play_url.description: The URL to open and play the participant audio file.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the the recording. To download the recording file of a meeting or a webinar, use the download_token value to download the file. For example:

# meeting.participant_put_in_waiting_room

The **Participant was put in a waiting room** event is triggered every time a participant who has already joined the meeting is returned to the Waiting Room during the meeting. The meeting host must be a user in your account or a user in any other accounts that have installed your [webhook-enabled](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/webhook-reference#enable-webhooks) app.

During a meeting, a meeting host can send a participant to the Waiting Room by selecting the **Put in Waiting Room** option in the Zoom client.

## Prerequisites

* The [**Waiting Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000332726-Waiting-Room) enabled for the meeting.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Participant was put in a waiting room**" subscription must be enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_put_in_waiting_room`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who created the meeting.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

type.description:
The meeting type: 
* 0 — A prescheduled meeting. 
* 1 — An instant meeting. 
* 2 — A scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A [personal meeting room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843). 
* 7 — A [PAC (Personal Audio Conference)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205172455-Hosting-a-Personal-Audio-Conference-PAC-meeting) meeting. 
* 8 — A recurring meeting with a fixed time.

participant.description: Information about the meeting participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, email returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

user_id.description: The participant's meeting user ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting.

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the id value in the [**Get a user**](/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's meeting universally unique ID (UUID). This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the duration of the meeting. This value will not be changed when the participant joins/leaves a breakout room.

date_time.description: The time at which the participant joined the meeting.

email.description: The participant's email address. This response only returns if the participant joined the meeting by logging into Zoom. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

requestBody.description:
# recording.trashed

This event is triggered when a user initially deletes a cloud recording.

When a user initially deletes a recording, it is sent to the trash. To move a recording to the trash, users can use the [**Delete meeting recordings**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/recordingDelete) API or the [Zoom web client](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Recording-Management). Users can recover recordings from the trash  up to 30 days after deletion.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Recording files have been deleted to Trash** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.trashed`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

download_token.description:
Use the generated token value with the download_url value to download the cloud recording via an [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app). The download token only lasts for 24 hours after its creation and you can only download the file within 24 hours of receiving the event notification. You can either include the download_token as a query parameter or pass it as a Bearer token in the Authorization header of your HTTP request: 

 **Using an Authorization header (Recommended)** 

 
curl --request GET \
  --url {download_url} \
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {download_token} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
 

**Using a query parameter** 

 
{download_url}/?access_token={download_token}
 

 For example: https://zoom.us/recording/download/123456?access_token=abcdefgh

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who deleted the recording to the trash.

operator.description: The email address of the user who deleted the recording to the trash.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who deleted the recording to the trash.

object.description: Information about the webinar or meeting recording.

id.description: The ID of the recorded meeting (meetingId) or webinar (webinarId).

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

host_id.description: The ID of the user set as the host of the meeting or webinar.

type.description:
The type of recorded meeting or webinar: 

 If the recording is of a meeting: 
* 1 — Instant meeting. 
* 2 — Scheduled meeting. 
* 3 — A recurring meeting with no fixed time. 
* 4 — A meeting created via PMI (Personal Meeting ID). 
* 7 — A [Personal Audio Conference](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204517069-Getting-Started-with-Personal-Audio-Conference) (PAC). 
* 8 - Recurring meeting with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is of a webinar: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time. 

 If the recording is **not** from a meeting or webinar: 

* 99 — A recording uploaded via the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) interface on the Zoom Web Portal.

start_time.description: The meeting or webinar's start time.

duration.description: The meeting or webinar's scheduled duration.

share_url.description: The URL at which approved users can view the recording.

total_size.description: The recording file's total size, in bytes.

recording_count.description: The number of recording files deleted to the trash.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that completed the meeting or webinar recording.

recording_files.description: Information about the trashed recording files.

recording_start.description: The date and time at which recording started.

recording_end.description: The date and time at which recording ended.

file_size.description: The recording file's size, in bytes.

play_url.description: The URL at which the recording file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL at which to download the the recording. 

 **JWT apps** 

 To access a private or password-protected cloud recording of a user in your account, use a [Zoom JWT app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-jwt-app). Use the generated JWT token as the value of the access_token query parameter and include this query parameter at the end of the URL. 

 https://{{base-domain}}/recording/download/{{path-to-file-download}}?access_token={{JWT-token}} 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains recording scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the file. For example: 

 https://{{base-domain}}/rec/archive/download/xxx?access_token={{OAuth-access-token}}. 

**Note:** We recommend that you send the access_token as a Bearer token in the Authorization header, for example: "Authorization": "Bearer <ACCESS_TOKEN>”.

status.description:
The recording file's processing status: 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

recording_type.description:
The type of recording file: 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view(CC) 
* shared_screen_with_speaker_view 
* shared_screen_with_gallery_view 
* gallery_view 
* shared_screen 
* audio_only 
* audio_transcript 
* chat_file 
* active_speaker 
* host_video 
* audio_only_each_participant 
* cc_transcript 
* closed_caption 
* poll 
* timeline 
* thumbnail 
* audio_interpretation 
* summary 
* summary_next_steps 
* summary_smart_chapters 
*production_studio 

For more information, read our [Managing and sharing cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205347605-Managing-and-sharing-cloud-recordings#h_9898497b-e736-4980-a749-d55608f10773) documentation.

participant_audio_files.description: Information about the trashed participant audio files.

recording_start.description: The participant audio file's start time.

recording_end.description: The participant audio file's end time.

file_size.description: The participant audio file's size, in bytes.

play_url.description: The URL at which the participant audio file can be opened and played.

download_url.description:
The URL at which to download the the recording. 

 **JWT apps** 

 To access a private or password-protected cloud recording of a user in your account, use a [Zoom JWT app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-jwt-app). Use the generated JWT token as the value of the access_token query parameter and include this query parameter at the end of the URL. 

 https://{{base-domain}}/recording/download/{{path-to-file-download}}?access_token={{JWT-token}} 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains recording scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the file. For example: 

https://{{base-domain}}/rec/archive/download/xxx?access_token={{OAuth-access-token}} 

 **Note:** This field does **not** return for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). Instead, this API will return the file_path field.

file_path.description:
The file path to the On-Premise account recording. 

 **Note:** This API returns this field for [Zoom On-Premise accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034064852-Zoom-On-Premise-Deployment). It does **not** return the download_url field.

status.description:
The participant audio file's processing status: 
* completed — The processing of the file is complete. 
* processing — The file is processing.

# webinar.updated

The **Webinar has been updated** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users updates a Webinar.

Zoom users with a [Webinar Plan](https://zoom.us/webinar) have access to creating and managing Webinars. [Zoom Video Webinar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200917029-Getting-Started-With-Webinar) allows users to broadcast a Zoom meeting to up to 1000 attendees. A scheduled Webinar can be updated either by the user who created it or by a user with admin privileges.

A user can update a Webinar manually by logging into the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/), navigating to the webinar that needs to be updated from the [Webinars](https://zoom.us/webinar/list) page and clicking on the **Edit this Webinar** button.  Alternatively, users can also use the [**Update a webinar**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/webinarUpdate) API to schedule a Webinar programmatically.

## Prerequisites

* Pro or a higher plan with Webinar license.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
	* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
	* The **Webinar has been updated** subscription enabled under the **Webinar** event.



**Event type**: `webinar.updated`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user who updated the webinar.

operator.description: The email address of the user who updated the webinar.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who updated the webinar.

scope.description:
The type of operation performed: 
* all — The change was applied to all webinars. 
* single — The change was applied only to a single webinar.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

password.description: The password required to join the webinar.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinar with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

status.description:
The webinar occurrence status: 
* available 
* deleted

settings.description: Information about the updated webinar settings. This **only** returns updated webinar settings.

host_video.description: Whether to start the webinar with the host's video on.

panelists_video.description: Whether to turn panelists' video on when they join the webinar.

practice_session.description: Whether to enable the [**Enable Practice Session**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206316975-Webinar-Practice-Session) feature.

approval_type.description:
The [approval type](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204619915-Scheduling-a-webinar-with-registration) for webinar registrants: 
* 0 — Automatically approve registrants. 
* 1 — Manually approve registrants. 
* 2 — Webinar registration not required.

registration_type.description:
The webinar registration setting for recurring webinars: 
* 1 — Attendees register once and can attend any of the webinar occurrences. 
* 2 — Attendees must register for each occurrence to attend. 
* 3 — Attendees register once and can select one or more occurrences to attend.

audio.description:
The available audio options for participants joining the webinar: 
* telephony — Telephony only. 
* voip — VoIP only. 
* both - Both Telephony and VoIP.

auto_recording.description:
The [automatic recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202921119-Automatic-Recording) settings for the webinar: 
* local — Record and save to the local device. 
* cloud — Record and save to the cloud. 
* none — Automatic recording disabled.

enforce_login.description: Whether to only allow signed in users to join the webinar.

meeting_authentication.description: Whether only authenticated users can join the webinar.

authentication_name.description: The authentication name set in the [authentication profile](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037117472).

authentication_domains.description: A list of the allowed authenticated domains.

type.description:
The type of recurring webinar: 
* 1 — Daily. 
* 2 — Weekly. 
* 3 — Monthly.

repeat_interval.description:
The webinar's repeat interval: 
* For daily intervals, a max of 90 days. 
* For a weekly interval, a max of 12 weeks. 
* For monthly intervals, a max of 3 months.

weekly_days.description:
A comma-separated list of the days of the week on which the recurring weekly webinar occurs: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

monthly_day.description: The day of the month on which the recurring monthly webinar occurs. The value ranges from 1 to 31.

monthly_week_day.description:
The day of the week on which the recurring monthly webinar is scheduled: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

end_times.description: The number of times the recurring webinar will occur before it is canceled.

end_date_time.description: The recurring webinar's final ending date and time before it is canceled, in UTC format.

monthly_week.description:
The week of the month on which a recurring webinar occurs: 
* -1 — The last week of the month. 
* 1 — The first week. 
* 2 — The second week. 
* 3 — The third week. 
* 4 — The fourth week.

time_stamp.description: The webinar's update timestamp, in milliseconds.

uuid.description: The webinar's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each webinar instance generates a webinar UUID.

type.description:
The webinar type: 
* 5 — A webinar. 
* 6 — A recurring webinar without a fixed time. 
* 9 — A recurring webinar with a fixed time.

password.description: The password required to join the webinar.

occurrences.description: Information about recurring webinar with fixed times and their occurrences. This only returns when the webinar's type value is 9.

status.description:
The webinar occurrence status: 
* available 
* deleted

settings.description: Information about the updated webinar settings. This **only** returns updated webinar settings.

host_video.description: Whether to start the webinar with the host's video on.

panelists_video.description: Whether to turn panelists' video on when they join the webinar.

practice_session.description: Whether to enable the [**Enable Practice Session**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206316975-Webinar-Practice-Session) feature.

approval_type.description:
The [approval type](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204619915-Scheduling-a-webinar-with-registration) for webinar registrants: 
* 0 — Automatically approve registrants. 
* 1 — Manually approve registrants. 
* 2 — Webinar registration not required.

registration_type.description:
The webinar registration setting for recurring webinars: 
* 1 — Attendees register once and can attend any of the webinar occurrences. 
* 2 — Attendees must register for each occurrence to attend. 
* 3 — Attendees register once and can select one or more occurrences to attend.

audio.description:
The available audio options for participants joining the webinar: 
* telephony — Telephony only. 
* voip — VoIP only. 
* both - Both Telephony and VoIP.

auto_recording.description:
The [automatic recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202921119-Automatic-Recording) settings for the webinar: 
* local — Record and save to the local device. 
* cloud — Record and save to the cloud. 
* none — Automatic recording disabled.

enforce_login.description: Whether to only allow signed in users to join the webinar.

meeting_authentication.description: Whether only authenticated users can join the webinar.

authentication_name.description: The authentication name set in the [authentication profile](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037117472).

authentication_domains.description: A list of the allowed authenticated domains.

type.description:
The type of recurring webinar: 
* 1 — Daily. 
* 2 — Weekly. 
* 3 — Monthly.

repeat_interval.description:
The webinar's repeat interval: 
* For daily intervals, a max of 90 days. 
* For a weekly interval, a max of 12 weeks. 
* For monthly intervals, a max of 3 months.

weekly_days.description:
A comma-separated list of the days of the week on which the recurring weekly webinar occurs: 
* 1 — Sunday 
* 2 — Monday 
* 3 — Tuesday 
* 4 — Wednesday 
* 5 — Thursday 
* 6 — Friday 
* 7 — Saturday

monthly_day.description: The day of the month on which the recurring monthly webinar occurs. The value ranges from 1 to 31.

# recording.batch_recovered

The **Batch recording recovered** event is triggered every time one of your app users or account users recover one or more recordings from the trash.

Zoom allows users to recover their cloud recordings from trash within 30 days of deletion. You can recover a deleted cloud recording via the [**Recordings** tab in the Zoom web client](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/216378863-Recover-a-Deleted-Cloud-Recording) or via the [**Recover meeting recordings**](/api-reference/zoom-api/ma#operation/recordingStatusUpdate) API.

## Prerequisites

* A Pro or a higher plan.
* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Recording files have been recovered in batches from trash** subscription enabled under the **Recording** event.



**Event type**: `recording.batch_recovered`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user that completed the meeting or webinar recording.

operator.description: The email address of the user who recovered the recording.

operator_id.description: The user ID of the user who recovered the recording.

object.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

items.description: Information about the meeting or webinar recording.

meeting_uuid.description: The universally unique identifier (UUID) of the recorded meeting or webinar instance.

recording_file_ids.description: The recording file's unique ID. If the current field value is NULL, it means to recover the whole Meeting Recording files.

# meeting.participant_room_system_callout_rejected

The **Invited party rejected a meeting invitation through phone (call out) via Zoom room** event is triggered every time a user rejects an invitation to [join a meeting through phone (call out) from a Zoom room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205369035).

## Prerequisites

* **Event Subscriptions** must be enabled for your [Marketplace app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/user/build) with the following configurations:
* A valid **Event Notification Endpoint URL**.
* The **Invited party rejected a meeting invitation through phone (call out) via Zoom room** subscription enabled under the **Meeting** event.



**Event type**: `meeting.participant_room_system_callout_rejected`

event_ts.description: A timestamp at which the event occurred.

account_id.description: The account ID of the meeting host.

uuid.description: The meeting's universally unique identifier (UUID). Each meeting instance generates a meeting UUID.

host_id.description: The user ID of the meeting host.

inviter_name.description: The user name of the event's trigger.

call_type.description: The type of call out. Use a value of h323 or sip.
